story:
ABOUT ALEXANDRA ZVI

Hi Indiegogo community. I’m Alexandra, the British fashion designer behind the ethical label ALEXANDRA ZVI​, now based in Melbourne, Australia.

Essentially, I need your help to get my fashion label off the ground, so I can build a brand that strives to release people from exploitation, slavery and poverty.

I officially re-launched ALEXANDRA ZVI​ as an ethical brand in 2017 and have received glowing reviews for my first collection, 'The 5th Avenue'.

THE 5TH AVENUE COLLECTION

The 5th Avenue Collection all started with the fabric. When I first saw that peacock print with all its vibrant colours; I was instantly enticed to buy the whole lot. The vintage floral pattern just spoke to me. When I walked past the contrasting dotted print, I felt that same emotion… and together they created a symphony of colour and print.

My designs developed a parallel relationship with these fabrics. I applied vintage details to create a fashion forward silhouette, which can be seen in this collection of timeless pieces.

Further sourcing found the luscious satin silks, and the extravagant jade, green tartan, which was certain to grab the attention in the board room.

Designing this collection was intrinsic to who I am! The tailored elegance and glamour of Lauren Bacall certainly influenced this collection. I hope when women wear ALEXANDRA ZVI, they will feel invincibly ready to be whoever they choose to be.

This collection is chic and modern with a hint of 1940s sophistication.  It screams 'REGAL' and is compared to some top Australian brands such as Leona Edmiston, Kookai, Cue and Witchery.

MY VISION

I have a passion for designing the most classic, comfortable clothing possible and delivering them with a modern twist. Everything that my label, ALEXANDRA ZVI, makes is ethical and to the best of my abilities.

With over 20 years in the fashion industry, I founded ALEXANDRA ZVI in 2012. I had a simple vision to design womenswear with a mission to create a classic, fashion forward label that attracts customers seeking quality and timeless pieces. However, it wasn't until 2017 when I decided to take my label to the next level, after watching a video by STOP THE TRAFFIK on YouTube. It was about the Southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu, which produces most of the world's cotton knit fabrics. This is when I discovered that there are more than 300,000 young women trapped in the Sumangali labour scheme. I began to sob uncontrollably, as I learnt about girls as young as 11 being lured with the false promise of a lump sum payment, used as dowry. I was heartbroken to discover that the families, who are usually from poor and rural villages, agree to this believing that their daughter's virtue will be protected, but sadly they are at risk of being sexually abused and not being paid! 

HOW 'HUMAN TRAFFICKING' CHANGED MY MISSION

Trafficking and the enslavement of women and children is a horrendous problem worldwide. In India, there are many ways that children and young women are caught by traffickers. A child may simply be snatched off the streets, pushed into a van and driven to a distant city where she is sold.

Out of a feeling of responsibility for the damage caused by the fashion industry (specifically fast fashion) to these people, I changed my core values instantly. I wanted to raise awareness of the crime of 'modern slavery', which has become a catch-all term to describe human trafficking, forced labour, debt bondage, sex trafficking, forced marriage and other slave-like exploitation.

With nearly 46 million people around the world living as slaves, forced to work
in factories, mines and farms, sold for sex, trapped in debt bondage or born
into servitude (according to the 2016 Global Slavery Index by rights group
Walk Free Foundation), I decided to build a fair and ethical culture in the fashion industry and make this social change through ALEXANDRA ZVI. It has become my life's purpose to find new ways to improve consumer’s response to ethical fashion, so my aesthetic shifted from costume to ‘wearable’ fashion just so I could manufacture ethically and make a difference.

Later, I partnered with J.D. Nelson, a creative marketing specialist, who also feels passionate about improving the lives of these people, and together we re-branded the entire label and launched the Fifth Avenue collection. Our focus was to build brand awareness to help the label grow, and support the cause of ethical fashion.

MY PERSONAL GOALS

Today, my main objective is to attract fashion consumers to shop ethically at ALEXANDRA ZVI’s online store (www.AlexandraZvi.com), with 10% of the profits donated to STOP THE TRAFFIK (www.stopthetraffik.com.au), an organization whose mission is to prevent, disrupt and abolish human trafficking and modern slavery.

As a fashion designer, I'm committed to crafting timeless designs, but as a human rights advocate, I am devoted to show the world my compassion for those who make my beautiful clothes. It is my duty to speak up and encourage consumers to shop socially responsible and environmentally friendly styles, rather than fast and cheap fashion.

Through my fashion label, I hope to make a difference within the fashion industry. My calling is to stop the human trafficking and the modern slavery which still exist today in manufacturing clothing.

We are far from the day when a consumer can purchase an item of clothing with total confidence that it’s free of slavery from thread to store shelf. We are far from the systematic change needed to eliminate slavery, however there's been some increase in awareness, following the work of media outlets such as 'the Guardian'.

NEW YORK FASHION WEEK 2019

In early 2018, ALEXANDRA ZVI’s new and improved Instagram profile was noticed by Planet Fashion TV, who later formally invited ALEXANDRA ZVI to show at their New York Fashion Week show in February 2019. With the label’s limited funds, it has been challenging to design and manufacture a new collection for New York Fashion Week.

In 2012, the financial impact of New York's Fashion Week (held in February and September) was a net of approximately $466 million in direct visitor spending leading to a further $773 million in economic impact.

With a dream to step onto such a prestigious international platform, I hope to use this opportunity to not only push the fashion label, but to also shine a light on human trafficking and the modern slavery. 

I hope that this crowdfunding campaign will contribute to manufacturing my next collection and my vision to make a significant impact within the fashion industry.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

So to help us create and manufacture our next collection, we need finances for the manufacturing processes with an ethical manufacturing factory, which will enable us to have some stock for our online store and boutiques across the world.

To produce this collection 100% ethically, we will need a minimum of $55,000. In addition, to produce our next collection in time for New York Fashion Week in February 2019, we will need a further $50,000+.

In addition, the money raised will also contribute to the following ongoing costs:

  • Social Media Campaigns - including Instagram/Facebook advertising ($1,500+ per month)
  • Website re-build and maintenance of online store ($5,000+)
  • SEO ($600+ per month)
  • Photoshoots ($5,000+)
  • Marketing ($10,000+)
  • Other paid advertising campaigns to raise awareness about 'ethical fashion' ($2,000+)
  • Public Relations ($5,000+ per month)
  • Packaging and presentation ($1,500+)
  • NYFW including flights and accommodation ($15,000+)
  • Other business related costs including legal fees, copyrights and patents, administration, staff etc. ($10,000+)

To help us get there, we want to give back to you! 

For contributions over:

$200 - you will receive our THANK YOU Bundle 1

  • 1x ALEXANDRA ZVI INTRINSIC t-shirt
  • 1x shoutout on Facebook

$400 - you will receive our THANK YOU Bundle 2

  • 1x ALEXANDRA ZVI INTRINSIC t-shirt
  • 1x shoutout on Facebook
  • 1x personal letter of gratitude

$1,000 - you will receive our THANK YOU Bundle 3

  • 2x ALEXANDRA ZVI INTRINSIC t-shirts
  • 1x shoutout on Facebook
  • 1x specific Instagram mention/post 
  • 1x personal letter of gratitude

$2,500 - you will receive our THANK YOU Bundle 4

  • 5x ALEXANDRA ZVI INTRINSIC t-shirts
  • 1x shoutout on Facebook
  • 1x specific Instagram mention/post using a brand recognition video 
  • 1x personal letter of gratitude

$5,000 - you will receive our THANK YOU Bundle 5

  • 10x ALEXANDRA ZVI INTRINSIC t-shirts
  • 2x shoutout on Facebook
  • 3x specific Instagram mention/post using a brand recognition video incorporating NYFW
  • a personal letter of gratitude

By supporting ALEXANDRA ZVI, you are supporting an organisation and giving us the opportunity to free someone from exploitation. Our label will not only donate to STOP THE TRAFFIK, but we will support and employ those manufactures who source their labour ethically. This will also help ALEXANDRA ZVI lower our prices, so our collection becomes more affordable for women worldwide.

If I don't reach my entire goal, I will try again. I will also look for investors to financially back me. I plan to pitch to department stores in UK, Australia and USA to stock my collection! This would be a huge achievement and I know whole-heartedly that this would make a significant difference and the beginning of social change.

THE IMPACT

The textile and fashion industry plays a major role all over the world and is considered to be the second most polluting industry worldwide because it causes negative impacts on people.

Your generous contribution would help me attract fashion consumers and encourage them to shop ethically at ALEXANDRA ZVI's online store with 10% of profits donated to STOP THE TRAFFIK (www.stopthetraffik.com.au). This would positively change and impact the fashion industry and would help build awareness about the crime of human trafficking.

No matter where we live, this problem exists everywhere around the world. As compassionate human beings, we must stand together and advocate for those who are victims of modern slavery. It's our responsibility to change this current system and to make a positive impact on our world.

Your contribution will help STOP THE TRAFFIK prevent, disrupt and abolish human trafficking and modern slavery.

Join over 2,000,000 people who've taken action to fight against modern slavery. You can make a difference under 30 seconds.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The risks and obstacles that I will face trying to make a difference could fill the full page. 

Since running a fashion business "ethically" can be an expensive business to run, this means that I will continue to struggle financially. Since I don't have millions of dollars to achieve this mission, I will face challenges with lack of resources to produce and to market the label so that it is an internationally recognized brand. 

Most likely, I will continue to struggle with attracting consumers who want to shop socially responsibly and who are aware of this global issue. This means that I will need to work even harder and be more creative than other designers just to design clothes that break the stigma around "ethical" fashion being 'unfashionable' and unappealing. 

Because the whole fashion industry is accused of paying low wages, it is challenging finding a reputable 'ethical' manufacturer who won't send me broke, but I am determined to find the perfect manufacturer for ALEXANDRA ZVI.

Although there are methods such as codes of conduct and inspections in place; somehow fashion retailers have failed to pay a living wage to workers, have accepted child labour, have misused human rights and asserted minimum labour standards in the workplace. This may have even happened when factories have claimed to produce "ethically" but failed to do so. But I want to overcome these hurdles by choosing the right factory that abides fair trade practices, so I am currently discussing with STOP THE TRAFFIK to find suitable manufactures in India. Even if I have to physically visit these factories and meet the workers, I want to ensure that the people who are producing for ALEXANDRA ZVI are well rewarded and living a great life.

The statistics of trafficking are overwhelming. According to www.worldschildren.org, estimates vary of the number of slaves in the world today. On the low end, the U.S. State Department estimates that as many as 27 million people are living in bondage, however the 2016 Global Slavery Index estimates that there are 46 million enslaved people worldwide with 40 percent being in India.

Although I have some significant obstacles to get past, there is a bigger risk of saying and doing nothing!  This problem will not only continue to exist, but it may continue to grow.

I want to be part of a fashion industry that has put humanity and profit on equal footing. I need to see humanity in the fashion industry, therefore, I plan to tackle one problem at a time - piece by piece. I'll continue to strategize, research and design, until my plan is fail-proof. Without a doubt, I will fail in many ways but I learn from my mistakes. I will pick myself up and try again! I will listen to feedback and tweak things until I get it right. 

In a nutshell, I will not stop until I make a difference.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Firstly, I want to say thank you for reading this and giving me a moment of your time.

I understand that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

If my message has struck a nerve with you, then I want to empower you to advocate for change, and equality. Together, we can make a difference to humanity, especially to the communities targeted for human trafficking,

Please spread the word and tell a friend about it.

Help me educate consumers and build awareness of the power of slow fashion and ethical fashion (such as Stella McCartney) which is increasing every day, even if it's happening slowly.

Let's start the conversation! We need to make some noise!

Use your voice in whichever way you want! Post on social media and share this Indiegogo campaign by using the share tools!

Again, thank you for helping me design a better world.
story_txt:
ABOUT ALEXANDRA ZVIHi Indiegogo community. I’m Alexandra, the British fashion designer behind the ethical label ALEXANDRA ZVI​, now based in Melbourne, Australia.Essentially, I need your help to get my fashion label off the ground, so I can build a brand that strives to release people from exploitation, slavery and poverty.I officially re-launched ALEXANDRA ZVI​ as an ethical brand in 2017 and have received glowing reviews for my first collection, 'The 5th Avenue'.THE 5TH AVENUE COLLECTIONThe 5th Avenue Collection all started with the fabric. When I first saw that peacock print with all its vibrant colours; I was instantly enticed to buy the whole lot. The vintage floral pattern just spoke to me. When I walked past the contrasting dotted print, I felt that same emotion… and together they created a symphony of colour and print.My designs developed a parallel relationship with these fabrics. I applied vintage details to create a fashion forward silhouette, which can be seen in this collection of timeless pieces.Further sourcing found the luscious satin silks, and the extravagant jade, green tartan, which was certain to grab the attention in the board room.Designing this collection was intrinsic to who I am! The tailored elegance and glamour of Lauren Bacall certainly influenced this collection. I hope when women wear ALEXANDRA ZVI, they will feel invincibly ready to be whoever they choose to be.This collection is chic and modern with a hint of 1940s sophistication.  It screams 'REGAL' and is compared to some top Australian brands such as Leona Edmiston, Kookai, Cue and Witchery.MY VISIONI have a passion for designing the most classic, comfortable clothing possible and delivering them with a modern twist. Everything that my label, ALEXANDRA ZVI, makes is ethical and to the best of my abilities.With over 20 years in the fashion industry, I founded ALEXANDRA ZVI in 2012. I had a simple vision to design womenswear with a mission to create a classic, fashion forward label that attracts customers seeking quality and timeless pieces. However, it wasn't until 2017 when I decided to take my label to the next level, after watching a video by STOP THE TRAFFIK on YouTube. It was about the Southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu, which produces most of the world's cotton knit fabrics. This is when I discovered that there are more than 300,000 young women trapped in the Sumangali labour scheme. I began to sob uncontrollably, as I learnt about girls as young as 11 being lured with the false promise of a lump sum payment, used as dowry. I was heartbroken to discover that the families, who are usually from poor and rural villages, agree to this believing that their daughter's virtue will be protected, but sadly they are at risk of being sexually abused and not being paid! HOW 'HUMAN TRAFFICKING' CHANGED MY MISSIONTrafficking and the enslavement of women and children is a horrendous problem worldwide. In India, there are many ways that children and young women are caught by traffickers. A child may simply be snatched off the streets, pushed into a van and driven to a distant city where she is sold.Out of a feeling of responsibility for the damage caused by the fashion industry (specifically fast fashion) to these people, I changed my core values instantly. I wanted to raise awareness of the crime of 'modern slavery', which has become a catch-all term to describe human trafficking, forced labour, debt bondage, sex trafficking, forced marriage and other slave-like exploitation.With nearly 46 million people around the world living as slaves, forced to workin factories, mines and farms, sold for sex, trapped in debt bondage or borninto servitude (according to the 2016 Global Slavery Index by rights groupWalk Free Foundation), I decided to build a fair and ethical culture in the fashion industry and make this social change through ALEXANDRA ZVI. It has become my life's purpose to find new ways to improve consumer’s response to ethical fashion, so my aesthetic shifted from costume to ‘wearable’ fashion just so I could manufacture ethically and make a difference.Later, I partnered with J.D. Nelson, a creative marketing specialist, who also feels passionate about improving the lives of these people, and together we re-branded the entire label and launched the Fifth Avenue collection. Our focus was to build brand awareness to help the label grow, and support the cause of ethical fashion.MY PERSONAL GOALSToday, my main objective is to attract fashion consumers to shop ethically at ALEXANDRA ZVI’s online store (www.AlexandraZvi.com), with 10% of the profits donated to STOP THE TRAFFIK (www.stopthetraffik.com.au), an organization whose mission is to prevent, disrupt and abolish human trafficking and modern slavery.As a fashion designer, I'm committed to crafting timeless designs, but as a human rights advocate, I am devoted to show the world my compassion for those who make my beautiful clothes. It is my duty to speak up and encourage consumers to shop socially responsible and environmentally friendly styles, rather than fast and cheap fashion.Through my fashion label, I hope to make a difference within the fashion industry. My calling is to stop the human trafficking and the modern slavery which still exist today in manufacturing clothing.We are far from the day when a consumer can purchase an item of clothing with total confidence that it’s free of slavery from thread to store shelf. We are far from the systematic change needed to eliminate slavery, however there's been some increase in awareness, following the work of media outlets such as 'the Guardian'.NEW YORK FASHION WEEK 2019In early 2018, ALEXANDRA ZVI’s new and improved Instagram profile was noticed by Planet Fashion TV, who later formally invited ALEXANDRA ZVI to show at their New York Fashion Week show in February 2019. With the label’s limited funds, it has been challenging to design and manufacture a new collection for New York Fashion Week.In 2012, the financial impact of New York's Fashion Week (held in February and September) was a net of approximately $466 million in direct visitor spending leading to a further $773 million in economic impact.With a dream to step onto such a prestigious international platform, I hope to use this opportunity to not only push the fashion label, but to also shine a light on human trafficking and the modern slavery. I hope that this crowdfunding campaign will contribute to manufacturing my next collection and my vision to make a significant impact within the fashion industry.WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GETSo to help us create and manufacture our next collection, we need finances for the manufacturing processes with an ethical manufacturing factory, which will enable us to have some stock for our online store and boutiques across the world.To produce this collection 100% ethically, we will need a minimum of $55,000. In addition, to produce our next collection in time for New York Fashion Week in February 2019, we will need a further $50,000+.In addition, the money raised will also contribute to the following ongoing costs:
Social Media Campaigns - including Instagram/Facebook advertising ($1,500+ per month)
Website re-build and maintenance of online store ($5,000+)
SEO ($600+ per month)
Photoshoots ($5,000+)
Marketing ($10,000+)
Other paid advertising campaigns to raise awareness about 'ethical fashion' ($2,000+)
Public Relations ($5,000+ per month)
Packaging and presentation ($1,500+)
NYFW including flights and accommodation ($15,000+)
Other business related costs including legal fees, copyrights and patents, administration, staff etc. ($10,000+)
To help us get there, we want to give back to you! For contributions over:$200 - you will receive our THANK YOU Bundle 1
1x ALEXANDRA ZVI INTRINSIC t-shirt
1x shoutout on Facebook
$400 - you will receive our THANK YOU Bundle 2
1x ALEXANDRA ZVI INTRINSIC t-shirt
1x shoutout on Facebook
1x personal letter of gratitude
$1,000 - you will receive our THANK YOU Bundle 3
2x ALEXANDRA ZVI INTRINSIC t-shirts
1x shoutout on Facebook
1x specific Instagram mention/post 
1x personal letter of gratitude
$2,500 - you will receive our THANK YOU Bundle 4
5x ALEXANDRA ZVI INTRINSIC t-shirts
1x shoutout on Facebook
1x specific Instagram mention/post using a brand recognition video 
1x personal letter of gratitude
$5,000 - you will receive our THANK YOU Bundle 5
10x ALEXANDRA ZVI INTRINSIC t-shirts
2x shoutout on Facebook
3x specific Instagram mention/post using a brand recognition video incorporating NYFW
a personal letter of gratitude
By supporting ALEXANDRA ZVI, you are supporting an organisation and giving us the opportunity to free someone from exploitation. Our label will not only donate to STOP THE TRAFFIK, but we will support and employ those manufactures who source their labour ethically. This will also help ALEXANDRA ZVI lower our prices, so our collection becomes more affordable for women worldwide.If I don't reach my entire goal, I will try again. I will also look for investors to financially back me. I plan to pitch to department stores in UK, Australia and USA to stock my collection! This would be a huge achievement and I know whole-heartedly that this would make a significant difference and the beginning of social change.THE IMPACTThe textile and fashion industry plays a major role all over the world and is considered to be the second most polluting industry worldwide because it causes negative impacts on people.Your generous contribution would help me attract fashion consumers and encourage them to shop ethically at ALEXANDRA ZVI's online store with 10% of profits donated to STOP THE TRAFFIK (www.stopthetraffik.com.au). This would positively change and impact the fashion industry and would help build awareness about the crime of human trafficking.No matter where we live, this problem exists everywhere around the world. As compassionate human beings, we must stand together and advocate for those who are victims of modern slavery. It's our responsibility to change this current system and to make a positive impact on our world.Your contribution will help STOP THE TRAFFIK prevent, disrupt and abolish human trafficking and modern slavery.Join over 2,000,000 people who've taken action to fight against modern slavery. You can make a difference under 30 seconds.RISKS AND CHALLENGESThe risks and obstacles that I will face trying to make a difference could fill the full page. Since running a fashion business "ethically" can be an expensive business to run, this means that I will continue to struggle financially. Since I don't have millions of dollars to achieve this mission, I will face challenges with lack of resources to produce and to market the label so that it is an internationally recognized brand. Most likely, I will continue to struggle with attracting consumers who want to shop socially responsibly and who are aware of this global issue. This means that I will need to work even harder and be more creative than other designers just to design clothes that break the stigma around "ethical" fashion being 'unfashionable' and unappealing. Because the whole fashion industry is accused of paying low wages, it is challenging finding a reputable 'ethical' manufacturer who won't send me broke, but I am determined to find the perfect manufacturer for ALEXANDRA ZVI.Although there are methods such as codes of conduct and inspections in place; somehow fashion retailers have failed to pay a living wage to workers, have accepted child labour, have misused human rights and asserted minimum labour standards in the workplace. This may have even happened when factories have claimed to produce "ethically" but failed to do so. But I want to overcome these hurdles by choosing the right factory that abides fair trade practices, so I am currently discussing with STOP THE TRAFFIK to find suitable manufactures in India. Even if I have to physically visit these factories and meet the workers, I want to ensure that the people who are producing for ALEXANDRA ZVI are well rewarded and living a great life.The statistics of trafficking are overwhelming. According to www.worldschildren.org, estimates vary of the number of slaves in the world today. On the low end, the U.S. State Department estimates that as many as 27 million people are living in bondage, however the 2016 Global Slavery Index estimates that there are 46 million enslaved people worldwide with 40 percent being in India.Although I have some significant obstacles to get past, there is a bigger risk of saying and doing nothing!  This problem will not only continue to exist, but it may continue to grow.I want to be part of a fashion industry that has put humanity and profit on equal footing. I need to see humanity in the fashion industry, therefore, I plan to tackle one problem at a time - piece by piece. I'll continue to strategize, research and design, until my plan is fail-proof. Without a doubt, I will fail in many ways but I learn from my mistakes. I will pick myself up and try again! I will listen to feedback and tweak things until I get it right. In a nutshell, I will not stop until I make a difference.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPFirstly, I want to say thank you for reading this and giving me a moment of your time.I understand that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!If my message has struck a nerve with you, then I want to empower you to advocate for change, and equality. Together, we can make a difference to humanity, especially to the communities targeted for human trafficking,Please spread the word and tell a friend about it.Help me educate consumers and build awareness of the power of slow fashion and ethical fashion (such as Stella McCartney) which is increasing every day, even if it's happening slowly.Let's start the conversation! We need to make some noise!Use your voice in whichever way you want! Post on social media and share this Indiegogo campaign by using the share tools!Again, thank you for helping me design a better world.

story:
AKRIVEIA Viking Hybrid for iOS & Android.

All that you would want in a luxurious, hybrid smartwatch with a fully functional interface. Made of the highest-quality materials and craftmanship, the Viking Hybrid is sure to turn heads while scuba diving or at the club.

The Akriveia Viking Hybrid is a revolutionary smartwatch which pairs innovative application-design features with a mechanical device. Our campaign is built around being able to take Akriveia to the next level. After 10 test prototypes we have a final prototype that is ready for production on a mass scale.

 

Watch Design Process:

Our contributors will help us be able to manufacture our new, patented devices on a greater scale which allows us to reach the end-users around the world.

Featured in:

Please Share

 Sharing greatly helps our Indiegogo succeed and allows us to spend more time and money into delivering Akriveia Viking smartwatches to you instead of marketing.

 

About

My name is Todd Johnsen and I'm the Co-Founder and CEO of Akriveia OÜ. I come from a background in IT, working in in both application support and also coding. From my years in this industry, I've not only been an employee, but also a lifelong student. By studying at some of the top schools like Harvard and MIT, I've been able to combine both theoretical classroom knowledge with real-world experience.

The Akriveia Viking Hybrid is a revolutionary smartwatch which pairs innovative application-design features with a mechanical device. Our campaign is built around being able to take Akriveia to the next level. We already have a prototype that is ready for production so at this point we are seeking to raise the funds necessary to realize this project on a greater-scale for the mass market.

Our contributors will help us be able to manufacture our new, patented devices on a greater scale which allows us to reach the end-users around the world.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to get going, we seek to raise about $20,000 USD. The bulk of this will be used in manufacturing these devices. About ten percent will be used to cover operations' costs.

 

Features:

 

Traditional Mechanical Hands

 

17 Unique Parts

The watch is made up of 17 unique parts, which combines the physical pointer with the full touch screen. 

 

Customization of Watch Dial

 

Customized/Removable Watch Bands

 

Luxury Watch Holder

 

High Grade Titanium Charging Cord

 

Award Winning Mobile Application

 

 

Sports Monitoring

Records and displays your daily, weekly and monthly activities. The information is automatically transferred over to the mobile application.

  • Steps
  • Calories
  • Distance
  • Activity Time

 

Heart Rate monitoring

Record and display your daily, weekly and monthly heart rate data. And the heart rate alarm can be set to max and min so that you can more easily understand the heart rate changes in time. Precisely monitor your cardiac frequency while exercising or at rest.

  • Static heart rate monitoring

  • Dynamic heart rate monitoring

 

Sleep monitoring

Records and displays awake times, light sleep and deep sleep. 

Akriveia Viking tracks when you fall asleep, wake up, and how much sleep you are getting. Smart alarm determines your optimal wake-up time based on your sleep cycle, so you are less groggy and more energized to tackle the day.

 

Notifications

Gives notifications for call reminders, emails, social media information, message alerts and readability.You can customize event alerts

 

Personalized Profile:

Akriveia Viking users can track their steps, fitness and calorie burs with reminders to move when they’ve been sedentary for too long. Akriveia Viking also automatically tracks quality of sleep when the watch is worn in bed. 

 

Share Your Most Recent Gains With Family & Friends

One of the best features of the Akriveia Viking is the activity/sharing function. This app keeps track of your exercise/activity that you accumulate throughout the day,  which you can then share with others to see how your friends around you are doing and they can see how you are doing.

 

Steps & Kilometers Walked Today:

 

Track your full day's: steps, distance, stairs climbed, and calories burned with a few simple steps. 

 

Power Consumption:

Graph shows 24 hours of usage. Akriveia Viking revolutionary digital chipset uses ultra-low power consumption, maximizing the battery life.

 

Akriveia Viking In Action:

 

 

 

A video demo highlighting: TFT/LTD analog display, software display (operating system), vibration mode, and heart rate sensor + other watch sensors on back of watch.

 

 

A video demo highlighting notification menu for smartwatch (e.g. message menu), and temperature + step rate notifications. 

 

 

Rewards

If you decide to become a backer, you will receive an Akriveia Viking smartwatch device and we'll ship to anywhere in the world! We will also cover the shipping costs.

 

Reminders

Provides reminders of goals, full memory, low power and high and low heart rate. 

 

Weather Report

Gives current and weekly weather.

 

Other Features

Remote music control, Find-your-phone, Raise your hands to turn on the screen and turn off by the opposite direction, Stopwatch and Timer. 

 

Fixed-Funding

We use a fixed-funding format which means its minimal risk for you as a potential backer. You will not be charged unless our campaign reaches our goal.

 

The Impact

Our Viking hybrid smartwatch has the chance to disrupt the wearable technology market in that it provides both value and quality. The smartwatch technology market is still in a late infancy stage so there will continue to be new players who have a competitive advantage to offer, but are not yet household names. We are offering a device that is able to perform the necessity, daily functions as well as serve as a fashionable timepiece.

 

Risks & Challenges

The primary obstacle we have now are capital constraints. We want to provide the best quality possible, but at the same time, need to operate in a sustainable manner. Research and development requires a great amount of time and money and so this is a hurdle that requires us to scale in the marketplace. By producing units on a larger scale we will be able to reduce our manufacturing expenditures. Additionally, our sole venue of sales is online which allows us to operate on a much lower budget than most of the major outfits. By continuing to focus on business-to-customer sales we can maintain substantially lower fixed costs. 

 

Mobile App In Action:

 

Easy and Painless Sign-Up Menu:

 

 

Calories/Step Tracker:

 

Personalized Reminder Panel:

 

Simple Mobile App Functions

 

Customize Your Settings

 

 

Viking Size Dimension Chart

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it

 

 

Recent Testimonials

 

"I love smart technology and I also love good watches. I've been let down by terrible battery life in the smartwatches I have owned so far. To have a watch with a decent battery life makes all the difference when traveling as I often don't have any ability to charge my devices."
 -Zayan Hammad

 

"The akriveia Viking is the first of its kind watch that contains both an elegant look, while also  having great functionality that people actually use. The mobile app for many smartwatch devices is not user friendly and difficult to navigate, but this mobile app is simple and easy to use for all types of people."

-Bill Stein 

 

"I love the look of classic analog watches but would find the extra digital capabilities extremely useful without having to charge it every day. Finally the smartwatch that takes care of everything! Everything about the features that excite me. Being a seasoned traveler, a must-have watch for my travel schedule also!"
            -miguel ortiz

 

"This looks like a much better idea than a "smartwatch" that just duplicates my phone and needs constant recharging. This watch packs both great software and hardware into a seamless design, along with a cool mobile app. Lastly, the Akriveia Viking is sleek, but does not have a typical smartwatch look."
             -Sebastian Olssen

 

 

Team & Manufacturing:

Akriveia is an international collaboration with team members in: Chicago, New York, Estonia, Istanbul, Madrid, Beijing, and Zurich. Our team has designed and manufactured high-end watches and smartwatches for some of the biggest watch brands in in U.S. and Europe. We know the challenges and requirements for manufacturing and shipping watches at scale. 

Akriveia has already started the first manufacturing batch for quality assurance. The Android and iOS app is 100% complete. Both are ready for your pleasure when Akriveia Viking ships in April. 

Please do not hesitate to send us a message if you have any questions or comments.

 

 

Akriveia Team Members:

 

Tyler: Co-Founder/Marketing/App Development

 

Todd: Co-Founder/Software-Hardware Design

 

 

Hamed: Videography/Visual Effects

 

 

Mary: PR/Social Media Marketing/Communication

 

 

 

Eva: Photography

 

Kristina: International Consultant/Website Development

 

Maria: Digital Marketing/Sales

 

 

Risks and challenges

We and our manufacturing partners have years of experience in the industry! We are aware our project is complex and that there are always unforeseen issues, but we have anticipated and planned for potential risks and have built a rock-solid production and delivery plan.

Firstly, our production is quite advanced and you can be very confident about our capacity to provide high-quality products on time. We spent over 2 years designing, developing, and testing finalized samples.

Secondly, we have very skillful and professional suppliers and do not anticipate delays to our shipping timeline. However, if by chance anything unexpected happens, we promise to keep you informed, both during the campaign and afterward. We also back all our watches with a 1 year warranty and satisfaction guarantee.

Thanks for all the support! We are excited to take this next step with you, the Kickstarter community!

 

 

Specifications:

 

System support: Android 4.3 or iOS 8，Bluetooth 4.0
 

Display screen: TFT，1.22"，240*240，space full touch
 

Overall dimensions: Face shell: glass; Case: stainless steel; Back cover: plastic; Band: TPU
 

Acceleration sensor: 3 axis
 

Bluetooth: BLE 4.0
 

Battery: 200mAh
 

Standby time: Bright screen using for 3 days, pointer to standby 30 days
 

Time display: Support (RTC + time synchronization)
 

Button: Two buttons
 

Charging way: USB wireless charger
 

Waterproof degree: 3ATM（30m waterproof)
 

Upgrade way: OTA

 

Viking Functionality Overview:

Mobile App In Action:

Easy and Painless Sign-Up Menu:

 

 

 

Award Winning Mobile Application

Features Overview: 

 

Who we are and what we seek to do? 

Our Viking hybrid smartwatch has the chance to disrupt the wearable technology market in that it provides both value and quality. The smartwatch technology market is still in a late infancy stage so there will continue to be new players who have a competitive advantage to offer, but are not yet household names. We are offering a device that is able to perform the necessity, daily functions as well as serve as a fashionable timepiece. 

Risks & Challenges

The primary obstacle we have now are capital constraints. We want to provide the best quality possible, but at the same time, need to operate in a sustainable manner. Research and development requires a great amount of time and money and so this is a hurdle that requires us to scale in the marketplace. By producing units on a larger scale we will be able to reduce our manufacturing expenditures. Additionally, our sole venue of sales is online which allows us to operate on a much lower budget than most of the major outfits. By continuing to focus on business-to-customer sales we can maintain substantially lower fixed costs. 

Specifications 

System support: Android 4.3 or iOS 8，Bluetooth 4.0

Display screen: TFT，1.22"，240*240，space full touch

Overall dimensions: Face shell: glass; Case: stainless steel; Back cover: plastic; Band: TPU

Acceleration sensor: 3 axis

Bluetooth: BLE 4.0

Battery: 200mAh

Standby time: Bright screen using for 3 days, pointer to standby 30 days

Time display: Support (RTC + time synchronization)

Button: Two buttons

Charging way: USB wireless charger

Waterproof degree: 3ATM（30m waterproof)

Upgrade way: OTA

The primary obstacle we have now are capital constraints. We want to provide the best quality possible, but at the same time, need to operate in a sustainable manner. Research and development requires a great amount of time and money and so this is a hurdle that requires us to scale in the marketplace. By producing units on a larger scale we will be able to reduce our manufacturing expenditures. Additionally, our sole venue of sales is online which allows us to operate on a much lower budget than most of the major outfits. By continuing to focus on business-to-customer sales we can maintain substantially lower fixed costs. 
 
Mobile App In Action:
 
Easy and Painless Sign-Up Menu:
 
 
Calories/Step Tracker:

 
Personalized Reminder Panel:

 
Simple Mobile App Functions

 
Customize Your Settings

 
 
Viking Size Dimension Chart


 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it
 
 
Recent Testimonials
 
"I love smart technology and I also love good watches. I've been let down by terrible battery life in the smartwatches I have owned so far. To have a watch with a decent battery life makes all the difference when traveling as I often don't have any ability to charge my devices." -Zayan Hammad
 
"The akriveia Viking is the first of its kind watch that contains both an elegant look, while also  having great functionality that people actually use. The mobile app for many smartwatch devices is not user friendly and difficult to navigate, but this mobile app is simple and easy to use for all types of people."
-Bill Stein 
 
"I love the look of classic analog watches but would find the extra digital capabilities extremely useful without having to charge it every day. Finally the smartwatch that takes care of everything! Everything about the features that excite me. Being a seasoned traveler, a must-have watch for my travel schedule also!"            -miguel ortiz
 
"This looks like a much better idea than a "smartwatch" that just duplicates my phone and needs constant recharging. This watch packs both great software and hardware into a seamless design, along with a cool mobile app. Lastly, the Akriveia Viking is sleek, but does not have a typical smartwatch look."             -Sebastian Olssen
 
 
Team & Manufacturing:
Akriveia is an international collaboration with team members in: Chicago, New York, Estonia, Istanbul, Madrid, Beijing, and Zurich. Our team has designed and manufactured high-end watches and smartwatches for some of the biggest watch brands in in U.S. and Europe. We know the challenges and requirements for manufacturing and shipping watches at scale. 
Akriveia has already started the first manufacturing batch for quality assurance. The Android and iOS app is 100% complete. Both are ready for your pleasure when Akriveia Viking ships in April. 
Please do not hesitate to send us a message if you have any questions or comments.
 
 
Akriveia Team Members:
 
Tyler: Co-Founder/Marketing/App Development

 
Todd: Co-Founder/Software-Hardware Design

 
 
Hamed: Videography/Visual Effects
 
 
Mary: PR/Social Media Marketing/Communication
 
 
 
Eva: Photography

 
Kristina: International Consultant/Website Development

 
Maria: Digital Marketing/Sales

 
 
Risks and challenges
We and our manufacturing partners have years of experience in the industry! We are aware our project is complex and that there are always unforeseen issues, but we have anticipated and planned for potential risks and have built a rock-solid production and delivery plan.
Firstly, our production is quite advanced and you can be very confident about our capacity to provide high-quality products on time. We spent over 2 years designing, developing, and testing finalized samples.
Secondly, we have very skillful and professional suppliers and do not anticipate delays to our shipping timeline. However, if by chance anything unexpected happens, we promise to keep you informed, both during the campaign and afterward. We also back all our watches with a 1 year warranty and satisfaction guarantee.
Thanks for all the support! We are excited to take this next step with you, the Kickstarter community!

Our Viking hybrid smartwatch has the chance to disrupt the wearable technology market in that it provides both value and quality. The smartwatch technology market is still in a late infancy stage so there will continue to be new players who have a competitive advantage to offer, but are not yet household names. We are offering a device that is able to perform the necessity, daily functions as well as serve as a fashionable timepiece.

Research and development requires a great amount of time and money and so this is a hurdle that requires us to scale in the marketplace. By producing units on a larger scale we will be able to reduce our manufacturing expenditures. Additionally, our sole venue of sales is online which allows us to operate on a much lower budget than most of the major outfits. story:
Recycled never looked so good!

Moonchild Yoga Wear is a one-woman owned company founded in Aarhus, Denmark. We are now taking a new step in our journey with the Lunar Luxe recycled leggings and you have a chance to be an important part of this! 

  • Designed with the softest recycled bluesign® certified fabric.
  • Moonchild's mission is to empower women and we work with charity organisations to give back to women who need it the most so they can learn to start their own business and take care of themselves and their family in a long-term and sustainable way.
  • By supporting our project you will help make this journey a reality and give us the opportunity to do good through our eco-friendly product and by supporting women for a better future.

This campaign is all about women supporting women! With your contribution you will get soft, recycled yoga wear that will make you feel great and you will help empower women all around the world.

What We Need & What You Get

So why should you get excited about this?

  • We are looking to raise €30.000 for this campaign so that we can develop and introduce a new and more sustainable material to the yoga wear industry.
  • We need enough pre-orders for us the reach the minimum order quantity at our manufacturing partners. If you help us fund our first production of the Lunar Luxe Recycled Leggings you will be the first to try this new generation of yoga wear.
  • We need you to help us empower women and produce yoga wear that can create good all around the world.
  • You will get exclusive first access to the new Lunar Luxe recycled leggings at an amazing rate.

The Impact

So why do we ask you to join us?

  • Moonchild is still a small start-up company with 1 full time employee (Me - Louise - founder & owner) and 3 student workers helping out part-time. To develop and start production of new styles we need support and this is where you play an important part.
  • We have a mission to develop more recycled and sustainable products in the future and we ask you for your help on this journey.
  • We don't see you as a customer but as a part of our community. We have developed an online community for women, passionate about yoga and would love to have you join us! You can find the MY Community on the Moonchild Yoga Wear website.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute through a pre-order of the Lunar Luxe recycled leggings there are many other ways you can help us too:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by sharing it with your friends and network. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Share it on Instagram or Facebook.
  • Join the MY Community on the Moonchild Yoga Wear website

Choose your favorite color

The Lunar Luxe leggings are available in 3 beautiful colors. Black, Navy* and Rust - which one is your favorite?

* Navy Blue is not yet photographed.

 

Select a perk

Click on the available perk and discount on this page and selected your color: Black, Navy or Rust and your size (XS - XL).

And that's all there is to it.

Thank you for taking the time to read about our project - we are so grateful. If you have any questions I would love to answer them and hear from you.

Sending you love & light,

Louise & Team Moonchild

story:
Have you ever noticed how a particular jacket, coat or suit fits so well on you?  You feel like a million bucks.  You feel it just says “this is me!”.  And you have sometimes had a hard time finding another suit that fits as well?  Sometimes, this puts you in a quandary.  As the suit fits so well, you obviously wear it more often.  And as you wear it more often, you feel a bit conspicuous about having worn something again.  It makes you wonder, doesn’t it?

Well, that suit or jacket can just become another miracle for you.

If you add RE-STYL’s Magic Lapel to it, you will have renovated the jacket into a new you. 

                                         

- Can be CUSTOMISED for you (lapel with initials)
- Comes at FRACTION of a price of a new jacket
- EASY to use
- Can be applied and removed in SECONDS
- Remove the lapels and the jacket goes back to being AS GOOD AS BEFORE
- Has great QUALITY
- For both WOMEN and MEN

 

I

Do you desire a style which is unconventional and yet classy, without having to spend for a whole new jacket?

If yes, then you are looking at the right direction.  RE-STYL gives you an innovative fashion accessory  that transforms your ordinary jacket into awesomeness!

 Be it a cocktail party, dinner date or wedding, merely changing lapels and adding a bowtie along with a pocket strap (for men), will make you the showstopper of any event.

And you know what, it can be customised with your initials!

Use these magic lapels for a cause by getting your Graphic printed on the Lapels. Choose the perk "Lapels for a cause"

 

 

Use these magic lapels for marketing/promotions by getting your Graphic printed or Embroidered on the Lapels. Choose the perk "Lapels for Marketing".

For Bulk Quantities  contact us for a special perk.

 

                               

 

 

All suits have a neck piece and a chest piece and the separation of these two pieces gives you a straight line which is to be used as the collar line.

STEP 1 : ALIGN

Apply the lapel through the collar line and the edge of the lapel all the way till the bottom.

STEP 2 : FOLD

As you apply, fold over the lapel to the collar line, transforming the suit into an exhilarating party jacket.

STEP 3 : FINISH

Press across the lapel to give it a great finish.

                               

=========================

 

 

 

Once the campaign is done, you will be sent a survey where you can choose the size of the lapels according to your requirement

 

Lapel kits for Corporates and Universities!

story:
Fashion and sustainability are intrinsic partners. Yet, it is hard for many to lead an environmentally conscious lifestyle. That’s where we come in!

PAGE has established itself as a cultural disruptor. We want to bring the nostalgia of print back into the fantasy of fashion, the sustainable way. With our first issue in production and almost ready to be sent to printers, we need your support. It’s time that we had a physical reminder that fashion can run adjacent to the needs of our planet.

On our path to publishing, leading sustainable brands have committed to us. But we have hit a roadblock with the worldwide COVID-19 pandemic. Sill, we believe that there is light on the other side of this.

As we continue to produce content daily, our bi-annual print will feature exclusive articles and content limited or removed entirely from our online platform. With your help, the enthusiasts of fashion done the sustainable way, we bring you a collectible piece of culture -- PAGE Print.

I am the Editor In Chief and Founder of PAGE magazine. Fashion is why I fell in love with photography and design. Working in media and the fashion industry, I have noticed the lack of representation, not just of groups but of the ideas that shape us in our everyday decisions. 

The challenges we face are that of printing costs and that we want to be able to distribute this magazine as far and wide as possible, as our audience is here in America and abroad in places like Paris, London, and Melbourne. Shipping has already begun!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Krystal Alpha, I'm a native full-time mother of 2 and I love making my own skincare. I started formulating in my kitchen when I was in high school.

It's important for me to start this business because my children are watching me, and saying to them "Don't let anything stand in the way of your dreams" just isn't good enough for me, I need to show them.

Funding TRUtanicals allows me to fulfill my passion of providing the cosmetics industry with an exceptional brand who's high standards and reasonable prices are clearly missing from today's market. I'd love to be able to earn & save every paycheck from a job independently, but with my young ones, it is simply not practical at the moment and I have put this dream aside long enough!

What I Need & Why

Your funding goes towards:

-My eco-friendly glass bottles which are more costly than plastic (which I am against using unless I can source 100% post-consumer recycled & BPA-free plastic for a reasonable price).

-My organic supplier. They are certified organic and impeccably tested for quality regularly. Having searched and found the best lab in the USA, I will not settle for anything less than their vast ingredient inventory and expertise hence their high quality reflecting in their prices.

-I plan to seek organic certification myself and apply for the EWG as soon as I am able to scale up and meet their strict requirements.

-The website host I plan to use has a 3 yr subscription plan I need to cut out the techy guess work so I can dedicate more time on other facets of my business.

-The labels I require must be waterproof and durable which cost more than paper labels.

-Fictitious business name registration, running the required  local newspaper ad, my city business license, and insurance.

-Equipment ranging from organization for various stages of production to lab equipment and a modest work station as well as the shipping fees for these large and heavy duty items.

-Shipping supplies (transporting liquid inside of glass requires a decent amount of padding).

-misc: security deposits for county, set-up/design fees for merchandise branding, additional costs such as shipping insurance, expedited shipping and taxes to all the above that add up.

What's in it for you?

I'm excited to thank you all with products, beauty tools and merchandise, discounts and exclusive early access. If I do not meet my goal in time, I'll recreate another campaign for the remaining amount needed until my final goal is met. I am persistent, passionate and I have the time and energy to make my dream come true, I'm only missing one thing...

The Impact

As a donor, you're doing way more than just throwing coins in my hat, as a businesswoman, I'm doing much more than just starting a beauty line. My ultimate goal is to facilitate the access of detox and rehabilitation clinics to addicts, specifically Native Americans who want to be freed of their addictions. There has been a silent and deadly epidemic tearing families apart across this country for centuries. I desperately need this business to succeed; lives depend on it. I am not seeking glamour or luxury, I simply want to cleanse bodies and mend families. Family is everything to me and my goals are achievable. 

Risks & Challenges

Being a mother I naturally plan ahead for inevitable mishaps, accidents or delays on a daily basis. For this project, there aren't any challenges beside my lack of funds. Having an online store is not risky business. I'm playing it very safe by starting online now with pop-up shops and storefronts to come in the future when I am ready.

Other Ways You Can Help

I have  raised only $235 in a span of 10 months from friends and family to produce a handful of product samples. I'm absolutely grateful for every dollar donated but it has come in too low and far too slow. So I challenge YOU to donate your current battery percentage AND share this campaign with 5 people using the Indiegogo sharing tools.

I'm dedicating this project and my mission to the memory of my outstanding uncle Caesar who took an oath to sobriety and appreciated beauty in all its forms. He passed the same day I launched this campaign. I'll make you proud, Uncle C.

story:
Winifred Rose is a luxury party and festival wear brand from Bristol, UK.

We require additional funding to launch our brand new sustainable collection which aims to bring you beautiful luxury clothing without compromising the environment and the well-being of manufacturers.

Our mission is to provide stunning, wearable and stand out pieces that are environmentally and socially conscious.

Our brand new sustainable line will show that using sustainable and recycled fabrics does not have to compromise quality and appearance. We are using both brand new technology and age old fabric techniques to bring you environmentally friendly pieces to fall in love with. We want our designs to encourage new and existing customers to realise eco-friendly can be beautiful and cool.

 

Winifred Rose was started in 2016 and we are proud to say that we are half way through our fourth year of selling beautiful luxury clothing.

The impact that the fashion industry has on the environment has become more and more apparent over these four years, and we want to be part of the solution not the problem.

This is where you come in, we are looking for funding to produce our first ever sustainable collection.

We are looking to raise £10,000.

£5000 will be used to purchase fabric, the two fabrics we are using are recycled Econyl Lycra and sustainable silk. The garments will be produced in Europe at a small manufacturers who pay and treat their workers fairly, this will cost £4200. £800 will go towards the marketing and collection launch. If we do not reach our target of £10,000 the collection will still be made and released with lower stock availability.

This money will not only enable us to create this first sustainable collection, it will mean we can create eco-friendly clothing year after year, this is only the beginning, with your help we want to spread our message that eco is fun and bright and beautiful.

 

All of our sustainable collection is available for pre-order, see the perks to order each garment.

We have chosen to use two fabrics throughout our sustainable collection, recycled Econyl Lycra and Mulberry silk.

Lulu is pictured here wearing the Burning Man Silk Kimono and the Alana Recycled Lycra Swimming Costume both in Cheri Bomb print. We chose to use silk as it is one of the most sustainable fabrics on the market, and it feels super soft and luxurious against the skin, and looks beautiful. Here are some facts about silk production and its’s eco credentials:

  • Silk is made from turning the fibres of the silk worm cocoon into thread.
  • The production of silk is one of the oldest known fabric manufacturing processes, producing very little carbon.
  • The Mulberry trees that the silk worms feed on actually suck in carbon from the air and produce oxygen.
  • The Mulberry tree requires little water and no pesticides or fertilisers to grow.
  • Silk is biodegradable and compostable.
  • The silk worm is eaten as a food source by the locals after their cocoons are used to produce the silk, insects are a high protein food source and produce very little methane which is harmful to the atmosphere.

Here Lulu is wearing the Mila catsuit in Fern Gully print.

All our Lycra pieces are made of Econyl recycled Lycra, it’s made from reclaimed marine waste like old fishing nets and other plastic waste, they have a partnership with charity Healthy Seas who dredge the sea of this waste. The plastic is then melted down and spun into thread which is made into the fabric.

One of the best things about this process is that this Nylon thread has the potential to be recycled indefinitely, meaning old clothing can be returned and made back into virgin cloth to make new garments.

Using recycled Lycra is a no-brainer for us, it looks and feels like regular Lycra but by wearing it you are removing waste from the seas that needlessly damages marine life and the eco-system.

This is perhaps our favourite piece of the collection, the Audrey jumpsuit. Made with 100% Mulberry silk this piece is so easy to wear and feels so luxurious, either tie the belt at the front to clinch in the waist or wear loose and relaxed.

It is available in either Queen Bee as pictured or Cheri Bomb. These two prints were designed by Emotional Waterfall, an amazing artist who is local to Bristol where we design the collection. As a brand we try to work with local talent as much as possible, we believe there is strength in community and collaboration. You can follow Emotional Waterfall on Instagram @emotionalwaterfallart .

The Mila recycled catsuit in Cheri Bomb

Here we have Lulu in the Gigi Flares and Betsy top, in the Fern Gully print, another fabulous collaboration with a Bristol designer, Marta Zubieta, this print was inspired by the natural world, a fantasy version of the Amazon rainforest with fairies and creepy crawlies, made in recycled Lycra. You can follow Marta on Instagram as well @onirical_zubieta .

The printing technique we have chosen to use is sublimation print, this is one of the most environmentally friendly printing processes, it uses heat to transfer the print to the fabric, so no water or chemicals are needed.

The recycled Betsy bikini in Queen Bee, also available in Cheri Bomb and Fern Gully and sublimation printed.

Here Lulu is wearing the Alana Swimming Costume which is fully reversible giving you both Emotional Waterfall prints in one! Sublimation printed and recycled.

And lastly we have the Florence Silk Catsuit in Fern Gully, a fitted strappy style with layered flare detail at leg, 100% silk and available in Fern Gully, Cheri Bomb and Queen Bee.

 

Winifred Rose was started in Bristol, UK, in 2016 by Rosie Toms, a British fashion designer.

Rosie studied fashion design in London before moving to Stockholm to design for high street clothing brand H&M in 2012. After a few years getting to know the fashion industry in Sweden she moved back to London to work for indie brand Religion Clothing. These years of experience gave her invaluable skills and knowledge and in 2016 she decided to start her own label concentrating instead on slow fashion- well made, originally designed and socially conscious clothing, and Winifred Rose was born.

Creating limited collections of beautifully designed clothing, at Winifred Rose we originally focused on the festival fashion market, hand making sequin garments. Now we still make hand crafted sequin pieces that are made to treasure for years to come, but ultimately we want to pull away from sequins and focus on sustainable garments. This sustainable collection is the first of many to come and we hope to be a fully sustainable clothing brand in the near future.

If you want further information about the production process, the reasons we chose these particular fabrics, how we plan to overcome potential risks or anything else please see our FAQ's.

Thank you for reading! We appreciate every person that takes the time to read our story, whether you can contribute or not. If you would like to help and support us but cannot afford a monetary contribution please go to our socials: Instagram and facebook @winifredroseclothing and check out our posts. We also think that word of mouth is an invaluable marketing tool, please tell your friends about us and the difference we want to make.

Sustainability and conscious consumption is the future, in fact it is the only option.

It is up to us as individuals to do what we can to help our planet, swap fast fashion for slow fashion, support our eco system and the people and animals in it by making wise choices.

Buy less buy better.
story_txt:
Winifred Rose is a luxury party and festival wear brand from Bristol, UK.
We require additional funding to launch our brand new sustainable collection which aims to bring you beautiful luxury clothing without compromising the environment and the well-being of manufacturers.
Our mission is to provide stunning, wearable and stand out pieces that are environmentally and socially conscious.
Our brand new sustainable line will show that using sustainable and recycled fabrics does not have to compromise quality and appearance. We are using both brand new technology and age old fabric techniques to bring you environmentally friendly pieces to fall in love with. We want our designs to encourage new and existing customers to realise eco-friendly can be beautiful and cool.
 

Winifred Rose was started in 2016 and we are proud to say that we are half way through our fourth year of selling beautiful luxury clothing.
The impact that the fashion industry has on the environment has become more and more apparent over these four years, and we want to be part of the solution not the problem.
This is where you come in, we are looking for funding to produce our first ever sustainable collection.
We are looking to raise £10,000.
£5000 will be used to purchase fabric, the two fabrics we are using are recycled Econyl Lycra and sustainable silk. The garments will be produced in Europe at a small manufacturers who pay and treat their workers fairly, this will cost £4200. £800 will go towards the marketing and collection launch. If we do not reach our target of £10,000 the collection will still be made and released with lower stock availability.
This money will not only enable us to create this first sustainable collection, it will mean we can create eco-friendly clothing year after year, this is only the beginning, with your help we want to spread our message that eco is fun and bright and beautiful.
 

All of our sustainable collection is available for pre-order, see the perks to order each garment.
We have chosen to use two fabrics throughout our sustainable collection, recycled Econyl Lycra and Mulberry silk.

Lulu is pictured here wearing the Burning Man Silk Kimono and the Alana Recycled Lycra Swimming Costume both in Cheri Bomb print. We chose to use silk as it is one of the most sustainable fabrics on the market, and it feels super soft and luxurious against the skin, and looks beautiful. Here are some facts about silk production and its’s eco credentials:

Silk is made from turning the fibres of the silk worm cocoon into thread.
The production of silk is one of the oldest known fabric manufacturing processes, producing very little carbon.
The Mulberry trees that the silk worms feed on actually suck in carbon from the air and produce oxygen.
The Mulberry tree requires little water and no pesticides or fertilisers to grow.
Silk is biodegradable and compostable.
The silk worm is eaten as a food source by the locals after their cocoons are used to produce the silk, insects are a high protein food source and produce very little methane which is harmful to the atmosphere.


Here Lulu is wearing the Mila catsuit in Fern Gully print.
All our Lycra pieces are made of Econyl recycled Lycra, it’s made from reclaimed marine waste like old fishing nets and other plastic waste, they have a partnership with charity Healthy Seas who dredge the sea of this waste. The plastic is then melted down and spun into thread which is made into the fabric.
One of the best things about this process is that this Nylon thread has the potential to be recycled indefinitely, meaning old clothing can be returned and made back into virgin cloth to make new garments.
Using recycled Lycra is a no-brainer for us, it looks and feels like regular Lycra but by wearing it you are removing waste from the seas that needlessly damages marine life and the eco-system.

As a brand we try to work with local talent as much as possible, we believe there is strength in community and collaboration. You can follow Emotional Waterfall on Instagram @emotionalwaterfallart .

The Mila recycled catsuit in Cheri Bomb

Here we have Lulu in the Gigi Flares and Betsy top, in the Fern Gully print, another fabulous collaboration with a Bristol designer, Marta Zubieta, this print was inspired by the natural world, a fantasy version of the Amazon rainforest with fairies and creepy crawlies, made in recycled Lycra. You can follow Marta on Instagram as well @onirical_zubieta .
The printing technique we have chosen to use is sublimation print, this is one of the most environmentally friendly printing processes, it uses heat to transfer the print to the fabric, so no water or chemicals are needed.

The recycled Betsy bikini in Queen Bee, also available in Cheri Bomb and Fern Gully and sublimation printed.

Here Lulu is wearing the Alana Swimming Costume which is fully reversible giving you both Emotional Waterfall prints in one! Sublimation printed and recycled.

And lastly we have the Florence Silk Catsuit in Fern Gully, a fitted strappy style with layered flare detail at leg, 100% silk and available in Fern Gully, Cheri Bomb and Queen Bee.

If you want further information about the production process, the reasons we chose these particular fabrics, how we plan to overcome potential risks or anything else please see our FAQ's.

If you would like to help and support us but cannot afford a monetary contribution please go to our socials: Instagram and facebook @winifredroseclothing and check out our posts. story:
Overview

• Factory workers are hardworking people in safe working conditions.

• Neutral® products are made from 100% organic cotton certified by GOTS.

•  Fairtrade isn’t charity. Farmers growing Neutral® cotton receive a fair price for their crops.

• Eco Friendly – ensuring the protection of the environment.


To buy our products, select a "Perk" to the right and once the campaign is over we will send you a survey where you will pick your size and color preference.

Short Summary

About us:

My name is Yves-Noël Bangne. I am a trained Sport & Event Manager and the creator of Noël Ban IVS. I created this business after completing my education, when I was going through a difficult time in my life. I chose to focus on creating something which could help others in the same position as myself, and other people around the world.

OUR WORK:

We are working in cooperation with businesses located in Europe as we want to focus on creating good workplaces for factory workers. We believe that people should be treated as people, and we therefore want to avoid working with certain factories which do not share our point of view. Our partner has a strong focus on sustainable materials and humane working conditions in line with human rights. Through these initiatives we can take into account social and ecological aspects, which helps to strengthen and maintain the planet as a viable place for future generations. This is our focus, as we want to influence our local environment by giving a helping hand to the organisations and projects that are trying to help vulnerable adults and especially children, who are our future.

OUR VALUES

Mission:

In the long term, By Noël Ban wants to inspire their consumers and communities to focus more on their immediate environment by engaging more in their local communities. We will work according to a socially responsible business model with people, the environment and the planet at the center. We will achieve this through collaboration with certified producers and local support projects that strive to make a difference for their local community.

Vision:

By Noël Ban’s vision is to make the Danish population take on greater social responsibility. Therefore, our desire is that the current generation of young people in our community works towards us all moving from giving responsibility to taking responsibility for the vulnerable members of our community. Our goal is to make social responsibility a lifestyle and not just a buzz word.

Values:

By Noël Ban wants to create a community around our brand and vision so that we can form a large family that has the same goal of expressing ourselves by striving to take care of our community. This is why we strive to deliver good quality organic clothing without compromising, and thereby achieving our goal of influencing society. This means that we in the company want to interact with our consumers via social media and create personal relationships. By Noël Ban is just a company that wants to make a difference in our community while providing quality organic clothing that is good for your health.

Our donations:

We want to have a donation feature on our webshop. This means that our customers, through a web shop purchase, will donate a percentage of the full amount to selected organizations. We want to emphasise that the customer will not pay extra, but that the percentage is taken from their purchase.

What We Need & What You Get

We therefore need 15.000 kr, which will be used for the registration of the company, production and shipping of the clothing.

Production: 5.000 kr.

Registration of the company to ApS: 40.000 kr., but we will start with 5000 and then work our way up.

Shipping, packaging and fee for indiegogo: 5.000 kr.

The Danish government has decided to abolish the corporate form of entrepreneurial companies. At the same time, the capital requirement for limited companies has been lowered to 40.000 kr. Therefore existing IVS (Entrepreneurial companies) need to register as ApS before the 15th of April 2021 or close down. If this happens, it will not be possible for BNB to fulfill our dreams.

If we do not reach our goal, we will use the money to produce new designs that we will sell, and then develop new designs that will lead us to our dream.

Tees 2.0

Our tees are Slightly fitted / Roll up at sleeves / Crew neck / Neck tape / COLOURS Elastane rib knitted neckband / Ringspun combed cotton made by Neutral®. The materials are biological fertilizers and earthworms instead of chemicals. 

Size S - 2XL

Color: White, Black

 

Tees “Améliorer”

Our tees are slightly fitted at shoulders & sleeves / Crew neck / Elastane rib knitted neckband / Neck tape / Ringspun combed cotton made by Neutral®. The materials are biological fertilizers and earthworms instead of chemicals. 

Size S - 2XL

Color: White, Black

 

Unisex sweatshirt

Our sweatshirts are Casual fitted / Raglan Sleeves / Rib knitted sleeve cuffs & waistband / Neck tape / Ringspun combed cotton made by Neutral®. The materials are biological fertilizers and earthworms instead of chemicals. 

Size S - 2XL

Color: White, Black

 

The Impact

Project value:

  • Shaping a more ecofriendly environment.
  • Helping less fortune in the society.
  • Creating a brand that works for social responsibility and not alone profit.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us get the word out and let’s make some noise about the campaign. Share the information with your friends and family.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools! So many more can join our mission.
