Our tees are Slightly fitted / Roll up at sleeves / Crew neck / Neck tape / COLOURS Elastane rib knitted neckband / Ringspun combed cotton made by Neutral®. The materials are biological fertilizers and earthworms instead of chemicals. 
Size S - 2XL
Color: White, Black

 
Tees “Améliorer”

Our tees are slightly fitted at shoulders & sleeves / Crew neck / Elastane rib knitted neckband / Neck tape / Ringspun combed cotton made by Neutral®. The materials are biological fertilizers and earthworms instead of chemicals. 
Size S - 2XL
Color: White, Black
 
Unisex sweatshirt

Our sweatshirts are Casual fitted / Raglan Sleeves / Rib knitted sleeve cuffs & waistband / Neck tape / Ringspun combed cotton made by Neutral®. The materials are biological fertilizers and earthworms instead of chemicals. 
Size S - 2XL
Color: White, Black
 

The Impact

Project value:

Shaping a more ecofriendly environment.
Helping less fortune in the society.
Creating a brand that works for social responsibility and not alone profit.

 

Other Ways You Can Help


Help us get the word out and let’s make some noise about the campaign. Share the information with your friends and family.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools! So many more can join our mission.

story:
Our Mission

We're trying to make the UK's most sustainable facemask:

  • THREE layers of 100% ORGANIC cotton
  • NO microplastics. NO pesticides. NO waste.
  • Our packaging is made from fully recyclable paper
  • For every mask we sell, we plant a tree
  • Our masks are designed to stand for something

 

Who are we

  • Michael, our founder, has experience in the healthcare sector from being a medical student and working in a GP surgery. Michael understands the importance we hold as individuals to protect each other for society’s benefit through wearing facemasks.​

 

The story

  • Fed up with the lack of facemasks options that were sustainable, comfortable, affordable, and had three layers. Here at the #The.Breathe.Project we set out to change this. We don't just want to help you breathe safer but help the planet breathe easier with every purchase of our masks - through our use of sustainable materials and our mission to plant a tree with every mask bought.

  • By creating a sustainable business that can be scalable it allows us to produce a large enough volume of masks to supply cafes, chains etc that may instead buy  thousands of disposable masks or masks made from cotton/polyester that creates more waste in our communities.

  • With scientists at University College London estimating that if every person in the UK used one single-use mask each day for a year, an extra 66,000 tonnes of contaminated plastic waste would be created.

 

 

  • And fabrics made from polyester/recycled being the 3rd largest polluter of our oceans, - behind plastic bags and bottles.

 

  • The two most common materials currently used for facemasks are conventional cotton and polyester, and while they may be inexpensive to produce and offer some comfortability. They have MASSIVE environmental impacts attached to them. Don’t get your facemasks no matter how inexpensive. 

 

It costs OUR planet.

 

  • With the influx of so many masks into our lives. We’ve seen some inventive masks being developed. And while masks made from recycled ocean waste and plastic bottles may seem initially as materials that are good for the planet. In fact, when you wash your recycled polyester mask it will release thousands of microplastics to our waters that are extremely damaging not only to local ecosystems but eventually end up in our bodies also!!

 

  • Conventional cotton is a water INTENSIVE material requiring the use of gallons of water for a little amount of usable cotton. Opposed to organic cotton which uses nearly HALF the amount of water.

 

  • Conventional cotton also accounts for an INSANE 16% of all insecticide use globally. Which has incredibly damaging effects to people’s health around the world, and causes 40,000 deaths/year from its use. The ORGANIC cotton used in our masks have ZERO pesticides or GMOs in their production.

 

  • And while recycled plastic uses much less energy than virgin polyester, although it’s still more than organic cotton. The production of virgin and recycled polyester is reliant on  extraction of crude oil and natural gas from the Earth.

 

  • It doesn’t matter if the masks are made from virgin or recycled polyester (recycled bottles or ocean waste), they both contribute to MICROPLASTICS pollution - releasing thousands of microplastics with every wash. 

 

What are microplastics? 
Tiny sized pellets of plastic that damage ecosystems in a number of ways from filling the stomachs of fish and animals to and impairing their ability to feed. And ultimately these microplastics end up in our food chain when we consume them. 

 

  • ORGANIC cotton also surpasses polyester as a material of choice for masks by the timeframe in which it takes to decompose (5yrs vs 200yrs). 

 

  • As a natural fiber also has the advantage of being antimicrobial and a breathable material. Cotton actually keeps you cooler than polyester fabrics by an average of 4 degrees.

 

The Impact

  • Our packaging is made from paper so that it is fully recyclable and can be biodegraded quickly as opposed to what many of our competitors deliver their masks in.

  • For every mask we sell, we plant a tree to help offset the CO2 emissions from the production and materials of our masks.

 

  • Our masks are designed to stand for something. Using the opportunity of a display everyone walks with to raise awareness of local issues we all face. The mask you can help produce is designed to raise awareness on the rise of food banks in the UK and the increasing reliance on them by families.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise £200 to fund the first batch of our sustainable masks from which we’ll be able to reinvest any profits and grow the business

  • By funding us TODAY you'll be able to buy one of our facemasks at more than HALF the price as when we sell them to businesses and online.
  • If we surpass our goal than we can look to introduce different sizes, designs
     

 

Risks & Challenges

  • We recognise that we may possibly never be as sustainable as we want to be, but that is our aim. It is to keep chasing the possibility that we may be the most sustainable not only facemask brand but clothing brand in the UK. 

 

At #thebreatheproject we want to change the way facemasks are currently thought of and used nationally.

Help the planet breathe while you breathe safely with our facemasks!


Other Ways You Can Help
Please do share this funding page with friends and family to get the word out and make this a possibility.

story:
85% of the carbon footprint of clothing happens during laundry  

 

   Pack less, enjoy more!

 

Our patented anti-odor/bacteria technology allows you to use our clothes for about 10 days without washing*. Do the math, that’s:

  • 10X less luggage space.
  • 10X less water and time spent on laundry. 
  • Getting 10 t-shirts/jeans for the price of 1.

​

* The amount of days our clothes can be worn without getting bad smells varies according to the climate, temperature, amount of sweat they are exposed to, and from person to person. That's why we estimate around 10 days without washing (we've had people who have used them for more than 60 days without washing but some others that have used them for 5 days). 

 

 

Jeans that feel like pajama pants but look like jeans

If these are not the most comfortable jeans you've ever had we'll give you a full refund.

 

2 anti-theft hidden pockets for your valuables​

 

Perfect for crowded places like the metro or concerts. 

 

Adjusting straps to avoid using a belt

Now you can go through airport security like a pro!

*UPDATE: The adjusting straps are now on the inside of the jeans

 

 

 

 

 

Anti-theft without compromising fast access

 

Thanks to our patented anti-theft magnetic closure system our backpack provides super fast access without compromising security.

 

Patented self-adjusting straps

Have you ever had one strap longer than the other? Thanks to our patented design this will no longer be a problem.

 

Rain resistant fabrics and YKK zippers 

 

Daily bag to Travel bag in seconds

 

Colors and sizes availability subject to stock

 

Colors and sizes availability subject to stock

 

 

When choosing your size keep in mind:

  • Choose colors and sizes after the campaign ends (we’ll contact you).
  • Our jeans are so stretchy that it’s very hard to go wrong in sizes. The same person can fit one size up (looser fit) and one size down (tighter fit).
  • If you’re not satisfied with your fit, we’ll exchange them for free.

 

To accurately get your size, follow the steps below

Take your best fitting jeans and measure them as follows (try to find the closest fit to slim fit for men and medium rise skinny fit for women):

Step 1: Lay them on a flat surface (do NOT stretch them and make sure they are unworn).

Step 2: Measure the width and length* as follows: 

*Only men (The inseam is 31" for women's jeans)

 

Step 3: Compare them with the measurements from our jeans. Get your size from our size chart.

Remember: 

  • Go for a lower size if you want a tighter fit and for a higher size if you want a looser fit. 
  • Our Jeans fit is slim for men and medium rise skinny for women.

 

Keep in mind:

  • Choose colors and sizes after the campaign ends (we’ll contact you).
  • If you’re not satisfied with your fit, we’ll exchange them for free.

 

To accurately get your size, follow the steps below

Take your best fitting t-shirt and measure it as follows:

Step 1: Lay it on a flat surface (do NOT stretch it and make sure it’s unworn).

Step 2: Measure the width.

 

 

Step 3: Compare them with the measurements from our t-shirts. Get your size from our size chart.

 

 

 

 

    What people say about us:     

   

Our team

Risks and Challenges

This is our 6th crowdfunding campaign,  we've worked for more than 2 years on this project and have almost everything ready to start production. We've already manufactured 500 backpacks and the fabric for 2.000 t-shirts. However, we're still finishing the final samples of the jeans' fabrics (which are looking really good). We hope to have the fabrics ready by the end of August.

We're looking forward to finishing the manufacturing of our products by the end of October but promise a delivery by April 2020. 

We've had issues with manufacturers in the past, where they promise a deadline but fail to deliver on time. This is mostly because we're very strict with quality and return everything if we're not satisfied with the products. 

We trust our current manufacturer but we can't be 100% sure they will deliver on time. That's why we have a margin of error of about 2 months to be able to accomplish the deadline we promised.

As an established company we have a very strict policy of 100% satisfaction or money back guaranteed for our customers. This means that if for any reason any of our customers is not satisfied with our products or with our service we guarantee we will offer a full refund on what our customers paid.

 

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best crowdfunding
projects with 1100+ successful projects with over $450MM raised between them.
story_txt:
85% of the carbon footprint of clothing happens during laundry      Pack less, enjoy more! Our patented anti-odor/bacteria technology allows you to use our clothes for about 10 days without washing*. Do the math, that’s:
10X less luggage space.

10X less water and time spent on laundry. 

Getting 10 t-shirts/jeans for the price of 1.

​* The amount of days our clothes can be worn without getting bad smells varies according to the climate, temperature, amount of sweat they are exposed to, and from person to person. That's why we estimate around 10 days without washing (we've had people who have used them for more than 60 days without washing but some others that have used them for 5 days).   Jeans that feel like pajama pants but look like jeansIf these are not the most comfortable jeans you've ever had we'll give you a full refund. 2 anti-theft hidden pockets for your valuables​  Perfect for crowded places like the metro or concerts.  Adjusting straps to avoid using a beltNow you can go through airport security like a pro!*UPDATE: The adjusting straps are now on the inside of the jeans     Anti-theft without compromising fast access  Thanks to our patented anti-theft magnetic closure system our backpack provides super fast access without compromising security. Patented self-adjusting strapsHave you ever had one strap longer than the other? story:
We are laagam, an affordable luxury fashion brand based in Barcelona inspiring girls to take the world by storm ⚡️.  

How? By crafting unique pieces. Our latest creation is the 4-in-1 fashion bag: a multi-position, high-tech, vegan bag for any occasion. 

The bag you deserve, the only bag you need!

We are girls, we know how it feels to have a closet full of bags but still don't know which one to pick.  

So we asked ourselves: how come there is no bag to cover all our needs? Even more, why the most practical ones are never fashionable and unique? 

Thanks to your help, we finally have the answer to our needs:

Think about this bag (with details in golden or silvery, you choose!) as the perfect complement for any occasion:  

1) You can wear it as a purse hanging from your shoulder for your daily routine.

2) As a handbag from its rings for a more formal and sophisticated touch.

3) Attached to your waist as a belt bag for those busy days you need to be hands-free.

4) Or just take with you the wallet to that special date when you only need your essentials.

 

 

 

Chipolo is a bluetooth device with a FREE dedicated app connecting your laagam bag to your smartphone. You will always know where your bag is.  

No more worries while carrying your bag!

Our integrated power bank provides convenient energy to keep your electronic devices (smartphone, tablets, ebooks, GPS, etc.)  always charged. It comes with a cable adapter for Apple and Android devices. 

This external battery is ultra-compact (width: 0.5 inches/1.3 cm), has high-speed charging technology (recharge your phone in minutes) and comes with 10000m Ah of energy (enough to charge an iPhone 4 times).

The Chipolo device and a the power bank are included with the purchase of our bag for free. They have specific compartments designed to fit perfectly inside. 

 

Our bag has 5 different large capacity compartments to carry all your belongings. All of them are smartly designed to cover your needs: 

  • Anti-Theft: secure compartments stuck to your body
  • Water repellent: vegan leather keeps the rain out!
  • Tech compartments: for both power bank & Chipolo device

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our patented design has been engineered by MOVEX, a leading studio specialized in applying the latests product innovations to the traditional manufacturing of leather goods. Their clients include world-renowned fashion designers. 

The final design integrates the 4 different positions in the same bag and all as the tech accessories (Chipolo device + power bank) in their own compartments.  

Ubrique is a small town located in the south of Spain (Andalusia). Located within a difficult access valley of the Sierra de Cádiz, Ubrique is recognized by its picturesque white colored houses... 

...but better known as the leather goods capital of Europe. The quality of Ubrique’s artisans is recognized worldwide and the tradition dates back to the Middle Ages. 

Ubrique is the supplier to luxury International fashion houses such as Loewe, Gucci and Louis Vuitton. 

Our 4-in-1 bag is handmade on those same workshops through a meticulous process, taking care of every single detail:

But what’s exactly and how is vegan leather made? (Don’t get fooled by plastic fake leather!) 

Easily explained, vegan leather is an activist's & eco-friendly alternative to leather from animals. 

Take a look on how we’ve processed it, from the grape skin to your hands:

 

laagam bag details (rings, logo and fastener) are provided by the famous YKK Japanese zipper brand: they make roughly half of all the zippers on earth! 

All the bag details can be either silvery or golden, you choose! 

 

 

The 3-in-1 bag cover easily converts from a protector to a tote bag, a backpack and even a purse. 

Made of beige cotton, it has adjustable vegan leather handles. You can modify the position of the cover with the stabilizer straps that come in the same color as your bag (silvery or golden).

 

 

 

At laagam we inspire girls to ‘take the world by storm’ ⚡️ . We do so by designing affordable luxury fashion with a time to market approach. 

We are based in sunny Barcelona, where we design all our pieces then handmade in Spain.

We’re a young team of female entrepreneurs trying to redefine the apparel industry from our generation’s point of view. We transform our empowering lifestyle and values into fashion piece.

story:
--- The campaign has ended. You can get your Sozius now on sozius.co ---



Your long lasting, real leather, modern companion for spontanous little trips exploring the world!


HI THERE, BACKER

What we created here, is a redesign of your traditional lace bag. We just made it a little more adaptable for everyday tasks and every situation's challenge! Made out of real leather, quality cloth and other high class materials we managed to develope a lace bag that can take on the rough. Still, it looks really classy.

If you think the same, please help us to bring this project to life.


FEATURES

Sozius Specifications:

Height: 45 cm (Leather: 18cm) // Width: 32 cm

LIFESTYLE 

Sozius...

...is your companion for all your little trips, whether it's a stroll through the city or just a day at the beach.

…gives you more than enough space for all your little things.

…fits the urban cowboy every bit as it does the skater or student. It’s for everyone!

…is perfect for motorcycle riding, because it is lightweight and very slim, leaving enough space for your partner.

…also looks great if it's not filled up to the top.

…can hold 13” laptops as well as vinyl records.


CONCEPT

In Zurich lace bags are very popular, however we couldn’t find one that is big enough to carry a laptop and bear its weight at the same time. Lace bags that we own started to fall apart, especially at the bottom where the cotton is really exposed. Most of these bags also hang down too far on your back for our taste, that's why Sozius sits nicely in the center of your back, where it belongs.

Hence, we decided to create our own bag, which ended up as a more elegant approach on the classic one. The leather is not only making sure that the bottom of the bag doesn’t get damaged easily, but gives the whole bag a cleaner look and allowed us to create two nicely spaced pockets on each side of the bag.

In addition to these two pockets, we also made sure that the size of the bag can fit a vinyl record and that there’s a small keyring on the inside so you don’t have to dig for your keys at the bottom of the bag and so they won’t harm anything you carry in the side pockets.


We decided upon a very strong cloth in two color schemes (as of now) for the upper part of the bag.

- Old Military Green

- Desert Beige

Mixed with the cotton waist cord inspired from sailing rope, the sturdy fabric and the smooth leather, we have a nice blend of an elegant, yet persistent product that suits a casual outfit just as well as it does a chic one.


NOW WE NEED YOU!

To make our dream of getting Sozius to production come true, we need funding of at least $7,500. But it's not just about the money. Not at all. With you, our first customers, we are looking to bond and help build an honest customer base.

The bags you see on the photos are prototypes. But your Sozius will look almost the same. The only difference will be our engraved logo, slickly located at the bottom of the bag as well as on the leather patch inside.

You will be among the first owners of Sozius and because of that - we're sure - a trendsetter! Because of forward thinking people like you, we think that Sozius might just come to life!


OUR OFFER

This is the best price you will ever get on a Sozius! But we want to keep making Sozius for an affordable price and not for an overinflated retail price. Hence the regular price after the campaign will be $99 instead of $150 if you buy directly from us!


REWARDS 

$ 25 - Good sport! You will be mentioned on our list of backers on our website!

$ 79 - Early Bird (Limited perk)

$ 89 - Sozius

$ 149 - Double Trouble (Early) - Both Colors (Limited perk)

$ 169 - Double Trouble (Sozius) - Both Colors


HOW SOZIUS ARRIVES AT YOUR HOME

For material goods: After having checked each order for its quality personally, we will package it and leave an individual "thank you" note.

For immaterial goods: We will send you a personal "thank you" E-Mail.

We do ship internationally, just make sure you add the correct shipping amount!


WHO WE ARE

The team consists of Caspar and Nicolas, two 20 year old students from Zurich, Switzerland.

We share a passion for simple, yet innovative quality goods and both of us enjoy combining design and functionality.

Caspar is the more creative mind, designing the logo and website. Nicolas is responsible for looking after the technical stuff, such as running the website or guaranteeing smooth logistics.

Together, we created Sozius.

By the way: We are fond of motorcycles. But this doesn't mean you have to be too. Sozius is for everyone!

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

If Sozius is successfully funded, we will have to make sure everything goes according to plan to meet the promised deadline. We have manufacturing, operations, and logistics set up and ready to go. The funding raised on Indiegogo will be used for production and manufacturing of your Sozius lace bag. Although we do not see any direct risks and challenges, there can always be unforeseeable issues that may present themselves during the process. We hope to run everything as streamlined as possible or even ahead of schedule.


If you find yourself having any troubles, don't hesitate to contact us: info@sozius.co


FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM

Caspar is the more creative mind, designing the logo and website. Nicolas is responsible for looking after the technical stuff, such as running the website or guaranteeing smooth logistics.Together, we created Sozius.By the way: We are fond of motorcycles. But this doesn't mean you have to be too. Sozius is for everyone!

We have manufacturing, operations, and logistics set up and ready to go. The funding raised on Indiegogo will be used for production and manufacturing of your Sozius lace bag. Although we do not see any direct risks and challenges, there can always be unforeseeable issues that may present themselves during the process. We hope to run everything as streamlined as possible or even ahead of schedule.If you find yourself having any troubles, don't hesitate to contact us: info@sozius.coFOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM

story:
I play guitar every day. I love the blues and I love the feel of a handcrafted guitar in my hands. But I never liked the feel of the acetate or celluloid picks.
     My nephew, Simen, hand carved two guitar picks of beech wood for me as a gift when he was twelve or so, six years ago. He even took the time to carve out my name, TH on one side and OR on the other. Those beech wood guitar picks changed the tone of my '91 Corona Fender Stratocaster and my Seagull acoustic.

All Wood Series Oak.

In the following months I handcrafted a few wood picks for myself and noticed the distinct tone differences in woods, thickness and tips. I crafted over a hundred wood picks, playing them hard, giving them to guitarist friends, wanting feedback from working guitarists. The feedback turned out to be amazing, they all wanted to play with my wood picks. The wood picks rounded off the sound, created a warmer, smooth tone. This took away some mids, added base and shaved the highs.
     I wondered if I could get a much brighter tone going in the other direction. I had tried playing with a coin and some primitive metal picks years ago and the thought manifested itself. Prototypes of wood/metal picks crafted, laminating a thin piece of metal between two pieces of wood, to see if a laminate pick can endure countless hours of constant beating onstage without breaking apart. The result was unreal! Experiencing fundamental tone changes in my guitars, NorwegianWoodPickers Custom Shop was conceived, high end guitar picks for professional guitarists.

Custom Shop Ågåt Apple/Brass.

Wood picks is, by far, not a new idea. What our research and prototypes developed into, is something we believe separates our picks from other brands. NorwegianWoodPickers wood/metal and wood guitar picks is a tone changing tool for professional guitarists. Handcrafted with care, enthusiasm and admiration for wood as the perfect material for crafting Fine Tiny Musical Instruments.

Just like a guitar, someone actually cared for you to have your guitar. You can not build a guitar and not care. We care.

Thor M. Renslemo
Creator & Owner

The one thing that separates great products from good products are often the attention to details and the no compromise attitude. There is a reason an expensive guitar do not come in a anonymous cardboard box. For a small company, like ours, it is essential not to take any shortcuts along the way, but to stay true to the initial challenge of creating a high end product with emphasis on product presentation.

Custom Shop Myrthild Oak/Brass.

Custom Shop Sønni Oak/Silver.

We want to change the guitarists perception of the guitar pick, as mentioned, the most overlooked piece of gear in a guitarist rig. Guitarists use different guitars, strings, pedals and amps to get the tone desired. Playing a NorwegianWoodPickers pick for the first time is much like playing a new guitar. Experiment, try different combinations, adjust tone, find your sweet spot. It is important that you let your fingers get used to the thicker gauge and weight, specially if you play with wood/metal pick. Some players will adjust quicker than others, but the transition should become obvious after a little while.

If our Custom Shop guitar picks drastically changes the sound of the guitar and opens it is tonality and maybe true potential, is it worth it? If we listen to all the guitarists we have met the past years, our customers and the artist we now endorse, it is worth it. We believe in them, they believe in us.

Research indicates that there are about one million professional guitar players in the world, twenty million bedroom players and thirty million noodlers.

It has taken three years to get to the point where our product has reached the level of craftsmanship and precision desired. We are ready to expand production capabilities, both All Wood Series and Custom Shop and launch internationally. With your help we can make a tiny dent in the music instrument and accessories business which recently passed an annual sales of twenty billion dollars.
Source: NAMM, National Association of Music Merchants

“Maybe one bright sunny day we all wake up and open a guitar case with a brand new guitar with a special tag attached to the headstock - Please consider NOT playing this Fine Precision Handcrafted Wood Instrument with acetate or celluloid pick!”
— Thor

NorwegianWoodPickers launched at Notodden Blues Festival 2014. The festival management let us introduce our picks backstage and we got an amazing response from artists like Keb' Mo', Paul Sherry, Davy Watson, Mike Anderson, Jimmy Henderson, Dave Fields, Marcus Løvdal and Bjørn Blix.

Jimmy Henderson plays a Myrthild Oak 1.8 mm pick at a show with Dorothy Moore at Notodden Church, August 2nd 2014.
Melvin "Housecat" Hendrex on keyboard.

Keb' Mo' and Thor backstage at Notodden. Keb' tried several picks and quickly found a favorite, Hedda Apple Copper.

The guitarists at Notodden Blues Festival and other guitarists we have worked with since have really given this project a momentum forward.

Since Notodden we have crafted guitar picks for norwegian guitarist and other foreign greats. I sat down with Tim Scott McConnell before a show. He tried many of my designs, he really noticed the difference in tone on his 12 string Taylor. We gave him a couple of Apple picks to take with, but we all know he is a fingerpicker.

Perks for our campaign are high end wood/metal and wood guitar picks. We chose Oak, Ash, Blood Beech and Kebony Maple. Gold, Silver, Copper and Brass. We selected round tip for our campaign, a tip we know works well for most styles of playing. Blunt, Sharp and Carved edge will be available thru the Custom Shop in September. Please understand that no two pieces of wood are identical. Therefore, no two NorwegianWoodPickers wood picks will be exactly alike.

All Wood Seriers Ågåt Kebony, Oak, Ash and Blood Beech.

The fact that we collect and process our own wood gives us greater understanding of the material, it's qualities and esthetics. A deal with T.A. Trefelling in Oslo, a tree-chop-down company, ensures a wide assortment and steady flow of woods. We also receive private donations of very limited beautiful and unique woods. This limited quantity woods is prepped and stored for use in the Custom Shop.

Nogusra, a company delivering gold and silver to Norwegian jewellers since 1936, will deliver the highest quality gold, silver, copper and brass for our picks.

Kebony Maple

Kebony is a denser, heavier and harder wood than most trees found in Norway. The invention of the Kebonization process is a Norwegian story 20 years in the making. Kebony is a sustainable alternative to hardwoods from tropical regions. The processed maple resembles teak and other tropical varieties of wood.

Kebony Maple produces a brighter tone than Ash or Beech. It wears a little quicker, but for a bedroom guitar player these picks will last for months, for a professional guitarist they will last about 30-35 hours of rough playing.

Blood Beech

Beech is the densest wood found in Norwegian woods. The difference between blood beech and regular beech is the wood and bark’s pinkish red colour. It’s a beautiful wood.

Blood beech produces a warm tone and wears slow. The density eliminates the feel of the strings hitting the pick between your fingertips.

Oak

It’s been said that an Oak tree grows for five hundred years, lives for five hundred years, and dies for five hundred years. Oak is a symbol of strength, life force and perseverance.

The keel of the Viking ship Gokstad excavated in Norway in 1880 was built of of a straight grown Oak approximately 25 meters (82 feet) in height. The wood was hewn from green logs, by axe and wedge, to produce radial planks, similar to quarter-sawn timber.

Oak is very bright in tone and feels superb between the finger due to the wood fiber structure. The wood ages beautifully.

Ash

The Louiville Sluggers are made from ash. Fender uses ash as guitar bodies. This is a long-fibered wood and we found out that the wear at the tip of the pick is minimal, hard playing actually packs the fibers at the tip before wear occurs.

The tone is brighter than blood beech, but not as crisp as Kebony Maple.

Myrthild

25x30 mm

Myrthild is as close to a classic 451 shape
and size you can muster. She's a lady.

Milrid

20x23 mm

Milrid is a tiny version of Myrthild. She's
for players with smaller hands, thinner
fingers or just fans of tiny Jazz picks.

Sollin

26x30 mm

Sollin is a large size Jazz pick. She's
got similar feel as a classic 451 shape.

Sønni

22x26 mm

Sønni is Jazz all the way. She's based
on a Jazz pick from the early 1970's.

Ågåt

26x29 mm

Ågåt is the perfect medium size pick.
She works great for most styles of playing.
She's a real peach.

Hedda

23x27 mm

Hedda is a little narrower and a little
rounder than Ågåt. But she's a fast little lady.

Olin

21x25 mm

Olin is the tiny sibling to Hedda.
She's great for intricate fast picking.

Peroline

33x33 mm

Peroline is a big lady, to be honest
they don't get much bigger than this.
She's based on a pick from the 1950's.

There is no doubt that every contribution counts, whether it be $3, $6 or $125 or a like on our facebook, you still Rock! For our $3 and $6 contributors we will set up Team Member page on our website with all the contributors names listed with a dedicated video recorded Thank You! from everyone at NorwegianWoodPickers. If you went all out and got yourself a wood/metal or wood guitar pick, well, then you really have something genuine and unique to look forward to.

Custom Shop Ågåt Kebony/Copper.

Custom Shop Sollin Apple/Copper.

Custom Shop Peroline Oak/925s, Kebony/925s and Ash/925s.

Custom Shop Series picks are shipped in a handcrafted tiny shipping crate based on 1970's real shipping crates. We just could not stand the thought of shipping our picks in a tiny plastic ziplock or any other plastic bag. The All Wood Series picks are shipped in small recycled envelope. Both seriers comes with specification tag.

Custom Shop Sønni Oak/Silver in shipping crate with specification tag and vintage cloth.

In the fall of 2015 these handcrafted tiny shipping crates can also be purchased separately. Also included a vintage cloth with bees wax and specification tag.

NorwegianWoodPickers Naturally Curved Coconut Pick. This pick has been tested to stand a real stage beating. Paul Sherry, Grainne Duffy's guitarist, got a Myrthild 2.4 mm before a show at Notodden Blues Festival 2014 and played the whole festival with the pick and dug it. It had a slight curve perfect for his slim fingers. Paul Sherry is now an endorsed artist and we in the process of crafting a set for him.

On the drawing board the are new designs for thumb and finger picks as well as picks created specifically for acoustic guitars and ukulele.

NorwegianWoodPickers Wood Pick Care Kit is currently being developed. The kit contains vintage cloth, small container with bees wax and two 1.5" x 1.5" pieces of 400/600 sandpaper to even out damages from rough playing.

Fall. Brea, Hallingdal.

Thor spent three years crafting prototypes and giving them to friends and other guitarist to try out. Their feedback and Thor's constant design tweaks and development of production methods have created enough momentum that we feel and believe is needed to run a successful Indiegogo campaign. We hope.

The level of craftsmanship is very high and no guitar pick leave the wood shop until they are crafted to specs. and meets Thor's insistent level of quality and accuracy.

Morten is considered to be a craftsman. He was a wood shop teacher for 15 years before joining team. He has extensive knowledge about woods and has been part of developing wood production methods and planning a production line.

Early August every year Morten is a artist driver at Notodden Blues Festival and has been doing so for the past 21 years. His knowledge and direct connection to artist that has passed thru Notodden Blues Festival is extensive.

Pawel is consistent and persistent character. The attitude is if it can be tweaked it will be tweaked, which is rewarding for everyone involved.

Pawel's objective is a seamless visual expression that underlines the values of the brand and presents its vision in the desired and the understandable way possible, by the target audience.

NorwegianWoodPickers are constantly on the search for artists thru concert venues, festivals and social media. We reach out to musicians across the globe that inspire us, that has that certain energy, and let them try our picks. The decision to join our team is completely up to the artist.

Endorsement deals are initiated, now we need to work out the details with the individual artists. Delivery of the first picks, for testing, was at Notodden. This process is rather slow, but we want to be able to send them more picks to try, their feedback can assist us in creating even better picks.

“It changed the way I look at the guitar pick.”
— Ross MacKenzie

Jimmy Henderson, guitarist for Dorothy Moore and Black Oak Arkansas, played the entire show at Notodden Blues Festival last year with a Oak pick I had given him the night before. It takes confidence to do that after playing fifty years with a plastic pick. Jimmy Henderson is now one of our endorsed guitarists.

“The speed and accuracy of conventional picks — with the warmth and richness of fingertips! Still discovering subtle nuances.”
— Jimmy Henderson

We had a chance to meet Bill Wyman, Albert Lee and Terry Taylor backstage after Bill Wyman's Rhythm Kings' show in Ål, Hallingdal some months ago. We had made a 5.0 mm Peroline Beech and a 2.5 mm Ågåt Apple pick for Wyman. He accepted though he told me he never plays with a pick, even on guitar writing songs. Still it was a thrill to meet such a historical figure.

Albert Lee and Terry Taylor both got a box with Myrthild Apple split picks. Albert Lee thought they would be good for acoustic. They both really liked the Silver Kebony and Copper Apple when we showed them what the Custom Shop can craft.

Blue Mood Records signed artists, Marcus Løvdal and Bjørn Blix of Marcus Løvdal Band, recently became familiar with our picks and are now endorsed.

“I’ll never play plastic again.”
— Max Mortensen

We include bass players in our concept and as endorsed artists. This allows us to connect with an even greater audience. We recently added singer and songwriter Tor R. Seidemann Stavenes as endorsed artist.

We collect logs, split, dry and cut them into boards, then down to 40 cm x 4 cm ready to be thickness sanded and made ready for the cnc router that we lease time on at Husemoens Gitarmakeri. We do not cut down trees to make guitar picks. We never will. We collect trees or parts of trees that professional tree choppers or others have chopped down or trees that have fallen due to wind and other freak of nature occurrences. A great deal of our very limited beautiful and unique woods is donated by private persons who want to contribute to NorwegianWoodPickers. We work hard to be accepted by The Rainforest Foundation or the Rainforest Alliance.

We recycle what we can and strive to be a green business. The vintage cloth that comes with the tiny wood shipping crate is recycled from old canvas camping tents we collect from different sources, usually from private people. We boil the cloth and clean it so it is free from dust, sand and particles accumulated over time. Some of the tents we have collected are from the early 1970's and the worn, faded color is simply perfect. Some of the machines and tools we use are also vintage. They made great, solid machines back in the day and they still are. The prices are much lower and there are machine tools auctions and used markets for this purpose.

We are in no way opposed to new technology, we just realize that many of the tools and machines we use are easily acquired used and does the job perfect.

For the early development stages NorwegianWoodPickers applied for a $20.000.- business start up grant from Innovation Norway and got approved July 17th. 2013. We developed designs, trademarks, business plans, budgets, collaborators, machine and raw material suppliers, relations with artists, goals and a tight vision.

With your support of our Indiegogo campaign we really hope to start production on a commercial scale. Should this be the case we will commit ourselves to keep crafting an excellent product at competitive prices. We have no idea what the response may be with this campaign. Maybe we will be back at the wood shop on monday or maybe we are on for an adventure. That is all up to you.

All contributions, even if we never reach our goal of $5.000.- will be spent on the following areas:

  1. Thickness sander. This is our main tool for consistency and accuracy prepping rods for production.
  2. International marketing and social media outreach.
  3. Raw materials such as gold, silver, copper, brass, aluminum and bone.
  4. Packaging design, pick envelopes, pick specification tags, tiny wood shipping crates, vintage cloth and other underpinning material.

We believe that using Indiegogo will place us on the map worldwide and increase sales thru the web shop and greatly contribute to build our customer and fan base. With this campaign and your contribution we want to reach more guitar players and give them a chance to experience the nuances.


Building a successful company in todays extremely competitive market is a great challenge in itself and having a great product alone is sometimes not enough. Creating a brand is even more challenging and more time consuming because you are looking for all the details that underlines the story and quality of the product.

A graphic designer in the early stage of development was essential to create a solid framework around the product i.e. packaging, website and the story behind the concept. Graphic designer Pawel Bilas has worked with the project for almost three years, creating profile, types, website, prints and other marketing media. He also creates our presentation material and edits our films. Having a graphic designer with personal interests in the project is essential to create a tight visual brand identity. It is all in the details.

The brand visibility thru Indiegogo, the supported websites and social platforms to promote the campaign is simply genius. We greatly appreciate that there is such a platform for small businesses to hopefully turn into bigger businesses, something that would have taken years to achieve back in the day. We have worked really hard to minimize risk, and overcome major challenges before launching this campaign.

There are producers of wood picks on the market today that are brilliant at what they do and we admire their products. However, our research indicates that we are the only company in the world that produces this kind of wood/metal laminate pick. We have secured design protection with The Norwegian Patent Board.

There is no doubt that NorwegianWoodPickers picks are some of the most expensive guitar picks on the market, with the price of raw materials, Norwegian taxes, labor cost and other expenses needed to run a business in Norway. There are high end acetate picks on the market today costing $35 and up and there are wood picks costing $4-5.- and up. We believe our product prices are not an issue at all. Picks are tools just like strings and there are guitarists changing strings on all guitars before every show. It is the preference of the guitarist. If a guitar tech. orders a box of twelve Custom Shop picks for his boss for a tour, the tour coffee budget is still probably higher than the cost of the picks. It is a tool. It is an expense.

“When you pay too much, you lose a little money — that is all. When you pay too little, you sometimes lose everything, because the thing you bought is incapable of doing the thing it was bought to do.”
— John Ruskin, British Writer and Social Critic

 

Norway, with little over 5 million people, has its limitations for such a product. Showing products and meeting distributors at NAMM and Frankfurt Musikkmesse is essential. We are competing with established brands and being a small business in Norway like we are, it is almost impossible to set aside budgets to attend these shows. With your contribution we will be able to travel and expose us to distributors in foreign markets and create awareness that there is a new unique, stellar product on the market eager to compete with high end music accessories manufactures.

Extensive testing of prototypes over the past three years working with guitarist has made us believe we are ready for the global market. However, some adjustments along the way will probably be necessary and are inevitable. This may result in delayed production or shipment in some instances. We will of course do our absolute best to ensure that does not happen. We have everything under control.

We have decided to set up our Indiegogo campaign with the InDemand option, this will increase our global visibility and reach, and gives us the opportunity to continue our Picks for Perks and introduce new perks as we move forward.

Does wood guitar picks wear faster than acetate or celluloid picks?

Yes. But this greatly depends on if you are a professional guitarist who gigs two hundred days of the year or a bedroom player or noodler.

Does wood/metal picks wear faster than acetate or celluloid picks?

Yes and no. The wood wears down to the metal. From the moment it is played in it keeps the shape and the metal wears real slow.

Does the wood/metal picks and wood picks need to be played in?

Yes. Your angle of attack and the way you hold the pick ultimately shapes the wood at the tip of the pick to your style of playing.

It just seems so expensive for a guitar pick?

As mentioned in Risks & Challenges, there are high end acetate and celluloid picks on the market today costing $35.- and up, and there are wood picks costing from $4—5.- and up. Product price is the result of effort, lubur, time and material. Norway is a fairly expensive country to establish a business in.

Even if you do not play guitar you can help us reach out and create awareness about our guitar picks. And if you do know someone who plays guitar, our Picks for Perks could be the perfect gift for a guitar player and maybe you can contribute to their never ending quest for tone.

 

You can like our Facebook or Twitter page, or follow us on Instagram.
We do not spam updates, but like to show some of our work and maybe share a link to an endorsed artist album release or concert. Our Instagram is our mood board where we try to capture images of wild nature and the old way of living in Norway. From time to time we will visit remote farms or peculiar places in search of woods or landscapes to photograph and would like to share this with you. This will give them a sense of where their picks are crafted and they can connect even further with the brand.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools, we know they would greatly appreciate that.

Thank you for viewing our campaign and considering contributing to NorwegianWoodPickers. We appreciate you sharing it with your friends and help us change the guitarists perception of the guitar pick.

Thor M. Renslemo, Morten I. Bjella & Pawel Bilas
Nesbyen, Hallingdal; May 17th, 2015

For business inquires please contact us thru our email.

"NorwegianWoodPickers" and "To Pick Wood, or Not To Pick Wood" are registered trademarks of NorwegianWoodPickers. "Fine Tiny Musical Instruments" and "Experience The Nuances" trademarks applied for. Photographs © Thor M. Renslemo
story_txt:
I play guitar every day. I love the blues and I love the feel of a handcrafted guitar in my hands. But I never liked the feel of the acetate or celluloid picks.
                       
                        
My nephew, Simen, hand carved two guitar picks of beech wood for me as a gift when he was twelve or so, six years ago. He even took the time to carve out my name, TH on one side and OR on the other. Those beech wood guitar picks changed the tone of my '91 Corona Fender Stratocaster and my Seagull acoustic.
                    


                        All Wood Series Oak.
                    

                        In the following months I handcrafted a few wood picks for myself and noticed the distinct tone differences in woods, thickness and tips. I crafted over a hundred wood picks, playing them hard, giving them to guitarist friends, wanting feedback from working guitarists. The feedback turned out to be amazing, they all wanted to play with my wood picks. The wood picks rounded off the sound, created a warmer, smooth tone. This took away some mids, added base and shaved the highs.
                       
                        
                            
                    I wondered if I could get a much brighter tone going in the other direction. I had tried playing with a coin and some primitive metal picks years ago and the thought manifested itself. Prototypes of wood/metal picks crafted, laminating a thin piece of metal between two pieces of wood, to see if a laminate pick can endure countless hours of constant beating onstage without breaking apart. The result was unreal! Experiencing fundamental tone changes in my guitars, NorwegianWoodPickers Custom Shop was conceived, high end guitar picks for professional guitarists.

                    


                        Custom Shop Ågåt Apple/Brass.
                    

                        Wood picks is, by far, not a new idea. What our research and prototypes developed into, is something we believe separates our picks from other brands. NorwegianWoodPickers wood/metal and wood guitar picks is a tone changing tool for professional guitarists. Handcrafted with care, enthusiasm and admiration for wood as the perfect material for crafting Fine Tiny Musical Instruments.

                    

                        Just like a guitar, someone actually cared for you to have your guitar. You can not build a guitar and not care. We care.
                    

                        Thor M. Renslemo
                    
Creator & Owner





                        The one thing that separates great products from good products are often the attention to details and the no compromise attitude. There is a reason an expensive guitar do not come in a anonymous cardboard box. For a small company, like ours, it is essential not to take any shortcuts along the way, but to stay true to the initial challenge of creating a high end product with emphasis on product presentation. 
                    


                                Custom Shop Myrthild Oak/Brass.
                    


                                Custom Shop Sønni Oak/Silver.
                    

                        We want to change the guitarists perception of the guitar pick, as mentioned, the most overlooked piece of gear in a guitarist rig. Guitarists use different guitars, strings, pedals and amps to get the tone desired. Playing a NorwegianWoodPickers pick for the first time is much like playing a new guitar. Experiment, try different combinations, adjust tone, find your sweet spot. It is important that you let your fingers get used to the thicker gauge and weight, specially if you play with wood/metal pick. Some players will adjust quicker than others, but the transition should become obvious after a little while. 
                    

                        If our Custom Shop guitar picks drastically changes the sound of the guitar and opens it is tonality and maybe true potential, is it worth it? If we listen to all the guitarists we have met the past years, our customers and the artist we now endorse, it is worth it. We believe in them, they believe in us.

                        Research indicates that there are about one million professional guitar players in the world, twenty million bedroom players and thirty million noodlers.                     
                    

                        It has taken three years to get to the point where our product has reached the level of craftsmanship and precision desired. We are ready to expand production capabilities, both All Wood Series and Custom Shop and launch internationally. With your help we can make a tiny dent in the music instrument and accessories business which recently passed an annual sales of twenty billion dollars.
                    
                        Source: NAMM, National Association of Music Merchants


“Maybe one bright sunny day we all wake up and open
a guitar case with a brand new guitar with a special tag attached to the headstock
- Please consider NOT playing this Fine Precision Handcrafted Wood
Instrument with acetate or celluloid pick!”

                        — Thor 
                    





                    NorwegianWoodPickers launched at Notodden Blues Festival 2014. The festival management let us introduce our picks backstage and we got an amazing response from artists like Keb' Mo', Paul Sherry, Davy Watson, Mike Anderson, Jimmy Henderson, Dave Fields, Marcus Løvdal and Bjørn Blix. 
                    


                        Jimmy Henderson plays a Myrthild Oak 1.8 mm pick at a show with Dorothy Moore at Notodden Church, August 2nd 2014. Melvin "Housecat" Hendrex on keyboard.
                    


                        Keb' Mo' and Thor backstage at Notodden. Keb' tried several picks and quickly found a favorite, Hedda Apple Copper.
                    

                        The guitarists at Notodden Blues Festival and other guitarists we have worked with since have really given this project a momentum forward.  
                    

                        Since Notodden we have crafted guitar picks for norwegian guitarist and other foreign greats. I sat down with Tim Scott McConnell before a show. He tried many of my designs, he really noticed the difference in tone on his 12 string Taylor. We gave him a couple of Apple picks to take with, but we all know he is a fingerpicker.
                    




                            Perks for our campaign are high end wood/metal and wood guitar picks. We chose Oak, Ash, Blood Beech and Kebony Maple. Gold, Silver, Copper and Brass. We selected round tip for our campaign, a tip we know works well
for most styles of playing. Blunt, Sharp and Carved edge will be available

We do not cut down trees to make guitar picks. We never will. We collect trees or parts of trees that professional tree choppers or others have chopped down or trees that have fallen due to wind and other freak of nature occurrences. A great deal of our very limited beautiful and unique woods is donated by private persons who want to contribute to NorwegianWoodPickers. We work hard to be accepted by The Rainforest Foundation or the Rainforest Alliance. 
                    

                    We recycle what we can and strive to be a green business. The vintage cloth that comes with the tiny wood shipping crate is recycled from old canvas camping tents we collect from different sources, usually from private people. We boil the cloth and clean it so it is free from dust, sand and particles accumulated over time. Some of the tents we have collected are from the early 1970's and the worn, faded color is simply perfect. Some of the machines and tools we use are also vintage. They made great, solid machines back in the day and they still are. The prices are much lower and there are machine tools auctions and used markets for this purpose. 
                    

                    We are in no way opposed to new technology, we just realize that many of the tools and machines we use are easily acquired used and does the job perfect. 
                    




                    For the early development stages NorwegianWoodPickers applied for a $20.000.- business start up grant from Innovation Norway and got approved July 17th. 2013. We developed designs, trademarks, business plans, budgets, collaborators, machine and raw material suppliers, relations with artists, goals and a tight vision.
                    




                    With your support of our Indiegogo campaign we really hope to start production on a commercial scale. Should this be the case we will commit ourselves to keep crafting an excellent product at competitive prices. We have no idea what the response may be with this campaign. Maybe we will be back at the wood shop on monday or maybe we are on for an adventure. That is all up to you.

                    All contributions, even if we never reach our goal of $5.000.- will be spent on the following areas: 
                    


                        Thickness sander. This is our main tool for consistency and accuracy prepping rods for production. 
                    

                        International marketing and social media outreach.

Raw materials such as gold, silver, copper, brass, aluminum and bone.


                        Packaging design, pick envelopes, pick specification tags, tiny wood shipping crates, vintage cloth and other underpinning material.  
                    


                    We believe that using Indiegogo will place us on the map worldwide and increase sales thru the web shop and greatly contribute to build our customer and fan base. With this campaign and your contribution we want to reach more guitar players and give them a chance to experience the nuances.





                        Building a successful company in todays extremely competitive market is a great challenge in itself and having a great product alone is sometimes not enough. Creating a brand is even more challenging and more time consuming because you are looking for all the details that underlines the story and quality of the product. 
                    

                        A graphic designer in the early stage of development was essential to create a solid framework around the product i.e. packaging, website and the story behind the concept. Graphic designer Pawel Bilas has worked with the project for almost three years, creating profile, types, website, prints and other marketing media. He also creates our presentation material and edits our films. Having a graphic designer with personal interests in the project is essential to create a tight visual brand identity. It is all in the details. 
                    

                        The brand visibility thru Indiegogo, the supported websites and social platforms to promote the campaign is simply genius. We greatly appreciate that there is such a platform for small businesses to hopefully turn into bigger businesses, something that would have taken years to achieve back in the day. We have worked really hard to minimize risk, and overcome major challenges before launching this campaign.

                        There are producers of wood picks on the market today that are brilliant at what they do and we admire their products. However, our research indicates that we are the only company in the world that produces this kind of wood/metal laminate pick. We have secured design protection with The Norwegian Patent Board. 
                    

                    There is no doubt that NorwegianWoodPickers picks are some of the most expensive guitar picks on the market, with the price of raw materials, Norwegian taxes, labor cost and other expenses needed to run a business in Norway. There are high end acetate picks on the market today costing $35 and up and there are wood picks costing $4-5.- and up. We believe our product prices are not an issue at all. Picks are tools just like strings and there are guitarists changing strings on all guitars before every show. It is the preference of the guitarist.
If a guitar tech. orders a box of twelve Custom Shop picks for his boss for a tour, the tour coffee budget is still probably higher than the cost of the picks. It is a tool. It is an expense. 
                    

“When you pay too much, you lose a little money — that is all. When you pay too little, you sometimes lose everything, because the thing you bought is incapable of doing the thing it was bought to do.”

                     — John Ruskin, British Writer and Social Critic                                   


                     
                    

                    Norway, with little over 5 million people, has its limitations for such a product. Showing products and meeting distributors at NAMM and Frankfurt Musikkmesse is essential. We are competing with established brands and being a small business in Norway like we are, it is almost impossible to set aside budgets to attend these shows. With your contribution we will be able to travel and expose us to distributors in foreign markets and create awareness that there is a new unique, stellar product on the market eager to compete with high end music accessories manufactures. 
                    


                    Extensive testing of prototypes over the past three years working with guitarist has made us believe we are ready for the global market. However, some adjustments along the way will probably be necessary and are inevitable. This may result in delayed production or shipment in some instances. We will of course do our absolute best to ensure that does not happen. We have everything under control. 
                    


                    We have decided to set up our Indiegogo campaign with the InDemand option, this will increase our global visibility and reach, and gives us the opportunity to continue our Picks for Perks and introduce new perks as we move forward. 
                    




                    Does wood guitar picks wear faster than acetate or celluloid picks?  
                    

                        Yes. But this greatly depends on if you are a professional guitarist who gigs two hundred days of the year or a bedroom player or noodler. 
                    

                    Does wood/metal picks wear faster than acetate or celluloid picks? 
                    

                        Yes and no. The wood wears down to the metal. From the moment it is played in it keeps the shape and the metal wears real slow.

                    

                    Does the wood/metal picks and wood picks need to be played in?  
                    

                        Yes. Your angle of attack and the way you hold the pick ultimately shapes the wood at the tip of the pick to your style of playing.

                    

                    It just seems so expensive for a guitar pick?  
                    

                        As mentioned in Risks & Challenges, there are high end acetate and celluloid picks on the market today costing $35.- and up, and there are wood picks costing from $4—5.- and up. Product price is the result of effort, lubur, time and material. Norway is a fairly expensive country to establish a business in.
                    




                    Even if you do not play guitar you can help us reach out and create awareness about our guitar picks. And if you do know someone who plays guitar, our Picks for Perks could be the perfect gift for a guitar player and maybe you can contribute to their never ending quest for tone. 
                    

                     
                    
You can like our Facebook or Twitter page, or follow us on Instagram.
                    
                    We do not spam updates, but like to show some of our work and maybe share a link to an endorsed artist album release or concert. Our Instagram is our mood board where we try to capture images of wild nature and the old way of living in Norway. From time to time we will visit remote farms or peculiar places in search of woods or landscapes to photograph and would like to share this with you. This will give them a sense of where their picks are crafted and they can connect even further with the brand.


                    Please use the Indiegogo share tools, we know they would greatly appreciate that. 
                    

                     Thank you for viewing our campaign and considering contributing to NorwegianWoodPickers. We appreciate you sharing it with your friends and help us change the guitarists perception of the guitar pick. 
                    

                    Thor M. Renslemo, Morten I. Bjella & Pawel Bilas
                    
                    Nesbyen, Hallingdal; May 17th, 2015
                    


                    For business inquires please contact us thru our email. 
                    

                    "NorwegianWoodPickers" and "To Pick Wood, or Not To Pick Wood" are registered trademarks of NorwegianWoodPickers. "Fine Tiny Musical Instruments" and "Experience The Nuances" trademarks applied for.
Photographs © Thor M. Renslemo

story:
: : Exclusive Offers : :

We are so excited to offer new KIMONO pocket purse exclusively for IndieGoGo. 

This is Very First Look!  


: : Design : : 

Kimono Pocket Purse

~Japanese Kimono Touch~


#TESAGE * KINCHAKU

~Drawstring Purse Organizer~


 :Features of KIMONO Pocket Purse:


Almighty Pocket

Big enough to put your phone, metro card, eyeglass case, plastic bottle, etc.

    

    


3 Way Strap



: : Features of Kinchaku : :


Organize Your Purse

~Bag in Bag~


Move from Purse to Purse

~Transport KINCHAKU Easily~



: : Specifications : :


3 way Strap Mesearment 1 1/2" width (6.35 cm)

Short Strap: 15" (38 cm)  Length

Long Strap: 30" - 56.5"   (76 - 143.5 cm) Length


Size of KINCHAKU: 

 12" x 12" (30.48 x 30.48 cm), and 6"(15.24 cm) high front pockets


  • Inner Fabric: micro-fiber Water Resistant

 


  • Purse Body Fabric Pattern




  • Durability Test 

* Look! What you can carry! *


Who we are

TESAGE by Yukiko Sato New York is 15 Years Old

TESAGE (purse in Japanese) was started as a purse design studio based in Long Island City, New York, in 2000. Each TESAGE product is lovingly handcrafted out of the finest fabrics: microfiber, 100% cotton, and vegan leather fabrics. TESAGE designer, Yukiko Sato has been conveying Japanese traditions into her own simple modern design. Although Kinchaku is lighter and smaller, it would contain more personal belongings than zipper pouches. We are seeking not only creative designs in fashion, but also durability and functionality. 

Our motto is to deliver Big Smiles (^^)


Production Process 

Holiday Gift-giving Production Timeline
Production for first 36 KINCHAKUs and KIMONO Pocket Purses in April
5/10  Mother's Day --------------  Deliver on 5/1X
Production for second 36 KINCHAKUs and KIMONO Pocket Purse in May
6/14  Flag Day --------------------  Deliver on 6/1X
Production for next 36 KINCHAKUs and KIMONO Pocket Purse in June
7/4  Independence Day --------  Deliver on 6/26X

* More perks? we will be so happy to create more and let you know when it will be deliver via email. 

* Fabric availability subject to change

FAQ's

  • When can I get it?
Check with our production plan above. If you don't receive a notification email of your order to deliver on time, please contact us to get immediate correspondence. 

  • Is it machine washable?
Yes! Both Kimono Pocket Purse and Kinchaku are machine washable. We usually recommend hand washing, but you can also use the gentle cycle on a washing machine. Does your machine have a "delicate" or "hand wash" cycle? If so, those are the ones you need to use. 

  • Can I customize the colors?
Of course! We offer Kimono Pocket Purse with 3 different patterns and Kinchaku with 7 different patterns. Check the available selections below. You can create your own combination of Kimono Pocket Purse and Kinchaku. 
Please contact us via email TESAGE@YukikoSato.com

         

     (A)  Nu Kasuli Gray                   (B)  Current Red                       (C)  Zen Black

                      

    (1)  Nu Kasuli Gray             (2)  Mod MochaChino Dots            (3)  Current Red

                       

       (4)  Leaf Dots                             (5)  En Gardens                       (6)  Espresso Kasuli 

(7)  Mod ChacoChino Dots


  • Can I carry my laptop?
Yes, you can. You have an enough space to carry your laptop in Kimono Pocket Purse. Just in case, we recommend you to put your laptop in a sleeve case. 


  • What is Kinchaku?
In tradition, Kinchaku is used as a Bento lunch bag in Japan. We thought that Kinchaku is also perfect for a drawstring purse organizer. Our Kinchaku is something different from others:
(1) 4 outside pockets to put more of your personal belongings
(2) lined in the finest microfiber fabrics that is water resistant
(3) it is durable and machine washable!


  • Is the pocket of Kimono Pocket Purse removable?
The pocket  is not removable. We concern the safety of your personal belongings. We don't want you to loose any of your important things. Also, the pocket is there for working as a closure cover of the purse, so you will be happy that is attached.

Risk & Challenges

We have a great craftsmanship in local-based studio in USA. We have already successfully produced TESAGE products and delivered to deadline, so we are confident that production risk is at a minimum.

Orders are available on a First-come, First-served (FCFS) basis. If the fabric goes out of stock, we will ask you to substitute for your order.


Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand that the situation you just can't contribute. If you share our story with your friends or click our share buttons below, we're so much grateful. 


Live Chat >> https://app.purechat.com/w/bf3dg

TESAGE support American Craft Artists: http://www.gofundme.com/handmadeUS

story:
100% of it will be given to Nomi Network. It is so hard to believe sex trafficking exists 27 million adults & 13 million children are a slave today. Nomi Network gives opportunities to survivors in Cambodia and India to be financially self sufficient, by creating T-Shirts, Bags extra collaborating with Fashion designers. Find out more at the website below: nominetwork.org

Giving can truly heal and restore the recipient and the giver.

story:
MY (very brief) STORY

In 1973 I got my first after-school job. It was with a corset specialist shop catering to women in non-standard sizes. Real women.  I was 13 when introduced to lingerie and I never stopped loving it. But life took me on another road into the corporate world and until now it hasn't been possible for me to return to my first passion.

Now it is. 

You can help me make a dream come through; a dream of designing and producing handmade luxurious lingerie to modern women.


WHY?

Life for the modern woman is hectic, high-tech and standardized. Most of her wardrobe is produced on assembly lines on the other side of the world, wrapped in plastic and shipped in containers. Her lingerie strives to mold and form her body into a generic idea of beauty.

I want to honor the modern woman’s body exactly as it is; with no restrictions, no metal wires, no padding. Just the feel of silk or cotton directly on the skin. I want to give her a feeling of stepping back in time on this one point: her lingerie. Back to a time, where clothes were made by selected silks, cut and sewn by hand, before carefully wrapped in tissue paper. I want her to know that what she is wearing next to her skin, has been made by somebody who cares.


WHAT I NEED

I am hoping to get sufficient funding to put two initial collections into production, create a web page, design logo and company profile and hire a part-timer for PR.  If I don't reach the full funding, I will complete one collection and sell that on existing retail platforms. Iwill get started :-).

The budget for starting up is US$ 25.000 and breaks down like this:

If you're not able to help in a financial way, I hope you will let your friends know we are launching Haute Couture Lingerie. That would mean a lot to me. 


WHAT YOU GET

Aside from my gratitude, you will get a taste of Haute Couture Lingerie. Depending on your contribution, you may receive a personal letter, an ongoing account, a pair of silk briefs, or a set of silk lingerie or sleep wear.


Please note that the photos are taken by me, just as I have sewn the models. These are just meant to give you an idea of the look and feel of the product. 


CHALLENGES

The greatest challenge in this first phase of the business, will be to sell the product. To this extent I rely heavily on PR and social media. I have a young women in mind, who is very accomplished in these matters. I plan to use her services part time in the beginning and together with her, devise a plan of killer social media marketing.

The second greatest challenge is the quality of the product. I plan to conduct quality control on every single item myself in the first time of the business. Until I feel certain, we have processes and competences in place to meet the high quality requirements we must have, to call ourselves  “haute couture”

story:
Hey Shoe Lovers and those who love us! Have you paid attention to the fact that we find creative ways in our home to sort and protect our shoes? Some of us use clear containers, storage bags, boxes or whatever is available. However, when it’s time to travel were only left with the option to place our shoes in a luggage with other items unorganized and in a manner that could damage them. My name is Denise Hare and I have patented a product that is a definite must-have for consumers worldwide. Being an avid Shoe Lover who takes pride in protecting my shoes, I have shopped extensively for a product of its kind.  I have tried big box, boutique and specialty retailers to no avail. Therefore I decided to create it!

The Travel Shoe Closet is a multi-compartment luggage specifically designed to accommodate multiple pairs of shoes in a way which prevents damage and allows them to be easily transported. This clever invention will save consumers frustration during the packing process, time and money. The design itself allows for an easier view to access shoes and storage of toiletries/accessories. It has swivel wheels and a retractable pull handle. The added bonus is that the item has the function of being used at home.

I still want to purchase this item.  But what is absolutely breathtaking is that everyone I share the idea with does too! My dream is to see the Travel Shoe Closet in mass production and available to Shoe Lovers globally. Your funds will bring this dream to fruition. This campaign will provide the funding needed to take the invention to its next step.  With the $25,000 I am seeking, I will have a prototype made and begin the 1st stage of manufacturing.

To those who contribute to this campaign, thank you so very much. For all of you, please help in any way you can including utilizing the IndieGoGo share tool and any avenue you prefer to share my product and story. I invite you all to visit my website at www.travelshoecloset.com where you will find even more information and social media tools to share with your friends and contacts.

Cheers!

Denise Hare

Inventor/Shoe Lover
