story:
Imagine if making a difference in the world were as easy as getting dressed for the day. The Acoustic Collective makes that a reality.

Eco Organic Ethical Apparel 

100% of profits donated to:

Protect the Ocean & Environment, Rescue Animals, End Poverty and Enrich Humanity. 

Born from surf, adventure and incredible experiences, our collection is crafted to look feel and DO good.  Help Change the World by preordering today.  

You choose where the money from your purchase goes! (once this campaign ends we'll send you a form to select your desired item from our webstore and the charity program to donate the profits to) 

THE IMPACT:  Feels Good & Does Good. 

The Acoustic Collective exists to better the world, not profit from it.  Every time you purchase one of our pieces, Good happens   With your involvement, we can make a paradigm shift for the future of humanity and protect this wonderful blue planet we live on. Here are a few ways we can have impact once we are up and running: 

Our quest is to spread joy, raise awareness and bring positive change through apparel, ambassadors, photos, films, art, music, and stories.   Starting with a handful of incredibly soft and comfortable pieces and expanding into an entire line of fashionable functional outerwear,  all Acoustic profits will go to projects that have a positive impact around the world.  Everything we create will always be eco-friendly and ethically sourced, because what is the point of outerwear that ruins the outer world?  

We are a growing community of adventurers, artisans, surfers, athletes, musicians, chillers and changemakers who live with passion and purpose.  

A simple vision:  Live From the Heart

 It’s a way of life.  Be a Part of it.  #livacoustic 

Become a Backer by pre-ordering apparel (claim a perk on the right) 

How it works:

1. Become a backer by pre-ordering Acoustic Apparel (select one of the Perks on the right) or Back it (at the top) Note: we do not have to reach the goal to get you the perks!   See apparel below. 

2. Once this campaign has ended we'll send you a form - you can select anything available in the Acoustic webstore.  If you choose egift card - you can also use it on any future Acoustic collections.   

3. We create the Summer/Fall collection and ship you the goods! (est. July 2017)

4.  We create the 2018 samples & lookbook, take orders from shops and create the Winter /Spring 18 Collection.  The pieces will then be made available in the webstore! 

100% of Profits are Donated.  Really? 

Yes! We’re going all in. Here is where the money goes: 

1. The charity programs:  To protect the ocean and environment, rescue animals,  end poverty in a way that is environmentally sustainable, and enrich humanity.  You can learn more about the charity programs or donate directly to them 

2.  The ambassador program: to further athletic, artistic and creative pursuits of inspiring individuals who give everything to their calling.  Ambassadors will play an integral role in charity programs while advocating and inspiring positive change worldwide.  

  Buyers will be able to choose which program receives funding at checkout.  When you pre-order apparel here, you will be able to choose which program on the form we send you once the campaign ends.  

THE APPAREL

ECO-FRIENDLY:  Because what is the point of outer wear that ruins the outer world?   Let’s keep earth incredible & explorable.  Acoustic apparel will be crafted with the finest environmentally conscious fabrics: organic cotton, bamboo blend, tencel, hemp and recycled poly. We use only Low impact dyes and water based inks.  Many of the pieces will be brought to life using wind and solar power. Most people wouldn’t dump a barrel of toxic waste into the waters of their local beach, but the pollution resulting from non-organic cotton and other made made fibers do just that worldwide.  

ETHICALLY SOURCED: To honor the people who bring our ideas and designs to life. We refuse to support exploitative practices and aim to eliminate sweatshops, child labor and forced labor.  We believe in fair working conditions and uplifting people in every way possible. 

Ridiculously Soft and Comfortable:  Our mission is to craft adventure apparel that is lightweight and luxurious. 

THE PLAN   

PART A 

$26,000 Summer/Fall  Product creation 

          Men's and Women's: Tees, Tops, Hoodies, Hats, Beanies, Stickers, Patches 

$4,000 web development, product photography and marketing 

Once produced, the perk products will be shipped to backers, the remaining products will be available for purchase on the web store as well as in local surf shops and boutiques across the U.S. 

All profits from sales will be donated to the charity programs and ambassador fund. (Buyer will be able to choose which at checkout - backers will be able to choose which on the form sent at the end of this campaign!)  

PART B

$25,000 Winter/Spring '18 collection sample creation & production   

      Men’s and Women’s: long sleeve tops, board shorts, bikinis, yoga pants, comfy shorts, sundresses, and coats.  These will be created by experienced fashion designers. The funds go to the design and creation of the samples as well as a small run production of the line. 

$5,000 product photography, look book creation, web store development, and marketing

(The remaining funds cover the 5% platform fee and 2.9% card processing fee) 

Simple. Comfortable. Earth Friendly. Ethically Sourced. 100% of profits for good. 

 

THE PERKS: WHAT YOU GET

Eco Organic Ethical Goods for Good!

Choose anything from the Acoustic webstore.

Click here to SEE ALL

The Basics:   

A few Designs: 

click to SEE ALL (but please pre-order by claiming a perk on the right!) 

Click to SEE ALL (but please pre-order by claiming a perk on the right!) 

RISKS & CHALLENGES 

HOW IN THE WORLD WILL YOU DONATE 100 % OF PROFITS?

     Transparency is really important to us. Each year we will be releasing our financial information so everyone can follow the money. If you have any questions, please ask! 

Profit : a financial gain, especially the difference between the amount earned and the amount spent in buying, operating, or producing something.

  + Total sales 

        - the cost of making the apparel 

       - operational overhead (marketing, back stock, website maintenance, wages, etc) 

   = Total Profits

The Profits are what we donate to charity.  Not 1% or 5%.   100%.   Acoustic is a registered non-profit corporation -  we are truly committed to donating all of our profits for the benefit of earth & society.  

FLEXIBILITY: WHAT IF THE GOAL IS NOT REACHED? 

Even with a single contributor, we will still be able get you the goods!  But the closer we get to the goal, the more we can do for the charity programs right off the bat. 

Risks Part A:  Summer/Fall Collection

We’ve already overcome the challenge of crafting high quality goods at an affordable price, without exploiting people or the environment.   

We have the samples in hand and the materials, facility, and distribution are in place to produce the first collection.   

We will be creating a limited run of the designs, based on backer and shop orders. This minimizes initial costs and allows us to focus on producing only the most desired pieces. Upon completion of this campaign we will send a form to each backer that would like to order from the first collection.     

Risks Part B: Winter/Spring Collection: Samples & Lookbook

Sample creation is challenging.  But we'll be working with experienced fashion pattern makers to create simple, stunning, comfortable, and durable outerwear.    We’ve sourced the high quality eco friendly materials for each piece and have the production facility ready to create the line.   

Once the samples and look book are finalized, we’ll share with shops, take orders, and produce the Winter/Spring 18’ collection. The pieces will then be made available on the Acoustic web store. 

 

THE FOUNDERS 

“In our travels we kept finding the same issues plaguing each place we visited.  We did what we could to help, but wanted to find a way to have a bigger impact. We started imagining what would happen if an outdoor apparel company was built to better the world, rather than just profit from it.   We called it Acoustic.  Our original plan was to create an apparel collective that donated all proceeds to existing charity organizations.  But we discovered  1. There were no organizations addressing the work that needed to be done in the areas we traveled.    2. Most other ‘charity’ organizations we considered donating to pay excessive salaries to the top administration. We set out to remedy that: we formed both Acoustic (non-profit apparel collective) and The Acoustic Initiative (501c3 charity organization).  That way we could ensure the funds would have maximum impact.  We are happy to consider any charity organization as a recipient of Acoustic profits - provided the administrative overhead is minimal.”   Gary Lynn & Danielle Ciminero  

 

CONTACT

If you have any queries or requests, please contact us at:  info@liveacoustic.org

If you would like to volunteer in the charity programs:  volunteer@theacousticinitiative.org

 or apply to be an ambassador:  ambassador@liveacoustic.org 

You can also find our press kit

 

Follow & Join the Acoustic Collective:

       

www.liveacoustic.org

 

it’s about seeking majesty

in the mystery and the mundane

in ourselves 

 

it’s generosity, creativity and adventure

a life of passion and purpose 

 

it’s about human potential

collectively and individually 

reaching ours

 

it’s about laughter

chasing dreams

truly living 

 

it’s about planting seeds

of hope, health

and prosperity

 

it’s about gaining perspective

casting off the ego

evolving

 

it’s about community

doing what we can

making a difference

 

it’s about earth

healing, nourishing,

and renewal 

 

it’s about courage

and having enough

to find your way 

 

it’s a quest

an awareness

a way of life

 

it’s about infinite possibility

and the paths we take

 to unleash it.

 

Acoustic.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Jessica King, FIDM Los Angeles Campus Fashion Design Graduate.  
  • With a rapid growth, we are in need of expanding to a larger venue location but we need your help to make this possible to accommodate to our 250 guests and support our local artists and designers! 
  • You will help with the launch of my collection, King Design and De la Hacienda and contribute to a large success under the mentorship of LA Fashion Week. 
  • You will contribute to a quality experience for the many guests anticipating the debut of our fashion show.

Where will your money go?

  • Subsidizing the cost of large event space.
  • Access to higher quality sound and lighting to achieve a successful runway show.
  • Eliminate cost of food and drinks to provide for our special guests.
  • Provide a fair pay to hair and makeup team and models. 

The Impacts

How important is your contribution?

  • As founder, my goal is to provide a safe space and open opportunity to expose the raw talent many individuals have to offer. 
  • You will help with the rapid growth and reputation of this designer collective and its projects. (145 guests for the 1st annual event. Anticipated attendees 2017: 250+)
  • You will fuel the creativity of individuals that have the talent but not the means. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you might not be able to contribute. But that's okay! You can still help by:

  • Asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Attending the "I Am..." Fashion Show: June 24, 2017 (Address: 1827 S. Hope St., Los Angeles CA 90015)

With a rapid growth, we are in need of expanding to a larger venue location but we need your help to make this possible to accommodate to our 250 guests and support our local artists and designers! 
You will help with the launch of my collection, King Design and De la Hacienda and contribute to a large success under the mentorship of LA Fashion Week. 
You will contribute to a quality experience for the many guests anticipating the debut of our fashion show.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Attending the "I Am..." Fashion Show: June 24, 2017 (Address: 1827 S. Hope St., Los Angeles CA 90015)

story:
INTRODUCTION

The world is getting more and more durable. We’re all starting to care more about the world we live in. With shoo.se we want to help. There are so many shoes that can live a second life. With the help of shoo.se you will be able to buy and sell durable shoes all around the world.

WHY DO I NEED YOUR HELP?

I have the idea for a long time now: an online platform where people who love shoes can come together to buy and sell their shoes. A few months ago I found out that there are so many people that have shoes just laying around in their house and don't wear them anymore, but most of the time they are still are in very good shape. So I thought why not sell them, so I can buy new shoes or buy other second hand shoes. Then I thought why not build the platform I need, build in all the features that I would use myself. Here's where you come in, I need your help to make my dream a reality. The money will mostly be used to build the shoe platform. The rest of the money will be used to promote the platform and build the shoe community. 

THE GOAL

The goal of shoo.se is that people will come to our online shoe marketplace if they can find the shoes they're searching for, because there are plenty of good shoes out there that need new owners. It is much better to buy second hand shoes for low prices than cheap new shoes. You’ll get more quality for your money and probably do longer with your shoes then you would with cheap new shoes.

SOCIAL SHARE

Shoo.se is only on Instagram in the social media world. Check shoo.se out on Instagram for daily updates about our campaign. 

LITTLE PREVIEW

I have not yet started building the platform of course, but I can show you some of the sketches I made to give you a little preview of what's coming. When I start building shoo.se I will keep you updated, and will post previews & updates via Instagram.  

SPECS & FEATURES

  • Chat with the seller/buyer
  • Automatic payment (I don't handle your money, you will get it directly when you sell shoes)
  • Shoo.se keeps a high standard for quality
  • No shoes, money back
  • Easy filter to find the shoes you’re looking for
  • Your own shoe shop page
  • Invite your friends to join
  • Shoo.se filters out the bad quality shoes for you
  • Get featured on the homepage
  • And many more… The idea of the platform is that shoo.se keeps improving, so if you have some feature ideas you can always let me know!

Trust me it's going to be awesome!

TESTIMONIALS

I told some random people on the street what shoo.se is going to be. This is what some of them said:

“I really like that there is a middle man, it's a safe feeling.“

“If it’s done well, I like the idea that there are only good quality shoes.“

“Easy system to find my new shoes I think, for sure going to use it.“

"Really like the feature: No shoes, money back.”

"I like second hand shoes! So this platform is going to be perfect for me!"

"Finally a save place to sell my shoes."

Let me know what you think of shoo.se

REWARDS

$5,00 | Virtual high five

$25,00 | Your name on the wall of fame on the website, for life. And of course the high five.

$85,00 | A surprise bag with some cool stuff. And all above.

UPDATES

Don't want to back shoo.se via Indiegogo, but want to be updated when shoo.se launch? Then fill in your email here and I will keep you posted! If everything goes via plan shoo.se will launch the first of December.

If you have any questions send me a message or email me.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! My name is Kylie Jane, and I'm a South African gal currently living in Shanghai. I've always been passionate about creating and I've always wanted to create something unique to make others happier and healthier.  

Naturally Kjane is my passion project that I started towards the end of last year. It's an athleisure lifestyle brand focused on making women feel confident and comfortable, daily. I want to create a Naturally Kjane Kit with a cute yet sophisticated tote bag, sports bra, and leggings, that women can easily carry around with them, and use whether they're heading to gym, picking kids up from school or running errands. Naturally Kjane is all about giving women the choice to wear high quality products that are as unique as they are, comfortable and effortless to wear - like a second skin. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of this project is to raise enough funding to place the first order for 50 Naturally Kjane Kits! 50 is the minimum factory order requirement. This includes 50 marble sports bras and 50 black leggings packaged in 50 hand-crafted tote bags. Once these 50 kits are ready to go, Naturally Kjane will not only be able to reach women living here in Shanghai, but also in South Africa, and beyond.

What the 3 grand will help achieve:

  • $1 500 will go towards the first order of 50 sports bras, and 50 leggings
  • $500 will go towards 50 hand-crafted, customised tote bags 
  • $1 000 will go towards marketing - content creation and advertising 

If the funding goal is not reached, the money that is raised will go towards creating and marketing the tote bags alone, which will help raise funds towards the manufacturing of the sports bras and leggings. 

 

The Impact

Naturally Kjane is all about enhancing, and celebrating your body, as it is. Whether you're a complete yogi, or you prefer walking, or coffee catchups with friends, we get you. We want women to have the choice to feel comfortable, and still look gorgeous. 

Skinny is no longer the goal - nourishing and caring for your body is, which is vital in our fast-paced, busy lifestyles. Self-care and self-love are becoming increasingly important, and women are making more time for themselves and choosing health. We understand this, and support this. 

What Naturally Kjane stands for:

  • Comfort - giving woman a beautiful and super comfortable second skin to enhance their own
  • Effortlessness
  • Confidence 
  • Individuality 
  • High quality fabrics, design and products 

 

Risks & Challenges

There are very few risks involved in this project! The greatest challenge is the marketing of the product, and making sure it reaches the right audience who will want to try it and buy it, as opposed to buying the current activewear out there. 

I am a Digital Marketer, specialising in Social Media Marketing, so I'll be able to successfully market and distribute my product using e-commerce platforms, including my own blog, Amazon, Etsy, Instagram and Facebook. I will execute a strong marketing campaign, specifically using social media, to reach young females looking for effortless, beautiful, comfortable athleisure that will make them feel more confident. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, I'd love if you could contribute by spreading the word! And sharing the Naturally Kjane message - comfort, confidence, quality :)
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi everyone! My name is Kylie Jane, and I'm a South African gal currently living in Shanghai. I've always been passionate about creating and I've always wanted to create something unique to make others happier and healthier.  
Naturally Kjane is my passion project that I started towards the end of last year. It's an athleisure lifestyle brand focused on making women feel confident and comfortable, daily. I want to create a Naturally Kjane Kit with a cute yet sophisticated tote bag, sports bra, and leggings, that women can easily carry around with them, and use whether they're heading to gym, picking kids up from school or running errands. Naturally Kjane is all about giving women the choice to wear high quality products that are as unique as they are, comfortable and effortless to wear - like a second skin. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
The goal of this project is to raise enough funding to place the first order for 50 Naturally Kjane Kits! 50 is the minimum factory order requirement. This includes 50 marble sports bras and 50 black leggings packaged in 50 hand-crafted tote bags. Once these 50 kits are ready to go, Naturally Kjane will not only be able to reach women living here in Shanghai, but also in South Africa, and beyond.
What the 3 grand will help achieve:

$1 500 will go towards the first order of 50 sports bras, and 50 leggings
$500 will go towards 50 hand-crafted, customised tote bags 
$1 000 will go towards marketing - content creation and advertising 

If the funding goal is not reached, the money that is raised will go towards creating and marketing the tote bags alone, which will help raise funds towards the manufacturing of the sports bras and leggings. 
 

The Impact
Naturally Kjane is all about enhancing, and celebrating your body, as it is. Whether you're a complete yogi, or you prefer walking, or coffee catchups with friends, we get you. We want women to have the choice to feel comfortable, and still look gorgeous.

story:
MEET ​RAMZI. Designed with versatility and minimalism in mind, RAMZI can be expanded, flipped inside out, or used as is. Reversing the bag reveals the story of one of our makers, Ramzi. When you carry Ramzi's story, you carry our mission to connect newcomers to local societies and rebuild confidence through creativity. 

RAMZI is made by Makers Unite from recycled clothes waste yarn woven by Enschede Textielstad, here in The Netherlands. The straps, buckle, and tag are made from the lifejackets worn by refugees on their way to Europe - the same as in our flagship collection. RAMZI comes with a unique Makers Unite lifejacket tag. The iconic tag can be clipped onto the interior and exterior of the bag.  



WHO ARE WE? For the past few years, Makers Unite have been designing and implementing social inclusion programmes based on creating sustainable products together, the sales of which go back to fund these programmes. The act of making simple things in a group stimulates the collaborative engagement of participants. It enables dialogues that build trust step-by-step. The final stage for each participant is career planning and matchmaking to employment, internships, or further vocational training.


WHO IS RAMZI? Ramzi was born in Palestine in 1971. After realising a passion for craftmanship & tailoring, he moved to Syria to pursue his aspirations. For over 20 years he worked in a clothing factory there, specializing in clothing construction & patterning. After migrating to the Netherlands, Ramzi was seeking a job when he found Makers Unite.

Ramzi quickly showed himself to not only be filled to the brim with industry expertise, but also our fastest tailor to date. After a year working with us, we connected him with a position at SuitSupply, an international fashion brand based here in Amsterdam. He now works at one of their stores, adjusting suits for their wealth of clients.

story:
The Boston Convertible

The Boston Convertible was designed by 2 working women who, for years, had searched high and low for the perfect laptop bag but just couldn't find one that ticked all the boxes. Thus, the Boston Convertible was born. 

For the corporate woman needing uber-functionality, this laptop bag is the ultimate shoulder bag-to-backpack convertible. We've thought about YOU, and all the things you need to take you from work day to night out, from meetings to family commitments. 

Continue maintaining your professional look in Backpack Mode. Keep your hands free (yes, hold a coffee or two) and enjoy the ergonomic benefits of evenly distributed weight on your shoulders. 

The finer details haven't been lost on us either:

With clever layering of the card slot tucked away behind a phone pocket, we've maximised the space for easy access to all your essentials. Perfect for your travel card or security pass. 

 

Did we mention our key snap? Just snap it on and off - no more fiddly straps. 

Never lose your keys again. 

 

 

Who wants to carry around multiple glasses cases? Certainly not us! For some four-eyed ladies, (us included!) we have our regular glasses to wear as well as our prescription sunglasses. Slip your eyewear in and out with ease with our in-built, CRUSH-PROOF glasses pocket. 

 

 

Carry a bag that carries YOU through life. 
 

#BOSTONCONVERTIBLE

 

Finishing Touches

To keep you looking good, the Boston is crafted from 100% quality genuine leather in black and finished with luxe gold trims.

Make it yours: we provide up to 4 gold letters of your choice free of charge. Order more letters from www.thebagstyler.com to spell BOSS and MINX instead of KATE or SARA. 

 


Main Features: 

  • Laptop fit: Will fit all laptops up to 15" diagonal (e.g. MacBook Pro 15")
  • Glasses pocket: In-built and crush-proof. Your sunglasses within easy reach. 
  • Phone pocket: For all phone sizes
  • Easy access card slot: For travel or access pass for a convenient grab & tap
  • Key snap: Easy snap on and off - never lose your keys again
  • Zipper pockets: 2 x Internal - for documents or your lady essentials, 1 x External - hair pins or other bits & pieces
  • Trims: Gold finishes for the luxe taste
  • Backpack straps: ergonomic support and adjustable
  • Wide single shoulder strap: for maximum comfort
  • Material: 100% genuine quality cowhide grainy leather in classic black

 

The Perks

To keep things simple, we are offering just 2 perks: 

Perk 1: US$229 (RRP$299, save $70)

  • 1 x Boston Convertible
  • 4 x Gold Letters
  • 1 x Thank you

 

Perk 2: US$398 (RRP $598, save $200)

  • 2 x Boston Convertibles 
  • 8 x Gold Letters
  • 1 x $50 The Bag Styler Gift Voucher
  • 1 x Thank you

 

#BOSTONCONVERTIBLE

 

Why should you invest with us?

By contributing to our campaign, you will be transforming the lives of the professional woman on the go. Carrying a laptop all day can be cumbersome and the ergonomic support offered by a backpack compared to traditional laptop shoulder bag requires no further explanation. 

Rest assured, we have done this before! 
 

 

Visit www.thebagstyler.com to see our full range of successfully produced bags available for immediate purchase and delivery. We have well established relationships with our suppliers and factory partners for over 3 years. Have the confidence to invest in our campaign and be a part of The Boston Convertible coming to life. 

Help us reach our goal of $5000 to fund our initial production run by choosing one of our perks. If you choose to get 2 x Boston Convertibles, you'll save more, plus, you'll receive a $50 Gift Voucher to spend at our online store www.thebagstyler.com.
Top tip: find a friend/sister and buy it together!

After the campaign, The Boston will increase in price to US$299. Enjoy your savings by purchasing NOW in our campaign! 

This is a unique product that professional women NEED and will LOVE. Help us spread the word about the Boston Convertible by sharing this campaign.

 

Our Planned Timeline:

We will do our best to stay according to this timeline. We will keep you updated at every stage so you can rest assured your contribution is being put to good use. 

 

#BOSTONCONVERTIBLE

 

Who are we?

The Bag Styler Pty Ltd is a start up by Gabby and Clare, 2 working professionals who desperately needed a backpack appropriate for the office. 

Secrets about Gabby:
Gabby races to sun each morning to squeeze in her morning workout. She makes home-made vanilla essence to gift to her friends at Christmas. In her spare time, she's a pro at working with pretty pictures (aka marketing). 

 

Secrets about Clare:
Clare was a pianist in a former life and can play anything she hears. Now, she likes putting together IKEA furniture. In her spare time, she is an expert at organising messy folders and desks (aka business admin).

 

Visit: www.thebagstyler.com to see our existing range and for immediate delivery for worldwide shipping. 

Email: info@thebagstyler.com

Follow us: on Instagram and Facebook #thebagstyler @thebagstyler

 

Important design changes to note:

The pictures of our Boston Convertible here is a prototype. Though the main form of the bag will remain the same, we plan to make it even better with a few extra changes. 

Lining: Our video features our prototype bag with a plain black lining. Though this looks great already, we will be replacing this with a black & white pin stripe lining instead.

Why? It will make it easier to see and find your items, and besides, it looks fabulous. 

Backpack straps: These will be fixed on with dog clips for ease of use, instead of a thread through in the top D-ring as featured in the video. This will make it easier to use and stabilise

 

#BOSTONCONVERTIBLE

 

FAQs: 

1. When is production due to start?
We plan to go into production in July. 

2. When are you due to ship?
We plan to ship out your Boston in November so you can receive it in time for Christmas. We will be in touch with you if things change

3. What will The Boston Convertible cost after the campaign?
The RRP for the bag will be set at $299 from the conclusion of the campaign. Though this will be available through InDemand after the campaign has concluded, the price will reflect the new RRP. 

4. What if I want to fit 5 letters?
Our letters have been inspired by Century Gothic font. Some letters like W, C and M are very wide, whereas T, S, P and I are very narrow. 

We provide up to 4 letters free of charge. Extra letters can be ordered from www.thebagstyler.com. Best of all, the letters are already in stock and available for immediate delivery. Be sure to choose Gold to match your other letters here. But first, email us at info@thebagstyler.com to check if your 5 letter name will fit in the nameplate.

 

Confirmed 5 letter names that WILL fit: 

  • CLARE
  • IRENE
  • HOLLY
  • SARAH
  • ROSIE
  • KELLY

6. Are your goods ethically produced? What measures have you taken to ensure this?
We have seen and visited the factories and warehouses of our partners in China and Hong Kong with our own eyes. We have seen the conditions of the workplaces and were extremely satisfied with the level of ethical production, treatment of their workers and the WHS standards. These factories work with big name designer clients internationally which contributed to our confidence in liaising with these same company and factories. 

We visit our suppliers, factories and warehouses 3-4 times a year. 

7. Where are your bags made?
Our bags and metal parts are made in China and Hong Kong

8. Where will my item be shipped from?
Your Boston Convertible will be shipped directly from our logistics provider in Hong Kong. 

9. Do you offer guarantees? 
If you are unsatisfied with your product in any way, please email us at info@thebagstyler.com. We will rectify any faulty/damaged items, but no refunds will be provided for change of mind. 

10. Who designed the bags? Are they copies of designer brands?
No! We are very proud to be working with our Australian and Hong Kong designers and their expertise in creating a unique product. 

10. Does the price include postage and taxes?
All shipping and handling costs are included, but taxes will need to be borne by the recipient as local taxes will vary. 

11. What happens after I place my order? When and how do I choose my letters?
We will send you a separate form to complete at the conclusion of this campaign. Please keep an eye out for this!

story:
Introducing The Trophy Box

After noticing the lack of functionality in plastic shoeboxes on the market, we re-imagined footwear storage to solve the problems of the modern day shoe collector. We found the most common pain point’s collectors experience is storing, displaying, protecting and accessing their most prized possessions. We designed a solution with your needs mind; a unique way to store, display and protect your investment.

 

Features

Transparent 

Handcrafted with high quality acrylic for its transparency, the Trophy Box eliminates the hassle of pulling shoeboxes in search of the perfect pair. 

Stackable

The three-sided metal corners designed with interlocking grooves and ridges on two of its sides enabling Trophy Boxes to stack atop and aside one another without tumbling over. 

 

Retractable

Ball bearings guide and secure the inner box offering a seamless withdrawal and easy access to your shoes.

 

Quality

A flared grommet is capped over a finger-sized hole on the face of the box featuring the brands wordmark and circular logo along the collar.

 

Styles

The Trophy Box Collection

The Trophy Box Collection comes in ten sizes, five styles, offering one solution to accommodate every shoe collector. Custom sized options will be available upon request through our ecommerce site.

Women's Low Top & Women's High Top

Men's Low Top & Men's High Top

 

 

Sizes

 

Maintenance 

We recommend our acrylic cleaning product over soaps or detergents that are made with abrasives that scratch acrylic. Each backer will receive one sample sized Restoration Kit with their purchase. This kit comes with a Lint-Free Wipe, Microfiber Cloth and our acrylic Cleaner, Polisher and Protector.  

Trophy Boxes should also be stored in a temperature-controlled room as year-round heat can tarnish the acrylic. We recommend that no more than 10 Trophy Box be stacked at a time.

How to get your Trophy Box

  1. Select a Perk by clicking "Get This Perk"
  2. Select your size preference
  3. Enter your billing and shipping information

Once the campaign is finished, you will be sent a survey via email confirming your size, style preference and shipping details. Once your survey is submitted to us, you will be placed on the shipment list.

Where We Are

We have trusted manufacturing partners who we chose based on their vast experience in jewelry and acrylic. Together, we have sourced the best quality materials to produce working prototypes. We are now in phase two, continuing rigorous quality testing and making minor improvements to tooled injection molded samples. The molding and assembling processes are the primary factors that require additional attention and effective production management. For that reason, our project managers are visiting our manufacturing partners to oversee these essential elements and ensure a quality product. 

Why We Need You

We’ve turned to Indiegogo to open our idea to you and the vast community of shoe collectors around the world. We believe that building Trophies into a successful brand starts with each and every backer's support. Your contributions will allow us to successfully complete the third phase: the final production, ordering and fulfillment of the Trophy Box Collection.

 

Timeline

Jun 2014 – Jan 2015: Concept

Jan 2015 – Sep 2015: Product Development

Sep 2015 – Jun 2016: Product Sampling

Jun 2016 – Dec 2016: Tooling

Jan 2017 – Jun 2017: Prototyping

Jan 2017 – Jan 2018: Brand Development

Feb 2018 – March 2018: Launch Concept 

April 2018 – May 2018: Launch Prototype

June 2018 – July 2018 : Finalize engineering and tooling build-out, complete assembly testing and international quality control. Finalize assembly process and begin order fulfillment.

 

Risks and Challenges

We have invested years into the development of The Trophy Box making sure it is ready to go to market. We fully understand the manufacturing and fulfillment processes ahead of us. We also understand that with mass production and shipment of any product comes unforeseen circumstances. We believe we have overcome the most significant ones and ironed out the most critical problems over our 3-year development period.

We believe our timeline takes into account minor setbacks and we are confident in our shipping timeline. However we cannot exclude revisions if any at all. We estimate deliveries to begin in July 2018 and we will do our best to meet this deadline. Should we encounter any delays, we will always share the latest good and bad news with you.

 

Peace & Love,

Once the campaign is finished, you will be sent a survey via email confirming your size, style preference and shipping details. Once your survey is submitted to us, you will be placed on the shipment list.Where We AreWe have trusted manufacturing partners who we chose based on their vast experience in jewelry and acrylic. Together, we have sourced the best quality materials to produce working prototypes. We are now in phase two, continuing rigorous quality testing and making minor improvements to tooled injection molded samples. The molding and assembling processes are the primary factors that require additional attention and effective production management. For that reason, our project managers are visiting our manufacturing partners to oversee these essential elements and ensure a quality product. Why We Need YouWe’ve turned to Indiegogo to open our idea to you and the vast community of shoe collectors around the world. We believe that building Trophies into a successful brand starts with each and every backer's support. Your contributions will allow us to successfully complete the third phase: the final production, ordering and fulfillment of the Trophy Box Collection. TimelineJun 2014 – Jan 2015: ConceptJan 2015 – Sep 2015: Product DevelopmentSep 2015 – Jun 2016: Product SamplingJun 2016 – Dec 2016: ToolingJan 2017 – Jun 2017: PrototypingJan 2017 – Jan 2018: Brand DevelopmentFeb 2018 – March 2018: Launch Concept April 2018 – May 2018: Launch PrototypeJune 2018 – July 2018 : Finalize engineering and tooling build-out, complete assembly testing and international quality control. Finalize assembly process and begin order fulfillment. Risks and ChallengesWe have invested years into the development of The Trophy Box making sure it is ready to go to market. We fully understand the manufacturing and fulfillment processes ahead of us. We also understand that with mass production and shipment of any product comes unforeseen circumstances. We believe we have overcome the most significant ones and ironed out the most critical problems over our 3-year development period.We believe our timeline takes into account minor setbacks and we are confident in our shipping timeline. However we cannot exclude revisions if any at all. We estimate deliveries to begin in July 2018 and we will do our best to meet this deadline. Should we encounter any delays, we will always share the latest good and bad news with you. Peace & Love,

story:
Cure the Naked Suit...

Wearing a suit or sport jacket without a pocket square... What's the point? You don't need to suit up to look sloppy.

A simple flat-fold pocket square provides the elegant accent that completes the aesthetic.

​At last, Squared Away has reimagined the pocket square, creating a system that eliminates the hassles of handkerchief folding and positioning. The deterrents to wearing your jacket with confidence are now gone. Prepare to be noticed.

   

A completely reimagined pocket square system.      

No careless crinkles.

No slovenly slip.

Fool-proof fashion.

  

Squared Away... All Day Long!     

The pocket square is inserted into the support and the pair placed into the suit breast pocket, the wearer can count on the proper look all day long.

 

Clothe the Needy Children...

Squared Away also has a philanthropic mission.  A successful Indiegogo campaign will enable Squared Away's launch and charitable contribution on future sales.

Every time we sell a pocket square, Squared Away will donate $1 to Save the Children and earmark an additional $1 for future donation. The $1 donated immediately sponsors one child in need for one day. Once, 360 pocket square systems are sold, ensuring one child is sponsored for a full year, the earmarked $360 will be donated as well - providing a full year of sponsorship for a second child and doubling the social good.      

So tell you friends! Don't just be a customer, be a partner in a philanthropic movement determined to cure the naked suit and clothe the needy children!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We've successfully created a small batch of prototypes to test the market... and the response has been great!  But we're not there yet.  We need to raise funds from the Indiegogo community in order to bring our pocket square production to life.:

  • We need to raise at least $5k to fund a mass production run of our pocket squares and complete our pending patent work.
  • When you support us on Indiegogo, you become the very first to receive our product when the mass production run is complete!

 

The Impact

As an Indiegogo supporter of Square Away: Pocket Square Movement - your contribution has maximum impact across several worthy endeavors:

  • You help innovate men's fashion - making it easier for men everywhere to dress with confidence.
  • For every pocket square distributed - $2 of the pledge price goes to charity to support children in need.

 

Risks & Challenges

The project risks are three-fold:

1) Financing - How do obtain sufficient funding for my initial full-scale production run?

2) Marketing - How do I efficiently get my new, innovative product in front of the public? And, more importantly, how do I get my product in front of potential customers at a point in time when they are likely to buy?

3) Supply Chain - How do I most efficiently have the product manufactured and shipped to me in Chicago?

Fortunately, my academic training as an MBA and subsequent work experience at Amazon.com position me for success in meeting these challenges.

Thus far, I have funded this effort with personal savings. About $7,000. Additional capital will be derived from a successful Indiegogo campaign.

I am currently employing an aggressive social media strategy. Please look for Squared Away: Pocket Square Movement on Facebook! Exposure from fashion bloggers and this Indiegogo campaign are the next step.

I have already successfully partnered with a manufacturer. They did a great job with the initial prototype batch! I just need the funding to bring production to scale!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now, but still want to help?  No problem! 

Indiegogo makes sharing easy.  Just click the link to to the social media outlet of your choice!

story:
ARI500 seeks to redefine this generation of "fast fashion".

Under the creative direction of Ari Duhaney, ARI500 will produce a collection manufactured by US based garment factories right in NYC. Working with these factories cuts carbon emissions that are a result of shipping to and from countries like India and China, where majority of clothing is outsourced today. 

What Your Contribution is Funding:

~In order of cost~

  • Garment production
  • Bulk fabric buying 
  • Website maintenance
  • Office space maintenance 
  • Public relations and social media outreach
  • Vendor's licensing 

The Impact

Given the circumstances of our global environment today, it is vital that fashion companies begin to rethink their ethical standards and general ethos. Brands like Zara, H&M, and Forever 21 outsource clothing in China and Bangladesh, where majority of workers are underpaid and work in dangerous conditions. The name of their game is to produce as much product as possible as fast as possible, and with that comes the issue of waste disposal. Regulations overseas are not as strict as in the states and Europe, leading to environmental crisis in areas surrounding these factories. Once these goods, are in the states, what doesn't get sold, gets thrown away and is likely to end up in a landfill. Majority of these clothes are made from synthetics (polyester, lycra, spandex) that do not biodegrade. According to the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), 84 percent of unwanted clothes in the United States in 2012 went into either a landfill or an incinerator. Combatting this issue begins with small businesses like ARI500 committing to sustainable practices by working domestically and sourcing biodegradable materials. 

Here are some links citing the dilemmas with fast fashion:

The Apparel Industry’s Environmental Impact in 6 Graphics

Fast fashion: Rivers turning blue and 500,000 tonnes in landfill

FAST FASHION IS CREATING AN ENVIRONMENTAL CRISIS​

 

Risks & Challenges

The most difficult challenge that come with garment production and costing. Companies outsource to China because of how cheap production is. Working in the US comes at a premium, but this is something ARI500 is willing and able to overcome with your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? No worries, there are other ways you can help! Share my campaign on social media or link your friends. Anything helps!
