story:
Clean Water 4 Artisans 

Improving Water Quality for Block Printed Textiles

About Us

Mehera Shaw has been in business for 10 years. We're a small manufacturer with a big reach--we design and make garments in Jaipur that are sold around the world, in the U.K., Australia, Ireland, Germany, New Zealand, Canada  and the United States. Our company, headquartered in the heart of India’s craft industry, employs 35 full-time artisan printers, block makers, tailors, pattern makers and dye masters. 

We are both a fair trade artisan lifestyle brand and clothing manufacturer specializing in hand block printing techniques passed down from generation to generation in Rajasthan, India.  We are headquartered in both Jaipur, India (our manufacturing) and in Chapel Hill, NC, USA (our brand).

We are expanding the Mehera Shaw brand of clothing and homewares, using certified organic cottons made in India, Ahimsa silk and AZO-free dyes.  

 

Our new designs are ready.  But before we hit the "go" button, we want to extend our environmental standards to include not only sustainable fabrics and low-impact dyes, but to also improve on our water filtration during our block printing and fabric dyeing. 

To that end, we're launching a CleanWater4Artisans crowd-funding campaign with the goal of completing the final requirements for GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standard) certification.  We plan to raise $35,000 to pay for a new water filtration (ETP) system at our in-house manufacturing facility in Jaipur. 

 

Jaipur, situated in the desert of Rajasthan, is India's craft center

and home to centuries of rich textile tradition.

We started the business out of a love of Jaipur's traditional block-printed textiles, and a  deep belief in Mahatma Gandhi’s ideals. We’re committed to creating jobs, treating our workers fairly, and creating bonds between our customers--you--and the people who make the clothes. When you contribute to CleanWater4Artisans, you become part of the life and future of those people, their families and their communities.  

 

Benefits of Water Filtration

Improved water filtration and recycling means 

  • a better quality product for our brand and the brands across the world for whom we manufacture, 
  • a stronger environmental standard and 
  • a chance to give back to the artisans who work with us.  

The final part of our journey toward being more earth-friendly and sustainable is building a Effluent Treatment Plant [ETP]--a water filtration system--for our facility outside of Jaipur, Rajasthan.

Rajasthan is a desert state.  Block printing requires a lot of water. We need to cut the amount of water we use, clean and re-use as much as we can, and discharge only water that's had the dye residue filtered out.

The ETP system will remove the dye residue, meaning we can use the same water over and over for rinsing. Combined with a rainwater catchment system, we can cut our water use by up to 80 percent. That's huge!

Water connects us around the globe. Clean water in India ultimately means clean water for all of us. In the West, we take clean, plentiful water for granted. When you contribute to our CleanWater4Artisans campaign, you’ll be contributing—in a small but vital way—to better lives and a healthier planet.

 

Good Design I Environmentally Friendly Products

 Our mission is to be as sustainable as possible and offer the best product possible. Having an improved water filtration and recycling system will allow us to meet this goal. 

 

Improved Standards Means the Best Product I Benefits to our Customers

 

Good design, fair trade and sustainability go hand in hand. 

Water filtration is the final step for us

in making the best quality, and most sustainable product we can.  

We will the be able to meet the GOTS standard.

 

This system will mean a better quality product and will allow us to broaden our product line.  Currently, we make primarily garments and a small amount of homewares.  Going forward, we will introduce a wider range of homewares —bed linens and table linens—which use more fabric and require more water, and a wider range of GOTS certified block printed organic cotton fabrics for use in DIY and B2B collections suitable for fashion and interiors.

 

This system will mean improved product quality assurance for our brand and for all the brands who work with us and the end customers across the world who want to make their purchases count toward doing good in the world.  For customers who want to make a difference and enjoy something of beautify and intrinsic value.

We believe in transparency and in sharing the story of the process.  Our customers want to be a part of the story as it is part of how we all make a difference. Right now, we offer as much transparency as possible.  We share photos of every step of production and printing, of our artisans, how they are treated, working conditions, environmental standards.  But we don’t have full information on what ultimately happens to the water as, once it leaves our facility, it is trucked to a government facility for filtration.  We believe it is vitally important to do everything in-house so we can assure ourselves and our customers of full transparency.

 

Water is one of our most important natural resources.  This system will help us improve our environmental footprint and make a difference to the artisans with whom we work and to the local environment.  Clean water will mean a safer environment and a longer lasting environment.  It will mean that this type of manufacturing has a future.  

The fashion industry is a big player in the destruction of the environment.  We don’t believe in fast fashion or fast living.  We think slow fashion and slow living is one solution.  To reclaim balance between people, the environment and a way of life.  To this end, we support artisan production and artisan textiles.  Improving our water footprint is vital to this process.

 

A Stronger Environmental Standard I Sustainability Goals and Benefits

From our inception, we have been committed to fair trade and are members of the Fair Trade Federation in the US and of the World Fair Trade Organization. 

 We work almost exclusively with GOTS certified organic cottons or handloom natural fibre fabrics. At our core is hand block printing, a nationally recognized heritage craft vitally important and to the artisan economy India. 

But block printing, like all textile processing, requires water.   We currently do everything possible to minimize the effects of chemical dyeing and conserve water.  We use only AZO free, low impact dyes, and conserve as much water as we can. But we need to do more. We need a state of the art filtration system that will allow us to recycle all of our water.  This system will also meet the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) thus assuring us of an international standard in quality and environmental preservation.

 

Giving Back I Benefits to Artisans

But it's not all about us! The village of Bagru, outside Jaipur, is home to dozens of individual, non-commercial block printers. They don't work for Mehera Shaw but they have the same water problem we do, and even less ability to fix it. It's important to us that they, too, have clean water as a benefit to their families and communities.

We're dedicating 10 percent of the money we raise to providing home-based printers with the materials and know-how to create their own filtration systems. These simple systems will ensure that dye-contaminated water isn’t used to irrigate fields or find its way into village water supplies. These are affordable, low-maintanence systems which will also help improve the quality of artisans’ drinking water and help conserve water usage. 

If they choose, they can use the systems to filter drinking water from their wells. The charcoal layers of the system minimize parasites and bacteria, improving the quality of the drinking water. Traditional clay pots used to store water in Rajasthani households prevent the growth of bacteria.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Donate to CleanWater4Artisans and, the next time you turn the tap for a glass of water, know that a family in Rajasthan has fresh water because of you.

 

Why Water?  Lifecycle of Sustainable Textile Printing

 

 

How will we spend your CleanWater4Artisans money? 

  • Design and build an [ETP] to filter contaminants from the wastewater that results from the block-printing  in our main facility in Sanganer.
  • Obtain GOTS certification
  • Give back 10% to village Artisans

 

Stretch Goals

If we achieve our initial goal of building the water filtration (ETP) unit our stretch goals are

  • Install a rainwater catchment system, to capture water during the seasonal monsoons.
  • Install solar panels, to reduce our dependence on the electricity grid and move us toward our goal of energy independence.
  • Increase the size and capacity of our block printing facility.

What GOTS-certification will mean to Mehera Shaw

GOTS [Global Organic Textile Standard] is the world’s gold standard for ensuring that a garment is truly organic from the harvesting of raw materials through environmentally and socially responsible manufacturing all the way to labeling. The standards apply from the planting of a cotton seed all the way through the manufacturing process, including the disposal of wastewater. Installing our ETP system is the last step in qualifying Mehera Shaw for GOTS certification.

 

 

What is involved in building an ETP?

The ETP is a tertiary filtration process involving:

  • a physical filter to catch loose threads
  • a pH equalizer 
  • a flocculation process to draw the dyestuff out of solution
  • a final filtration of the water after the dye has come out of solution

We will be working with an engineer and filtration supplier who has successfully installed several GOTS compliant ETP units in the area.

 

 

History of Block Printing in Rajasthan

India-inspired, Internationally styled 

Mehera Shaw marries tradition and modernity, the charms of handcrafting with the sophistication of haute couture detailing. The Indian inspiration for our garments, accessories and table linens is subtle, interpreted—not copied—to blend into any lifestyle.

We start with organic cotton grown in India—a blank canvas for the artisans’ craft. Print designs are sketched, then translated into hand-carved hardwood blocks, one for each color in the print. Block carving is painstaking work. 

Low impact, AZO free pigment dyes are mixed and fabric is stretched on specially built tables. The printer goes to work, pressing the block into the cotton time and again. The pattern undulates across the fabric with subtle variations caused by the varying pressure of the artisan’s hand. This process will be repeated for every color in the design—as many as six in some patterns.

In between application of each element of the design, the fabric is rinsed, line-dried, rinsed again, hung to dry, then rinsed once more. The rinse water becomes laden with dye and fiber. Both have to be filtered so that the water can be reused several times before being released safely as wastewater.

The traditional process of hand block printing on textiles, with rich natural colors, has been practiced in Rajasthan for around 500 years.  Block printing was introduced to the Jaipur region of Rajasthan by the Chhipa community.  This community was originally located in Bagru Village, an area now famous for its vegetable dye and mud resist (dabu) block prints.  The art of block printing has been passed down for generations within families and communities and has branched out in recent decades to other regions such as Sanganer, just South of Jaipur.  In traditional Bagru style block printing, the ‘recipes’ for the traditional plant-based dyes are developed within each family and kept alive from generation to generation.  The colors are dependent on the quality of the plants, the water and skill and knowledge of the printing masters.  In more recent forms of block printing, such as those practiced in Sanganer, colors are mixed using AZO free pigment dyes.

 

 

STEP 1: Block Carving

A print starts with the design, drawn on paper and carved into the Sheesham wood block.  Designs are meticulously carved by hand into the blocks which are approximately 18-25 cm across.  The physical block is the design for a single repeat which is then stamped in rows across the fabric.  Each color in the design is carved into a separate block.  Depending on the colors in the design, the ground color block or 'gud' or the outline block or 'rekh', (which is the most intricate) and usually stamped first; it is typically the outline for a floral or lattice type design.  Next comes the fill block or 'datta'.  Block carving is in itself an art requiring years of apprenticeship to gain mastery and is done entirely by hand.  

 

STEP 2: Color Mixing-Preparing the Dyes

Once the blocks are carved, the master printer prepares the colors which will be used in printing.  The colors are then poured into wooden trays and the blocks stamped in the color each time, then stamped onto the fabric to form the repeat pattern.  The colors shown are AZO free, low-impact pigment dyes which are used in Sanganer printing.

For each new design, we do a color check and test out new color combinations.  We use Pantone  reference codes for color matching.  In the photos, our master printer, Ghanshyam Ji is working with our team to develop a series of new colorways with our new collection.

 

STEP 3: Printing Process

Each color pattern is stamped individually onto the fabric; the process takes skill and time, as the pattern must be stamped repeatedly across the fabric, color by color. The slight human irregularities — inevitable in handwork — create the artistic effect emblematic of block prints.  The final outcome of this intricate labor is a timeless beauty, and every garment made from this fabric is unique.

The printing master must carefully align each block as he prints, using the ‘guide’ carved on the left edge of the block as his marker.  Each printer has a slightly different style which is considered his ‘signature’ look.  The printing master must then follow the same pattern of aligning the blocks with each color layered on to the design.  The subtle gaps and overlaps are a beautiful reminder of the hand work and give block printing it’s iconic look.  All prints exemplify this aesthetic and have a subtle pattern of light/dark across the design.

 

Who We Are -   Mehera Shaw, LLC

We create distinctive clothing from organically produced cotton, block-printed by hand using natural dyes. Mehera Shaw’s high-end artisan-inspired clothing is sold in Australia, Ireland, Canada, Germany and the U.S.  We are committed to using the most environmentally friendly methods possible, with the eventual goal of getting off the grid. We’ve always believed in and practiced fair labor standards. We want Mehera Shaw to prosper as a company by contributing to the stability of our employees, their families and their villages. 

 

The Crew

The

Mark and Shari Keller, both Americans and neither with any Indian heritage, met in 1997, in Maharashtra, in western India. She was completing her Ph.D. in Anthropology, with a focus on artisan development in India. He was collecting artisan textiles and creating silver jewelry set with semi-precious stones. They married the following year and launched the Mehera Shaw clothing brand in 1999, in Jaipur, India. They expanded the brand in 2007 by registering as a fair-trade, limited manufacturing company. 

The Kellers grew the business artisan-by-artisan over the next decade, always adhering to fair-trade standards, reflecting their belief in the ideals of Mahatma Gandhi. They are committed to continually improving their manufacturing processes to meet global environmental standards. Their company is already a certified Fair-Trade organization and they expect to meet the final qualifications in 2018 for full GOTS-certification, the world’s highest standard for organic manufacturing.

Mark, with more than 30 years experience working in India, is Director of Operations. Shari is Mehera Shaw’s Creative Director, working with the company’s master pattern-maker and printers on fabric and clothing design for the Mehera Shaw clothing line and for companies that rely on Mehera Shaw for custom manufacturing of their clothing and housewares products.

Mark and Shari have extensive experience working as liaisons between Indian manufacturers and Western markets, ensuring product quality, supply chain reliability, maintaining fair trade practices and implementing ecological production standards.

 

Mehera Shaw is committed to the well-being

of its employees and their communities.

 

Mark and Shari Keller love India, its people and their skills and traditions. Mehera Shaw was founded on the principle of stabilizing and strengthening Indian communities by supporting those skills and traditions, in order that artisans and their families can thrive. To do less would be to fail, not only as a business but as compassionate human beings.

 

Our management staff includes: 

 

Our Labor Standard - Fair Trade

We

We believe the message behind fair trade is passed on to the next generation when people work together and see each other as human beings first.  We believe this is the most important type of understanding which will create long-term positive change for humanity.  We believe an environment of empathy and respect is key to our whole future; together we all benefit.  We believe the benefits of simply treating each other as human beings are there for all of us who are willing to join hands and see ourselves as part of this ‘trade’. 

Fair trade employee benefits build independence and stability, not only for employees but for the next generations of their families in terms of improved education, safer living conditions and a healthier environment.

Caste/class discrimination is diminished, providing better opportunities for social and economic upward mobility. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We believe the message behind fair trade is passed on to the next generation when people work together and see each other as human beings first.  We believe this is the most important type of understanding which will create long-term positive change for humanity.  We believe an environment of empathy and respect is key to our whole future; together we all benefit.  We believe the benefits of simply treating each other as human beings are there for all of us who are willing to join hands and see ourselves as part of this ‘trade’. 

 

How does Mehera Shaw treat employees?

Mehera Shaw is a member of the Fair Trade Federation in the U.S. We’re committed to a business philosophy that puts the human factor first. We are a team of highly trained stitchers and a quality control staff, a cutting master, pattern master, support and office staff. We have a dyeing and block printing unit in Sanganer which operates under the same fair trade standards. All our garments are made in-house using sweatshop-free labor. 

We are committed to providing employees with economic stability, so that their families—and their communities—can flourish.

Fair Labor Practices at Mehera Shaw

• All staff are full-time, permanent employees

• No persons under the age of 18 are employed

• Living wages are paid on time to each and every person on our staff

• Staff bonuses are paid 3 times annually (1/3 monthly salary)

• All our stitchers and their family members receive full medical care benefits through a Government of India incentive program

• Staff members are eligible for emergency loans for education, illness and family concerns 

• Mehera Shaw give loans to employees for children’s education, building a house, wedding and illness

• All staff members earn pension funds supported by the Government of India

• Paid holiday leaves

• Staff are paid overtime for voluntary overtime work (no forced labor) 

• No discrimination; all staff have the right of expression and clear advocacy regarding work policies.  

• Working conditions are safe, clean and well-ventilated working conditions. Staff is provided with clean drinking water, chai and lunch breaks

• Ongoing skills training for all staff and support for ongoing learning, believing that learning through doing is equally as important as formal education. 

• Mehera Shaw provides on-going skills training and support for continual learning, in the belief that learning through doing is as important as formal education
story_txt:
Clean Water 4 Artisans Improving Water Quality for Block Printed TextilesAbout UsMehera Shaw has been in business for 10 years. We're a small manufacturer with a big reach--we design and make garments in Jaipur that are sold around the world, in the U.K., Australia, Ireland, Germany, New Zealand, Canada  and the United States. Our company, headquartered in the heart of India’s craft industry, employs 35 full-time artisan printers, block makers, tailors, pattern makers and dye masters. We are both a fair trade artisan lifestyle brand and clothing manufacturer specializing in hand block printing techniques passed down from generation to generation in Rajasthan, India.  We are headquartered in both Jaipur, India (our manufacturing) and in Chapel Hill, NC, USA (our brand).We are expanding the Mehera Shaw brand of clothing and homewares, using certified organic cottons made in India, Ahimsa silk and AZO-free dyes.   Our new designs are ready.  But before we hit the "go" button, we want to extend our environmental standards to include not only sustainable fabrics and low-impact dyes, but to also improve on our water filtration during our block printing and fabric dyeing. To that end, we're launching a CleanWater4Artisans crowd-funding campaign with the goal of completing the final requirements for GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standard) certification.  We plan to raise $35,000 to pay for a new water filtration (ETP) system at our in-house manufacturing facility in Jaipur.  Jaipur, situated in the desert of Rajasthan, is India's craft centerand home to centuries of rich textile tradition.We started the business out of a love of Jaipur's traditional block-printed textiles, and a  deep belief in Mahatma Gandhi’s ideals. We’re committed to creating jobs, treating our workers fairly, and creating bonds between our customers--you--and the people who make the clothes. When you contribute to CleanWater4Artisans, you become part of the life and future of those people, their families and their communities.   Benefits of Water FiltrationImproved water filtration and recycling means 
a better quality product for our brand and the brands across the world for whom we manufacture, 
a stronger environmental standard and 
a chance to give back to the artisans who work with us.  
The final part of our journey toward being more earth-friendly and sustainable is building a Effluent Treatment Plant [ETP]--a water filtration system--for our facility outside of Jaipur, Rajasthan.Rajasthan is a desert state.  Block printing requires a lot of water. We need to cut the amount of water we use, clean and re-use as much as we can, and discharge only water that's had the dye residue filtered out.The ETP system will remove the dye residue, meaning we can use the same water over and over for rinsing. Combined with a rainwater catchment system, we can cut our water use by up to 80 percent. That's huge!Water connects us around the globe. Clean water in India ultimately means clean water for all of us. In the West, we take clean, plentiful water for granted. When you contribute to our CleanWater4Artisans campaign, you’ll be contributing—in a small but vital way—to better lives and a healthier planet. Good Design I Environmentally Friendly Products Our mission is to be as sustainable as possible and offer the best product possible. Having an improved water filtration and recycling system will allow us to meet this goal.  Improved Standards Means the Best Product I Benefits to our Customers Good design, fair trade and sustainability go hand in hand.  Water filtration is the final step for us in making the best quality, and most sustainable product we can.  We will the be able to meet the GOTS standard. This system will mean a better quality product and will allow us to broaden our product line.  Currently, we make primarily garments and a small amount of homewares.  Going forward, we will introduce a wider range of homewares —bed linens and table linens—which use more fabric and require more water, and a wider range of GOTS certified block printed organic cotton fabrics for use in DIY and B2B collections suitable for fashion and interiors. This system will mean improved product quality assurance for our brand and for all the brands who work with us and the end customers across the world who want to make their purchases count toward doing good in the world.  For customers who want to make a difference and enjoy something of beautify and intrinsic value.We believe in transparency and in sharing the story of the process.  Our customers want to be a part of the story as it is part of how we all make a difference. Right now, we offer as much transparency as possible.  We share photos of every step of production and printing, of our artisans, how they are treated, working conditions, environmental standards.  But we don’t have full information on what ultimately happens to the water as, once it leaves our facility, it is trucked to a government facility for filtration.  We believe it is vitally important to do everything in-house so we can assure ourselves and our customers of full transparency. Water is one of our most important natural resources.  This system will help us improve our environmental footprint and make a difference to the artisans with whom we work and to the local environment.  Clean water will mean a safer environment and a longer lasting environment.  It will mean that this type of manufacturing has a future.  The fashion industry is a big player in the destruction of the environment.  We don’t believe in fast fashion or fast living.  We think slow fashion and slow living is one solution.  To reclaim balance between people, the environment and a way of life.  To this end, we support artisan production and artisan textiles.  Improving our water footprint is vital to this process. A Stronger Environmental Standard I Sustainability Goals and BenefitsFrom our inception, we have been committed to fair trade and are members of the Fair Trade Federation in the US and of the World Fair Trade Organization.  We work almost exclusively with GOTS certified organic cottons or handloom natural fibre fabrics. At our core is hand block printing, a nationally recognized heritage craft vitally important and to the artisan economy India. But block printing, like all textile processing, requires water.   We currently do everything possible to minimize the effects of chemical dyeing and conserve water.  We use only AZO free, low impact dyes, and conserve as much water as we can. But we need to do more. We need a state of the art filtration system that will allow us to recycle all of our water.  This system will also meet the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) thus assuring us of an international standard in quality and environmental preservation. Giving Back I Benefits to ArtisansBut it's not all about us! The village of Bagru, outside Jaipur, is home to dozens of individual, non-commercial block printers. They don't work for Mehera Shaw but they have the same water problem we do, and even less ability to fix it. It's important to us that they, too, have clean water as a benefit to their families and communities.We're dedicating 10 percent of the money we raise to providing home-based printers with the materials and know-how to create their own filtration systems. These simple systems will ensure that dye-contaminated water isn’t used to irrigate fields or find its way into village water supplies. These are affordable, low-maintanence systems which will also help improve the quality of artisans’ drinking water and help conserve water usage. If they choose, they can use the systems to filter drinking water from their wells. The charcoal layers of the system minimize parasites and bacteria, improving the quality of the drinking water. Traditional clay pots used to store water in Rajasthani households prevent the growth of bacteria.               Donate to CleanWater4Artisans and, the next time you turn the tap for a glass of water, know that a family in Rajasthan has fresh water because of you. Why Water?  Lifecycle of Sustainable Textile Printing  How will we spend your CleanWater4Artisans money? 
Design and build an [ETP] to filter contaminants from the wastewater that results from the block-printing  in our main facility in Sanganer.
Obtain GOTS certification
Give back 10% to village Artisans
 Stretch GoalsIf we achieve our initial goal of building the water filtration (ETP) unit our stretch goals are
Install a rainwater catchment system, to capture water during the seasonal monsoons.
Install solar panels, to reduce our dependence on the electricity grid and move us toward our goal of energy independence.
Increase the size and capacity of our block printing facility.
What GOTS-certification will mean to Mehera ShawGOTS [Global Organic Textile Standard] is the world’s gold standard for ensuring that a garment is truly organic from the harvesting of raw materials through environmentally and socially responsible manufacturing all the way to labeling. The standards apply from the planting of a cotton seed all the way through the manufacturing process, including the disposal of wastewater. Installing our ETP system is the last step in qualifying Mehera Shaw for GOTS certification.  What is involved in building an ETP? The ETP is a tertiary filtration process involving:
a physical filter to catch loose threads
a pH equalizer 
a flocculation process to draw the dyestuff out of solution
a final filtration of the water after the dye has come out of solution
We will be working with an engineer and filtration supplier who has successfully installed several GOTS compliant ETP units in the area.  History of Block Printing in RajasthanIndia-inspired, Internationally styled Mehera Shaw marries tradition and modernity, the charms of handcrafting with the sophistication of haute couture detailing. The Indian inspiration for our garments, accessories and table linens is subtle, interpreted—not copied—to blend into any lifestyle.We start with organic cotton grown in India—a blank canvas for the artisans’ craft. Print designs are sketched, then translated into hand-carved hardwood blocks, one for each color in the print. Block carving is painstaking work. Low impact, AZO free pigment dyes are mixed and fabric is stretched on specially built tables. The printer goes to work, pressing the block into the cotton time and again. The pattern undulates across the fabric with subtle variations caused by the varying pressure of the artisan’s hand. This process will be repeated for every color in the design—as many as six in some patterns.In between application of each element of the design, the fabric is rinsed, line-dried, rinsed again, hung to dry, then rinsed once more. The rinse water becomes laden with dye and fiber. Both have to be filtered so that the water can be reused several times before being released safely as wastewater.The traditional process of hand block printing on textiles, with rich natural colors, has been practiced in Rajasthan for around 500 years.  Block printing was introduced to the Jaipur region of Rajasthan by the Chhipa community.  This community was originally located in Bagru Village, an area now famous for its vegetable dye and mud resist (dabu) block prints.  The art of block printing has been passed down for generations within families and communities and has branched out in recent decades to other regions such as Sanganer, just South of Jaipur.  In traditional Bagru style block printing, the ‘recipes’ for the traditional plant-based dyes are developed within each family and kept alive from generation to generation.  The colors are dependent on the quality of the plants, the water and skill and knowledge of the printing masters.  In more recent forms of block printing, such as those practiced in Sanganer, colors are mixed using AZO free pigment dyes.  STEP 1: Block CarvingA print starts with the design, drawn on paper and carved into the Sheesham wood block.  Designs are meticulously carved by hand into the blocks which are approximately 18-25 cm across.  The physical block is the design for a single repeat which is then stamped in rows across the fabric.  Each color in the design is carved into a separate block.  Depending on the colors in the design, the ground color block or 'gud' or the outline block or 'rekh', (which is the most intricate) and usually stamped first; it is typically the outline for a floral or lattice type design.  Next comes the fill block or 'datta'.  Block carving is in itself an art requiring years of apprenticeship to gain mastery and is done entirely by hand.   STEP 2: Color Mixing-Preparing the DyesOnce the blocks are carved, the master printer prepares the colors which will be used in printing.  The colors are then poured into wooden trays and the blocks stamped in the color each time, then stamped onto the fabric to form the repeat pattern.  The colors shown are AZO free, low-impact pigment dyes which are used in Sanganer printing.For each new design, we do a color check and test out new color combinations.  We use Pantone  reference codes for color matching.  In the photos, our master printer, Ghanshyam Ji is working with our team to develop a series of new colorways with our new collection. STEP 3: Printing ProcessEach color pattern is stamped individually onto the fabric; the process takes skill and time, as the pattern must be stamped repeatedly across the fabric, color by color. The slight human irregularities — inevitable in handwork — create the artistic effect emblematic of block prints.  The final outcome of this intricate labor is a timeless beauty, and every garment made from this fabric is unique.The printing master must carefully align each block as he prints, using the ‘guide’ carved on the left edge of the block as his marker.  Each printer has a slightly different style which is considered his ‘signature’ look.  The printing master must then follow the same pattern of aligning the blocks with each color layered on to the design.  The subtle gaps and overlaps are a beautiful reminder of the hand work and give block printing it’s iconic look.  All prints exemplify this aesthetic and have a subtle pattern of light/dark across the design. Who We Are -   Mehera Shaw, LLCWe create distinctive clothing from organically produced cotton, block-printed by hand using natural dyes. Mehera Shaw’s high-end artisan-inspired clothing is sold in Australia, Ireland, Canada, Germany and the U.S.  We are committed to using the most environmentally friendly methods possible, with the eventual goal of getting off the grid. We’ve always believed in and practiced fair labor standards. We want Mehera Shaw to prosper as a company by contributing to the stability of our employees, their families and their villages.  The CrewTheMark and Shari Keller, both Americans and neither with any Indian heritage, met in 1997, in Maharashtra, in western India. She was completing her Ph.D. in Anthropology, with a focus on artisan development in India. He was collecting artisan textiles and creating silver jewelry set with semi-precious stones. They married the following year and launched the Mehera Shaw clothing brand in 1999, in Jaipur, India. They expanded the brand in 2007 by registering as a fair-trade, limited manufacturing company. The Kellers grew the business artisan-by-artisan over the next decade, always adhering to fair-trade standards, reflecting their belief in the ideals of Mahatma Gandhi. They are committed to continually improving their manufacturing processes to meet global environmental standards. Their company is already a certified Fair-Trade organization and they expect to meet the final qualifications in 2018 for full GOTS-certification, the world’s highest standard for organic manufacturing.Mark, with more than 30 years experience working in India, is Director of Operations. Shari is Mehera Shaw’s Creative Director, working with the company’s master pattern-maker and printers on fabric and clothing design for the Mehera Shaw clothing line and for companies that rely on Mehera Shaw for custom manufacturing of their clothing and housewares products.Mark and Shari have extensive experience working as liaisons between Indian manufacturers and Western markets, ensuring product quality, supply chain reliability, maintaining fair trade practices and implementing ecological production standards. Mehera Shaw is committed to the well-beingof its employees and their communities. Mark and Shari Keller love India, its people and their skills and traditions. Mehera Shaw was founded on the principle of stabilizing and strengthening Indian communities by supporting those skills and traditions, in order that artisans and their families can thrive. To do less would be to fail, not only as a business but as compassionate human beings. Our management staff includes:  Our Labor Standard - Fair TradeWeWe believe the message behind fair trade is passed on to the next generation when people work together and see each other as human beings first.  We believe this is the most important type of understanding which will create long-term positive change for humanity.  We believe an environment of empathy and respect is key to our whole future; together we all benefit.  We believe the benefits of simply treating each other as human beings are there for all of us who are willing to join hands and see ourselves as part of this ‘trade’. Fair trade employee benefits build independence and stability, not only for employees but for the next generations of their families in terms of improved education, safer living conditions and a healthier environment.Caste/class discrimination is diminished, providing better opportunities for social and economic upward mobility.            We believe the message behind fair trade is passed on to the next generation when people work together and see each other as human beings first.  We believe this is the most important type of understanding which will create long-term positive change for humanity.  We believe an environment of empathy and respect is key to our whole future; together we all benefit.  We believe the benefits of simply treating each other as human beings are there for all of us who are willing to join hands and see ourselves as part of this ‘trade’.  How does Mehera Shaw treat employees?Mehera Shaw is a member of the Fair Trade Federation in the U.S. We’re committed to a business philosophy that puts the human factor first. We are a team of highly trained stitchers and a quality control staff, a cutting master, pattern master, support and office staff. We have a dyeing and block printing unit in Sanganer which operates under the same fair trade standards. All our garments are made in-house using sweatshop-free labor. We are committed to providing employees with economic stability, so that their families—and their communities—can flourish.Fair Labor Practices at Mehera Shaw• All staff are full-time, permanent employees• No persons under the age of 18 are employed• Living wages are paid on time to each and every person on our staff• Staff bonuses are paid 3 times annually (1/3 monthly salary)• All our stitchers and their family members receive full medical care benefits through a Government of India incentive program• Staff members are eligible for emergency loans for education, illness and family concerns • Mehera Shaw give loans to employees for children’s education, building a house, wedding and illness• All staff members earn pension funds supported by the Government of India• Paid holiday leaves• Staff are paid overtime for voluntary overtime work (no forced labor) • No discrimination; all staff have the right of expression and clear advocacy regarding work policies.  • Working conditions are safe, clean and well-ventilated working conditions. Staff is provided with clean drinking water, chai and lunch breaks• Ongoing skills training for all staff and support for ongoing learning, believing that learning through doing is equally as important as formal education. • Mehera Shaw provides on-going skills training and support for continual learning, in the belief that learning through doing is as important as formal education

story:
Meet Buddie:  the mask made for you

 

 

Buddie is a protective, stylish face mask customized to fit each individual wearer. We use 3D scanning to map the contour of your face and 3D printing to create a customized silicone pad for your mask. Buddie's customized silicone pad creates a virtually airtight seal to each wearer's face without applying an excessive amount of pressure; this guarantees both maximum safety and ultimate comfort. 

One mask for the pandemic

One mask for the future

 

On his first day in office, President Joe Biden has mandated 100 days of mask wearing for all US citizens. The vaccine is coming, but COVID-19 is still a threat. Buddie is here to protect you and your loved ones during the final stretch of the pandemic. Buddie will not only keep you safe, but will also keep you comfortable and enhance your style as you emerge into the post-quarantine world! Buddie will be by your side for the future, keeping you prepared to face worsening pollution, health crises, and anything else this world throws at you.

 

How it works

 

We've developed a patent-pending algorithm that analyzes your face scan and builds a 3D model of the custom pad for your mask. All Buddie needs from you is your scan! Scanning can be done on any iPhone X or newer using the Bellus3D FaceApp scanning application.

 

Stay Safe, Protect Others, Breathe Easy

 

Buddie Mask uses a valveless, two-way filtration system with Filti Nanofiber filters to purify air as you inhale and exhale. Filti Nanofiber filters remove 95+% of sub-micron airborne particles to protect you and others from COVID-19 and other pathogens. Filti Nanofiber filters offer N95-equivalent protection with significantly lower inhalation resistance than medical-grade N95 and KN-95 masks, allowing you to stay protected while breathing easily.

Buddie's Twist-Lock filter guarantees filter security and allows for quick, easy filter changing. Buddie Mask filters should be replaced every 12 hours of use. 

 

 

Built for Comfort

 

Buddie's customized pad is made of soft, flexible silicone which provides maximum comfort and allows the wearer to smile, speak, and express freely. The neoprene fabric covering also delivers comfort, breathability, and flexibility to the wearer's face and ears. When you move, Buddie moves with you! 

 

 

Safety and comfort have never looked so good

 

Buddie's streamlined, modern design will not only keep you safe when you're out, but will also enhance your style. The soft, flexible neoprene covering pairs well with all styles and textures and our white, black, and grey color options give you flexibility to customize your Buddie even further.

The Buddie Team

 

Buddie was born, designed, and built in NYC. In May 2020, Lead Engineer Jared West and Lead Designer Matthew Kelley were both fresh out of college and working at Brooklyn-based 3D-printing startup, Makelab, producing personal protective equipment to help people through COVID-19. With help from The Algorithmic Design Corporation, Jared and Matt leveraged their 3D-printing and 3D scanning expertise to create a custom-fitting algorithm and used their sound design/engineering sense to build the Buddie mask around it. 

 

 

Building Buddie together!

 

Reaching our funding goal of $15,000 will allow us to expand our manufacturing operation and become a self-sustaining business. Specifically, we will use funds for:

1. Arrangement of large-scale manufacturing for Filti Nanofiber filters

2. Purchasing required materials for fulfilling all Indiegogo orders

3. Improving Buddie's proprietary software and building out new software for our custom-fitting and 3D scanning processes

4. Research and development for Atlas, the customized face mask for medical professionals

 

 

Help Buddie grow

 

If Buddie isn't accessible to you at this price point, there are still ways you can get involved! Follow us on social media (  https://www.instagram.com/buddiemask/  ), share Buddie content, post about Buddie, and be sure to tell all your friends and family about the Buddie project. 

Reach out to Buddie via Instagram @buddiemask ! We love people and we love to collaborate. Are you an essential worker looking for enhanced comfort in your face mask? Are you a professional looking for the perfect new accessory? Are you a designer/engineer/artist/fashionista whose creative spirit can't be quenched? Buddie wants to get to know you!

Donate a small amount to our campaign! The more funding we have, the more we will be able to improve our process and push towards a more accessible price point in the future.

story:
The Ultimate Pants for .. Anything

Functional suit trousers offering complete freedom of movement made for elegance and extreme sports. Care-free and sporting a pocket layout worthy of a secret agent.

Elegance or performance? Activity or leisure? Travel or sofa?

UNITE OPPOSITES WITH HOSN

As a secret agent, you need to deliver the best under pressure – and keep looking good. So we figured we'd start our design process at the top:

The best pants are good enough only if they are good enough for the best.

Featured on

 

See how Hosn stands out from the crowd while blending into any environment: 

 Check out more never-seen-before features below!

The stretchy waistband supports who you are and who you work to be.

Of Course there's a Bazillion Features 

 but the only thing that really matters:

A lot of people put incredible effort into creating the most versatile trousers in the world, and we are proud to share them with you today.

Fits what you Love

Hosn reimagine the way pants can support individual freedom.

We gathered top athletes, military and law enforcement special forces, outdoor survival experts, passionate extreme sports enthusiasts, martial artists and combat instructors, filmmakers, parents, pensioners, entrepreneurs, globetrotters, digital nomads, butlers and stunt world record holders – all for one thing:

THE MOST FUNCTIONAL ELEGANT PANTS IN THE WORLD

Unleash Your Inner Agent

And discover the potential of Hosn:

You'll love: Look good all day long through travel and meetings and experience more comfort than in jogging pants. Gadgets: Shirt-stay clips and business-card pockets.

You'll love: Being dressed up for any occasion while travelling light, iron-free and hands-free thanks to the ingenious pockets. Gadgets: Bottle pocket and passport safety pocket.

You'll love: All-day reliability under grimy costumes and preventing injuries thanks to the padded waistband and metal-free manufacture. Gadgets: Padded waistband and super flat button.

You'll love: Distraction-free focus on what matters most, keeping your gear handy and your professionality shining. Gadgets: Magazine pockets and conceal-carry holster.

You'll love: Breathable comfort through changing weather conditions, water-resistant and quick dry fabrics that you can still crash any party with after a long day outdoors. Gadgets: Padded waistband for backpacks and the non-chafing bottle pocket.

You'll love: Rolling, kicking and grappling on grass, sand and the mats; Low-kick friendly and free of metal parts. Gadgets: Padded waistband, stretchy gusset for groin guards and hidden mouthguard pocket.

Stay smooth and embrace your day. It's full of beautiful memories to discover!

 

Top Quality & Fabrics

Accept no compromise!

We believe that healthy fabrics, fair trade, and long-lasting quality are the basis for our mission to support healthy movement and freedom across the globe. After all, Hosn might spend as much time hugging your skin as your partner.

Hosn are manufactured entirely in the EU. Our fabrics are a cozy weave of caressing elegance made in a traditional mill in Italy. Engineering, design and production are done in Austria. Manufactured by a long-standing supplier of police uniforms and evening wear.

 

Respecting your Skin, Respecting our Planet

We all share a responsibility to protect our planet. We strive to stay at the cutting edge to ensure the most sustainable Hosn possible.

Hosn consist of bluesign approved, sustainable fabrics and OekoTex certified materials. 

Hosn pack cutting-edge functionality into a design of timeless elegance.

TUCKED TIGHT

Patent-pending shirt-clips keep your shirt tucked at all times.

AVOID INJURIES

The padded waistband protects your hip from impacts and chafing.

FITS ANY BELT

Engineered for tactical and battle belts, but why not go crazy?

Your Hosn come with an ingenious pocket system that you'll wonder how you ever lived without.

JUST IN CASE

The secret pocket keeps your valuables secure.

 

STAY HYDRATED

The thigh pockets keep your hands free while maintaining visual elegance.

 

ALL SORTED

The back pocket on the left has two compartments for mags, hankies, lights and the like.

 

ZIP-LOCKED

The zippered card pocket – hidden under the waistband, ideal for business cards and spare keys.

 

Timeless Fit

Tailored by a top runway designer, Hosn are guaranteed to be snug on your curves, sporting a timeless look. 

 

Do you prefer a classic unisex straight look, or a ladies' cut that embraces your curves, or a skin-tight athletic fit? 

 

Sizes

Select your style and size after the campaign, ranging from XS to XXL, W26" to W48", EU sizes 44 to 64 for gentlemen and 34 to 58 for ladies, or sizes 2 to 24 for ladies in the US.

 

Maximum length on ready-to-wear Hosn is 34". If you are sporting legs for days, go for your very own custom tailored Hosn.

 

Ultimate Individuality

Bespoke Hosn inspire ideal confidence and are custom tailored to fit any size (for humans ;)

 

Colors

Since all good things come in black and black goes with everything, Hosn come in black.

Pantone Black Beauty to be exact.

 

Super-Simple Care

Get the most out of your Hosn by treating them nicely and taking them on lots of adventures:

To maintain the non-tox water repellency treatment, avoid softener and occasionally tumble dry or iron at 70°C.

Enjoy the extra time saved with your quick-dry, non-iron suit pants!

 

The Expertise Behind the Hosn

We are driven by a passion for unrestricted freedom and a love of ingenious solutions that make our daily lives better. We have combined our expertise into Hosn, in the hopes of enriching your life and supporting your joy of movement each and every day.

The drive behind Hosn comes from Markus Weilguny, action director and stunt coordinator for the top-featured stunt Guinness World Record of 2017, recipient of the Pioneer of European Martial Arts award and video director for Hitman. 

Markus developed the first pair of functional dress trousers with first responders, stunt performers and extreme athletes, getting overwhelmingly positive feedback. Thus, the journey began to share Hosn with the world – and with you today.

 

Timeline

Since 2016 we've been refining Hosn. On our quest to create the ultimate trousers, we have spent intense times with special forces and top managers to perfect Hosn.

Today, we are proud to present what we believe to be the trousers of the 21st century. The culmination of functionality, timeless elegance and textile science-fiction.

We've established the manufacturing process, ensuring a smooth transition from smaller series to larger batches. Worldwide shipping has commenced in March 2020.

Take the Hosn journey with us

 

Super Important Note on Shipping

We offer world-wide shipping.

To get you the best rate for your individual delivery address, you'll be able to choose your shipping option on checkout. That's why we don't include shipping costs during the campaign, ensuring you get the best deal for your exact location.

Costs for Express Shipping range from 6.90 to 34.90 for up to 2 kg (a Triple Pack of Hosn). Standard Shipping is available from 6.90. Or you can pick up your Hosn in Vienna. If you're lucky, the Deliverer might even bring them by.

We work with global logistics partners, including UPS, to ensure timely and reliable delivery without the hassle of lost packages, impossible pickup times, and the like. They'll inform you of delivery before it happens, with full parcel tracking, and will attempt up to three deliveries.

Let the Deliverer take care of it!

 

To Order on Indiegogo

Select your favourite set of Hosn (did you notice the triple pack gives you the best price?)

We'll guide you with how to take measurements, if you need a hand – or a leg.

You'll receive an order code to select the size and shipping options you want.

We'll be happy when your Hosn get to share your adventures and simplify your life!
story_txt: The Ultimate Pants for .. AnythingFunctional suit trousers offering complete freedom of movement made for elegance and extreme sports. Care-free and sporting a pocket layout worthy of a secret agent.Elegance or performance? Activity or leisure? Travel or sofa?UNITE OPPOSITES WITH HOSNAs a secret agent, you need to deliver the best under pressure – and keep looking good. So we figured we'd start our design process at the top:The best pants are good enough only if they are good enough for the best.Featured on See how Hosn stands out from the crowd while blending into any environment:  Check out more never-seen-before features below!The stretchy waistband supports who you are and who you work to be.Of Course there's a Bazillion Features  but the only thing that really matters:A lot of people put incredible effort into creating the most versatile trousers in the world, and we are proud to share them with you today.Fits what you LoveHosn reimagine the way pants can support individual freedom.We gathered top athletes, military and law enforcement special forces, outdoor survival experts, passionate extreme sports enthusiasts, martial artists and combat instructors, filmmakers, parents, pensioners, entrepreneurs, globetrotters, digital nomads, butlers and stunt world record holders – all for one thing:THE MOST FUNCTIONAL ELEGANT PANTS IN THE WORLDUnleash Your Inner AgentAnd discover the potential of Hosn:You'll love: Look good all day long through travel and meetings and experience more comfort than in jogging pants. Gadgets: Shirt-stay clips and business-card pockets.You'll love: Being dressed up for any occasion while travelling light, iron-free and hands-free thanks to the ingenious pockets. Gadgets: Bottle pocket and passport safety pocket.You'll love: All-day reliability under grimy costumes and preventing injuries thanks to the padded waistband and metal-free manufacture. Gadgets: Padded waistband and super flat button.You'll love: Distraction-free focus on what matters most, keeping your gear handy and your professionality shining. Gadgets: Magazine pockets and conceal-carry holster.You'll love: Breathable comfort through changing weather conditions, water-resistant and quick dry fabrics that you can still crash any party with after a long day outdoors. Gadgets: Padded waistband for backpacks and the non-chafing bottle pocket.You'll love: Rolling, kicking and grappling on grass, sand and the mats; Low-kick friendly and free of metal parts. Gadgets: Padded waistband, stretchy gusset for groin guards and hidden mouthguard pocket.Stay smooth and embrace your day. It's full of beautiful memories to discover! Top Quality & FabricsAccept no compromise!We believe that healthy fabrics, fair trade, and long-lasting quality are the basis for our mission to support healthy movement and freedom across the globe. After all, Hosn might spend as much time hugging your skin as your partner.Hosn are manufactured entirely in the EU. Our fabrics are a cozy weave of caressing elegance made in a traditional mill in Italy. Engineering, design and production are done in Austria. Manufactured by a long-standing supplier of police uniforms and evening wear. Respecting your Skin, Respecting our PlanetWe all share a responsibility to protect our planet. We strive to stay at the cutting edge to ensure the most sustainable Hosn possible.Hosn consist of bluesign approved, sustainable fabrics and OekoTex certified materials. Hosn pack cutting-edge functionality into a design of timeless elegance.TUCKED TIGHTPatent-pending shirt-clips keep your shirt tucked at all times.AVOID INJURIESThe padded waistband protects your hip from impacts and chafing.FITS ANY BELTEngineered for tactical and battle belts, but why not go crazy?Your Hosn come with an ingenious pocket system that you'll wonder how you ever lived without.JUST IN CASEThe secret pocket keeps your valuables secure. STAY HYDRATEDThe thigh pockets keep your hands free while maintaining visual elegance. ALL SORTEDThe back pocket on the left has two compartments for mags, hankies, lights and the like. ZIP-LOCKEDThe zippered card pocket – hidden under the waistband, ideal for business cards and spare keys. Timeless FitTailored by a top runway designer, Hosn are guaranteed to be snug on your curves, sporting a timeless look.  Do you prefer a classic unisex straight look, or a ladies' cut that embraces your curves, or a skin-tight athletic fit?  SizesSelect your style and size after the campaign, ranging from XS to XXL, W26" to W48", EU sizes 44 to 64 for gentlemen and 34 to 58 for ladies, or sizes 2 to 24 for ladies in the US. Maximum length on ready-to-wear Hosn is 34". If you are sporting legs for days, go for your very own custom tailored Hosn. Ultimate IndividualityBespoke Hosn inspire ideal confidence and are custom tailored to fit any size (for humans ;) ColorsSince all good things come in black and black goes with everything, Hosn come in black.Pantone Black Beauty to be exact. Super-Simple CareGet the most out of your Hosn by treating them nicely and taking them on lots of adventures:To maintain the non-tox water repellency treatment, avoid softener and occasionally tumble dry or iron at 70°C.Enjoy the extra time saved with your quick-dry, non-iron suit pants! The Expertise Behind the HosnWe are driven by a passion for unrestricted freedom and a love of ingenious solutions that make our daily lives better. story:
Module's product philosophy is simple - modern design with ZERO compromise.

After hundreds of hours of iterations and almost a year of development, we are excited to share our first product - super comfortable, highly functional men's dress socks -

The ONLY dress socks with 15 thoughtful and useful features.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We've reinvented the modern dress sock by engineering these awesome performance and quality features into the body of a dress sock:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Socks are a consumable item that is worn every day, so ordinary socks wear quickly. Module's higher cotton quality and focus on features that reduce wear means our socks are more durable. We also use higher quality elastic materials (i.e. Lycra) that better maintains shape and functionality. 

These features lead to a higher quality and durable sock, so you'll have to replace them less. This means less socks end up in landfills, and you get to keep more in your wallet. You also won't have to go to the store to replace your socks, so you save time AND money. 

 

 

Here's how we achieved the highest quality in the business: 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

FOOTBED SUPPORT

A super soft cushion is added to the entire footbed, giving you maximum support with each step, without the thickness of athletic socks.

 

ARCH COMPRESSION

High-quality LYCRA elastic fibers surround your feet, helping to distribute pressure more evenly and reduce foot fatigue. 

 

STAY-UP CUFFS

Our specially designed cuffs include just the right amount of stretch to keep them on your calves all day. We use high quality Lycra fabric that minimizes uncomfortable marks on your calves.

 

REINFORCED TOE

The toe area contains extra material to reduce the likelihood of annoying holes to form, helping you replace your socks less frequently.

 

FORTIFIED HEEL

We've worn enough Band-aids on our heels to add extra material here so that you have protection against discomfort and even blisters when wearing shoes.  

 

SILVER-BASED ANTI-MICROBIAL TECH

Best-in-class Silver (Ag+) technology destroys odor-causing bacteria so your feet always feel fresh. Going to the gym before or after work? Leave the normal tube socks at home and just keep your pair of Module Socks on. 

 

INVISIBLE TOE SEAMS

Each of our toe seams are stitched by hand to avoid itchiness and scratchiness. The only thing your feet will feel is pure bliss.

 

Y-STITCHED HEEL

Your heels will feel right at home in our special Y-stitched heel since they'll form a perfect cup around your heels.            

 

EXTRA-LONG STAPLE COTTON

We've directly sourced the best cotton, extra-long staple cotton, for maximum softness, breathability, and ease of maintenance. Our cotton fibers are longer than other cotton types, so our socks are softer, more absorbent, and extra durable. 

 

ULTRA-FINE KNIT

Our threads go through a proprietary process that makes them not only feel more refined, but are also more durable and fray less after each wash. 

 

200 NEEDLE HIGH-GAUGE KNIT

Our socks are knitted on specialized machines that have 200-needle "resolution" for a high definition look and feel, giving you the finest sock wearing experience.

 

OPTIMIZED COTTON BLEND

We've integrated just the right amount of synthetic fibers to increase the durability and stretch of our socks. These proportions were optimized so you can benefit from the natural features of cotton, but also enjoy maximum performance.

 

SUPER-SMOOTH INTERIOR

Thoughtful design means our socks have minimal loose threads on the inside, leading to a smoother sock that lays flat and doesn't leave marks on your feet and calves after daily wear.

 

PRECISION FIT

We've added high quality Lycra fibers in key areas of the sock so they fit each part of your foot with high precision.

 

3 SIZES - M, L, XL

Tired of socks that are too big or too small? We solve this by giving you 3 options so that your socks fit you, not the other way around.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

FOLLOW US

 

 

 

We started Module in 2018 because we wanted to reinvent common staples that have been overlooked by major brands. Our goal is to create a lasting, global brand, with sustainable and ethical business practices. In the last year, we've attended trade shows, visited and negotiated contracts with numerous manufacturers and built a design and engineering team. 

 

 

 

 

 

Our team has 5 years of global e-commerce experience prior to founding Module, and we are happy to offer both domestic and international shipping options:

 

DOMESTIC

Our socks will ship out of our New York-based warehouse via USPS and should arrive at your address within 3-8 business days, depending on location. 

 

INTERNATIONAL

We will use the appropriate global courier (FedEX, USPS, etc) to ship to your country.  You may have to pay additional import duties and other applicable taxes to customs upon receipt of the shipment. The duties and tax rates vary from country to country.

 

EXCHANGE POLICY

 

If you follow the sizing chart above, the socks should fit you perfectly. However, we want to make sure you are completely satisfied. If you would like to exchange your socks for any reason, we'll happily offer an exchange but you will have to pay for two-way shipping. Because we are offering our socks at highly discounted prices on Kickstarter, we are unable to accept returns. Please make sure your items are unworn, unwashed, and in the same condition that you received them. We will accept exchanges up to 30 days of you receiving the socks.

story:
B R A N D D


Brandd was founded in 2011 by Nathly van der Burgt and started designing custom made jewelry in Amsterdam.

Since the foundation of our jewelry label in 2011, all our jewelry was designed and custom made on order only. Take a look at our gallery Here!

Over the last 6 months we received an incredible amount of positive reactions. More people started to contact us showing interest on our designs, even on Facebook we got 1900 new followers just the last 5 weeks.

Because of that increase of interest we are more excited and motivated than ever to get our jewelry out to the world! We want to make a step further in jewelry design releasing an Official BRANDD collection, hoping to make a lot of people happy just like we do when we are designing them.






All BRANDD designs are handmade with the finest hand picked Gemstones, Pearls and Lead-Free Swarovski® Elements. 

Gemstone: (also called a fine gem, jewel, or a precious or semi-presious stone) is a piece of mineral, wich, in cut and polished form, is used to make jewelry or other adornments. However, certain rocks or organic materials that are not minerals are also used for jewelry and are therefore often considered to be gemstones as well.

Pearl: A peral is a hard object produced within teh soft tissue (specifically the mantle) of a living shelled mollusk. Just like the shell of a clam, a pearl is composed of calcium carbonate in minute crystalline from, which has been deposited in concentric layers. the ideal pearl is perfectly round and smooth, but many other shapes occur. The finest quality natural pearls have been highly valued as gemstones and objects of beauty for many centuries. because of this, "pearl"  has become a metaphor for something rare, fine, admirable and valuable.



Our Initial & Stretch Goals!

This is where we could use your help...!

With your help we could reach our initial goal of €25.000 and buy the tools and materials needed, produce molds for casting signature beads and start international marketing and branding. Making it all possible for us to release a beautiful and unique BRANDD Collection according to our ideal picture. 

(If our initial goal is not reached we will still devide the amount that we did raise, the same way.)



We found that our ideal budget of €60.000 is maybe a little to much to ask for our initial goal, so we narrowed it down to our most important needs and made that our initial goal. 

We would still like to see our dream budget being raised, so we made them our stretch goals! We really hope you can help us live our dream instead of dreaming our life....



Refferal Contest

Get Your BRANDD Perks For Free!

We started our refferal program so make sure you share your individual Indiegogo link all over the place to get a free perk!

Maybe your unique link raises €3,700.... then you will get all 4 perks! Thats a total of €4,249 worth of perks for free!!

What do i get when my unique link raises €200?

You'll get the €249 Perk for free!

What do i get when my unique link raises €600?

You'll get the €249 and €500 Perks for free!

What do i get when my unique link raises €1,500?

You'll get the €249, €500 and €1,000 Perks for free!

What do i get when my unique link raises €3,700?

You'll get the €249, €500, €1,000 and €2,500 Perks for free!


NOTE:  Make sure you are logged into your indiegogo profile to get your own unique link! 

Don't know what to do?

Please take a look HERE on how to participate in a referral contest.


Flexible Funding 

For our crowdfunding campaign we made the decision to go for a flexible funding. We are determined to make BRANDD known and let our jewelry make a lot of people happy. So even if we wouldn't reach our goal and just a part of it, we will still keep making jewelry and work hard to get there, while doing the thing we love! That means every little bit helps us a step closer getting there. 


Risks & Challenges

We have been making BRANDD Jewelry for a while now and are not planning to stop anytime soon! 

We don't see any risks and are sure we can only learn and get better from everything on our way. Ofcourse there could occur a small delay in delivering our jewelry that you designed but we will make sure we keep our backers updated and notified on any delay or progression. 

"Our Greatest Weakness Lies In Giving up. The Most Certain Way To Succeed Is Always To Try Just One More Time."

                                                                                                       - Thomas A. Edison




We Can Alway's Use Your Help!

Even if you're not able to support us financially you could still help us spreading the word to the world....!

  • Ask your friends and family to get the word out there about us.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools on top of the page to show people our campaign.
  • Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and Twitter @DutchBrandd.

Thanks for taking the time to check out our campaign! and we hope you like our Jewelry enough to help us out and make this a successful campaign! We'd hugely appreciate you sharing it with your friends.



FAQ

What does BRANDD stand for?

We at BRANDD believe that anybody shoud be proud of who they are and always believe in themselves. Be free in expressing yourselve and wear whatever you feel comfortable in. That's why we started with making jewelry that people could design the way that it would show who they are and wear it proudly! 

“No matter what you look like, or where you come from, or who you love, you can dream big dreams.”

                                                                                          - Barack Obama

How do I design my BRANDD bracelet or necklace?

At the end of the campaign we contact you to discuss all options and you will be able to choose out of a wide collection of cord and gemstones.

When do I receive my Perk?

The estimated delivery time that is shown with the perk is where we strive to deliver your Perk. We contact you if this gets delayed or even when it will be ahead of time.

Why do I have to be 21 or older for Perks €5.000 & €7.500?

With these 2 Perks you receive a luxury box with some exclusive products in there like cigars and champagne. In some countries you have to be 21 or above.

Why do I have to be 18 or older for Perk €10.000 and not 21?

With this Perk we are flying you out to Amsterdam and giving you a luxury weekend. Even though you may or may not take a drink we want to be safe. The minimum age in Holland is 18. (A valid passport is required!)

Will you be updating this campaign?

Yes... We would love to keep you updated on any changes and our experience through this. Even after the campaign we will let the people know how things are going on our journey!


Get In Touch

Please ensure you have read the FAQ before contacting us!

If you have any questions left or want to know more details about our jewelry, perks or do you know another way to help us? Please feel free to contact us at anytime! 

Backers: info@dutchbrandd.com

Business Enquiries: business@dutchbrandd.com

Press: press@dutchbrandd.com


Thank You! / ¡Gracias! / Bedankt! / Merci! / Grazie! / Obrigado! / 谢谢! 

*All brand names, product names, or trademarks belong to their respective holders.

We Can Alway's Use Your Help! Even if you're not able to support us financially you could still help us spreading the word to the world....!

Ask your friends and family to get the word out there about us.
Use the Indiegogo share tools on top of the page to show people our campaign.
Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and Twitter @DutchBrandd.
Thanks for taking the time to check out our campaign! and we hope you like our Jewelry enough to help us out and make this a successful campaign! We'd hugely appreciate you sharing it with your friends.FAQ
What does BRANDD stand for?
We at BRANDD believe that anybody shoud be proud of who they are and always believe in themselves. Be free in expressing yourselve and wear whatever you feel comfortable in. That's why we started with making jewelry that people could design the way that it would show who they are and wear it proudly! 
“No matter what you look like, or where you come from, or who you love, you can dream big dreams.”
                                                                                          - Barack Obama
How do I design my BRANDD bracelet or necklace?
At the end of the campaign we contact you to discuss all options and you will be able to choose out of a wide collection of cord and gemstones.
When do I receive my Perk?
The estimated delivery time that is shown with the perk is where we strive to deliver your Perk. We contact you if this gets delayed or even when it will be ahead of time.
Why do I have to be 21 or older for Perks €5.000 & €7.500?
With these 2 Perks you receive a luxury box with some exclusive products in there like cigars and champagne. In some countries you have to be 21 or above.
Why do I have to be 18 or older for Perk €10.000 and not 21?
With this Perk we are flying you out to Amsterdam and giving you a luxury weekend. Even though you may or may not take a drink we want to be safe. The minimum age in Holland is 18. (A valid passport is required!)
Will you be updating this campaign?
Yes... We would love to keep you updated on any changes and our experience through this. Even after the campaign we will let the people know how things are going on our journey!



Get In Touch
Please ensure you have read the FAQ before contacting us!If you have any questions left or want to know more details about our jewelry, perks or do you know another way to help us? Please feel free to contact us at anytime! 
Backers: info@dutchbrandd.com
Business Enquiries: business@dutchbrandd.com
Press: press@dutchbrandd.com





Thank You! / ¡Gracias! / Bedankt! / Merci! / Grazie! / Obrigado! / 谢谢! 


*All brand names, product names, or trademarks belong to their respective holders.

story:
Garabattos is a design and stamping t-shirt project produced by a handcraft process. We work with lot of effort and love. We are passionate for designing and we love tees, each design created is done for people to enjoy and share with others, to laugh with the humor implied or even feel identified with them.

We are a small workshop of artisans who have encouraged ourselves to dive into the entrepreneurship world. This challenge is faced with eagerness though also aware of  the obstacles we may encounter. Now is the moment to reach out for strength in order to move on to the next stage, you can be part of this force. We need your help!

In our personal life, we are linked one way or another with social cooperation. The call for sharing with others our time, our efforts and even our possessions, is why we want this business to be also a means of collaboration with society, reaching for the common wellbeing. With this in mind, we give birth to the Solidarity T-Shirt.

This parallel, yet directly linked project, the Solidarity T-Shirt, consists in choosing and producing one design per month, whose entire 100% benefits during the same period will be used to support a social cause. Our supporters can decide the social service chosen to receive this aid. Garabattos will present a group of candidates that may be granted with the aid, and our supporters will be able to vote for the final beneficiary.

We need to leave the garage start-up project behind. Actually due to our budget limitations, we use homemade machinery, and our stamping corner is our home itself.

It is time to move forward, we need professional silk-screening machinery, we don't want automatic equipment, we want to keep its craftsmanship, but we need to optimize working time.

Our wish is to start as soon as possible with the social cooperation project, the Solidarity T-Shirt. Therefore we need to have the adequate tools and facilities in order to fulfill the demands and by these means be able to help others.

For these reasons we are here in Indiegogo, using this platform as a stand for calling your attention and asking for your help in order to continue this road we have so gladly taken. Of course your help has pleasant rewards.

Among the offered rewards, we could not leave behind our designs. Take a look at our current catalogue for this campaign, it may be updated with the new designs we work on.

We have women's tees for yours rewards, you can choose them. If you want to combine designs, sizes and type of shirt... you can do it.

We will keep moving along, Garabattos is a project filled with enthusiasm, and a lot of courage, so we will continue the hard work.

Any help given will be welcomed and surely with the funds raised with this campaign, we will be able to buy at least part of the tools and materials we require.

And for sure, we will fulfill the rewards offered during the campaign.

If you are not able to collaborate monetarily, this does not mean you can't help:
Help us by sharing this campaign with all your friends.
In a nearby future you can have the chance to cooperate with our social projects via the Solidarity T-Shirt. We hope to launch it on September.

Thanks for your time dedicated to read our campaign, support us and don’t forget to share it!
